og:title: The 5-Ingredient Dinner I Make on Repeat—It Only Takes 20 Minutes
og:description: All you need is five ingredients and 20 minutes to make these Buffalo chicken quesadillas. This easy recipe is a fun spin on the party food classic.
Title: The 5-Ingredient Dinner I Make on Repeat—It Only Takes 20 Minutes
Author: Sara Bir
Description:
Buffalo Chicken Quesadilla Recipe (5 Ingredients)
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 20 mins; Servings: 4 servings; Yield: 4 quesadillas
Ingredients: 2 cups shredded rotisserie chicken, 2/3 cup sour cream, plus more for serving , 1/3 cup Buffalo-style hot sauce (such as Frank’s RedHot Buffalo Wings), 6 ounces Monterey Jack Cheese, shredded (about 1 1/2 cups), 4 (8-inch) flour tortillas, 2 tablespoons olive oil, divided
Reviews: [{'name': 'Twila', 'review': 'It sounds great. I would use shreded pork as my husband does not like chicken! I know, but l will keep him he has other qualities LOL'}]

og:title: Peeling Hard Boiled Eggs Is a Pain—Your Instant Pot Can Help
og:description: The Instant Pot is the secret to easy peel hard boiled eggs! They're ready in 15 minutes and make perfect eggs every time.
Title: How to Make Instant Pot Easy-Peel Hard Boiled Eggs
Author: Emma Christensen
Description:
How to Make Instant Pot Hard Boiled Eggs
Cook Time: 4 mins; Pressurizing and natural release: 15 mins; Total Time: 19 mins; Serving: 1
to 12 servings
Ingredients: Large eggs, cold from the fridge—at least 1 egg or as many as will fit in a single layer in your pressure cooker
Reviews: [{'name': 'Katharine in Brussels', 'review': 'Thanks for this. Currently cooking above lunchtime whole wheat macaroni in the IP, to get a jump on dinner with hard boiled egg on a cold Korean noodle salad. Cheers'}, {'name': 'Nancy', 'review': 'What do they mean by natural release? I did the cook pressure for 5 minutes then when it beeped. I flipped the release and let sit for 5 more minutes ? Will this be wrong and I will have bad eggs? For my potatoes salad ?'}, {'name': 'Joni Sensel', 'review': 'Warning: this 5-5-5 approach does NOT work on an IP "steam" setting; you might want to be more specific about that (or just not mention it above, which I interpreted as optional if your IP had that setting). I tried it and the eggs were nearly raw. You MUST use the high pressure-cook method.'}, {'name': 'Podunk ', 'review': "Actually, the 5-5-5 does not include heating up time. It's 5 minutes pressure cooking, 5 minutes natural release, 5 minutes in an ice water bath."}, {'name': 'John Emm', 'review': "I am a widower of 15 years and have become pretty capable when it comes to preparing my own meals. My one ongoing irritation is my inability to get into the secret of eggs ... hard boiled eggs in particular. I have tried everything at one time or another, and at present my InstaPot is the method of choice. I use the manual mode, heat on high, 5 minutes of natural release and 2 minutes of up to temp. I know, you say more time under pressure, but this works well for me. \n\nMy question has to do with the Julia Childs recommended needle prick hole in the big end. The problem for me is that I don't make eggs every day. I make a dozen at a time every 7 or 10 days. When I have the pinhole in the egg, it seems that water is drawn in during the cool down, and this immediately starts the egg white on its way to mushy, yucky, almost decomposing and very, very unfriendly and unappetising. I always keep hard boiled eggs in the fridge and that almost seems to make things worse. What as I doing wrong?"}]

og:title: Try Making Kai Jeow, the Thai Omelet Infused with Umami Flavor
og:description: Kai jeow is a classic Thai omelet with the perfect balance of salty-sweet-hot flavors. Serve it simply, with rice and raw vegetables, for a quick and satisfying meal.
Title: Kai Jeow (Thai Omelet)
Author: Lany Phlong
Description:
Kai Jeow (Thai Omelet) Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 5 mins; Total Time: 10 mins; Serving: 1 serving; Yield: 1 omelet
Ingredients: 3 large eggs, 2 teaspoons fish sauce (see recipe note), 1/4 teaspoon brown sugar, 1 scallion, minced , 1/2 Thai chili to start, minced (optional, can add more if desired), 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, 2 to 3 tablespoons vegetable oil  , 1 cup cooked jasmine rice, 4 slices cucumber, Slices of romaine lettuce, Sriracha (optional)
Reviews: [{'name': 'Sandy ', 'review': 'Hi, if I don’t have Thai chilis, what else can I use?'}, {'name': 'Rana Salem', 'review': 'Followed exactly and it came out so delicious! Thank you so much for a healthy, eclectic, flavorful meal!!'}, {'name': 'Jo', 'review': 'I love this, had it most days for breakfast in Thailand. I am thrilled that someone posted a recipe for others to discover. The restaurants in NYC never have it on the menu!'}, {'name': 'Mski2', 'review': "Very interesting, wouldn't make it every day but delicious for a change once in a while.\nGlad I read the note about cutting back fish sauce if not eating with veggies, 1 ts perfect"}, {'name': 'Lazar', 'review': 'Fish Sauce: is oyster sauce a valid replacement?'}]

og:title: For The Best Burger, Cook It On Your Stovetop
og:description: No grill, no problemo! Make an incredible burger indoors on the stove.
Title: How To Make a Burger on the Stove
Author: Nick Evans
Description:
How to Make a Burger on the Stove
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 15 mins; Servings: 3 servings; Yield: 3 burgers
Ingredients: 1 tablespoon kosher salt, 1 tablespoon black pepper, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/4 cup mayonnaise, 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard, 1 tablespoon ketchup, 1 pound ground chuck (90:10), 3 potato or brioche buns, 6 slices American cheese, Nonstick spray, Green lettuce leaves, Thinly sliced red onion, Thinly sliced fresh tomato
Reviews: [{'name': 'Walt D in LV', 'review': 'Looks great! I can't wait. I am really curious why so many places are now choosing the purple "red onions" versus white or yellow? Myself, I feel the flavor is too strong. I love onions, but red onions are on another level and not in a good way. (My opinion, and I respect those who feel differently)'}, {'name': 'Cathy Tarr', 'review': 'The nutrition information is for one burger? 4115 calories for one burger?'}, {'name': 'Munni P.', 'review': "Wow, this was SOO good! I've made skillet burgers before, but truly the seasoning on this one was just amazing! I loved how peppery it was, and the recipe didn't use up all the spice mix, I plan to make this again soon. The burger sauce wasn't too intense nor did it retract from the taste of the burger, which I really appreciated."}]

og:title: Make Simple Chicken Congee for an Affordable, Comforting Meal at Home
og:description: Congee, a Chinese rice porridge also known as jook, is a simple and flavorful dish.
Title: Chicken Congee (Jook)
Author: Frank Tiu
Description:
Chicken Congee (Jook) Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 100 mins; Total Time: 115 mins; Servings: 5
to 6 servings; Yield: 8 cups
Ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breasts, very thinly sliced, 2 tablespoons finely minced ginger, 3 green onions, whites chopped and greens thinly sliced lengthwise, divided, 2 teaspoons chicken bouillon, 1 teaspoon ground white pepper, 1 cup jasmine rice, 10 cups low-sodium chicken stock, Salt, to taste, 1 (2-inch) piece ginger, peeled and sliced into thin matchsticks, to garnish
Reviews: [{'name': 'Lindi ', 'review': 'This was excellent. I froze the rice the night before, but did not presoak it. This will be even better this winter to keep on the woodstove.'}, {'name': 'Laurel R', 'review': "This recipe is so easy and dependable. I've made it a couple of times on cold nights, the second time I added soaked, sliced dried porcini mushrooms and used the soaking water as part of the broth. Delicious! So warming and comforting."}]

og:title: For a Perfectly Cooked Sweet Potato, Turn to the Microwave
og:description: When you’re short on time and don’t want to turn on the oven, turn to the microwave. Here’s how to make a perfectly cooked, fluffy microwave sweet potato every time.
Title: Microwave Sweet Potato
Author: Laurel Randolph
Description:
Microwave Sweet Potato Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 5 mins; Total Time: 10 mins; Serving: 1 serving
Ingredients: 1 medium sweet potato, about 10 ounces, 1/2 teaspoon olive or canola oil, optional, 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, optional
Reviews: [{'name': 'Annie R', 'review': 'Gets the job done fast with no dried-out spots. I highly recommend crisping the skin up in an air fryer if you’re going to eat this straight up. But super easy if you want a pretty good sweet potato cooked fast!'}]

og:title: Tomato Egg Is the 20-Minute Meal You’ll Make Again and Again
og:description: With just a few affordable ingredients, Chinese tomato egg is a weeknight win. You’ll have a flavorful easy-to-make main dish in just minutes. Serve with rice.
Title: Chinese Tomato Egg Stir Fry
Author: Frank Tiu
Description:
Chinese Tomato Egg Stir Fry Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 13 mins; Total Time: 18 mins; Servings: 2
to 3
Ingredients: 1 pound plum tomatoes (4 to 5), 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, 5 large eggs, beaten, 1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil, 2 teaspoons chicken bouillon powder, 2 teaspoons sugar, 1/2 teaspoon ground white pepper, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1 green onion, trimmed and sliced on a bias, to garnish, 2 cups steamed jasmine rice, for serving, optional
Reviews: [{'name': 'Gilles van den Boom', 'review': 'Tastes good. Liked the Chinese touch of sugar with tomato.'}, {'name': 'Julie ', 'review': 'This looks delicious and sounds amazing! Love the addition of a bit of sugar!'}, {'name': 'Torrey Peacock', 'review': 'This was surprisingly good. I used the chicken broth and cornstarch, and served with jasmine rice and a green salad. Delicious use for some fresh tomatoes from the garden.'}, {'name': 'Laurel R', 'review': 'So easy, so delicious! A great last minute meal that is more than the sum of its parts. I served with steamed broccolini and chili crisp for topping.'}]

og:title: Make Quick, Fluffy Baked Potatoes in the Microwave
og:description: A microwave baked potato recipe takes a fraction of the time and is just as delicious as oven baked potatoes. Here's how to make them perfectly every time.
Title: Microwave Baked Potato
Author: Nick Evans
Description:
Microwave Baked Potato Recipe
Prep Time: 3 mins; Cook Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 13 mins; Serving: 1 serving; Yield: 1 potato
Ingredients: 1 large (10 to 12-ounce) russet potato, 1 teaspoon olive oil, optional, Pinch of kosher salt, optional, 1 tablespoon butter, 1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese, 1 tablespoon sour cream, 1 teaspoon minced chives, Salt and pepper, to taste
Reviews: [{'name': 'Veronica', 'review': '5/10/24 Guess I was ahead of my time! Ten years ago if I was in a hurry to get dinner on the table after staying late at work, I would pop my Russet potatoes, usually 4 into my microwave, piercing skins for about 10 or more min. Then put the potatoes in 450 0ven to finish cooking, I checked with knife to determine when done. Now I read your same idea. I will now add one more step- grease skin with oil like you do ! This is a really great way to reduce time for cooking baked potatoes!! Works every time !Thanks!'}, {'name': 'John F. Bramfeld', 'review': 'The microwave is in constant use in our kitchen. The recipe looks good. Consider oiling the potato before microwaving.\n\nI have been microwaving since 1978. I used to pierce the potato to avoid explosions. Now I just skip that step, which also avoids explosions.'}, {'name': 'Carol starke', 'review': 'This is the best article ever done on baking potatoes. Thanks soooo much for the depth of information in your article! I have a new whoop-te-do GE microwave that does not give me any other choice for baking time of potatoes other than for one, two, three, or four potatoes! My old Panasonic’s setting choice was for weight as it should be. I would exchange this GE for my old one in a heartbeat. Aargh! Thanks again.'}, {'name': 'Laurel R', 'review': "My favorite way to make a baked potato! Works like a charm. So much faster and fluffier. I always add the oil and stick it in the hot oven to crisp for a few minutes. No one knows it's not baked from start to finish!"}, {'name': 'Dee', 'review': "I use a potato baking bag you make with cotton/cotton batting and you just take 2 pieces of fabric and put it with the batting and sew like making a bag. You flip the bag so the batting is in the middle and then just stitch around the bag and fold in the open end Oh you fold it almost in half so you have a little lip. I don't fork the potato just wash and dry, roll it in a paper towel and place it in the bag and microwave for about 8 minutes for 2 potatoes and it is done. I don't buy big potatoes and these are really great."}]

og:title: The 1-Minute Tomato Sandwich I’m Having All Summer Long
og:description: Does the perfect tomato sandwich exist? Try this version with Boursin—a go-to for recipe developer Grace Elkus—and find out for yourself.
Title: The 1-Minute Tomato Sandwich I’m Having All Summer Long
Author: Grace Elkus
Description: Tomato and Boursin Sandwich Recipe

og:title: This 3-Ingredient Trader Joe's Cucumber Sandwich Is My New Favorite Summer Lunch
og:description: It takes just 5 minutes to make and it calls for one of my new favorite Trader Joe's finds. It's so good, my cucumber sandwich consumption is through the roof!
Title: This 3-Ingredient Trader Joe's Cucumber Sandwich Is My Favorite Summer Lunch
Author: Laurel Randolph
Description: 3-Ingredient Cucumber Sandwich Recipe
Ingredients: 1 Persian cucumber, 2 to 3 tablespoons TJ's Red Pepper, Garlic, and Parmesan Cream Cheese Spread, 2 slices sandwich bread

og:title: Everyone Will Love These Homemade Meatball Subs
og:description: Meatball sub sandwiches are pure comfort food. Our recipe includes easy homemade meatballs combined with your favorite store-bought or homemade sauce and provolone on a hoagie roll.
Title: Meatball Sub
Author: Nick Evans
Description:
Meatball Sub Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 55 mins; Total Time: 65 mins; Servings: 4 servings; Yield: 4 sub sandwiches
Ingredients: 1/3 cup whole milk, warmed, 1 slice white bread, crumbled, 1 pound ground beef (80 to 85% lean), 1/4 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese, 1 large egg, 1/2 tablespoon fresh chopped parsley, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano, 1 cup Italian breadcrumbs, for coating, 1/3 cup olive oil, for searing, 24 ounces good quality marinara sauce, 4 large hoagie rolls, 6 to 8 inches long, 1 tablespoon butter or olive oil, 8 slices provolone cheese, Fresh basil, for garnish, Banana peppers, for garnish (optional)

og:title: Grilled Chicken Caprese Sandwiches are the Perfect Summer Lunch
og:description: This Italian-inspired grilled chicken Caprese sandwich takes everything you love about a classic Caprese salad and turns it into a filling, flavorful meal. The combination of mozzarella, tomatoes, juicy grilled chicken, and flavorful pesto is irresistible.
Title: Grilled Chicken Caprese Sandwich
Author: Hannah Zimmerman
Description:
Grilled Chicken Caprese Sandwich Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 6 mins; Marinate Time:: 30 mins; Total Time: 51 mins; Servings: 4 servings; Yield: 4 sandwiches
Ingredients: 2 large boneless, skinless chicken breasts (about 1 1/2 pounds total), 2 tablespoons olive oil, 2 teaspoons Italian seasoning, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, 4 ciabatta rolls, 1/4 cup pesto, store-bought or homemade, 1 (8-ounce) ball of mozzarella, sliced, 2 (8-ounce) beefsteak tomatoes, sliced, 20 to 24 leaf basil leaves, 2 tablespoons balsamic glaze, optional
Reviews: [{'name': 'Laurel R', 'review': 'Such a delicious sandwich! Summery and flavorful and easy to make. I used heirloom tomatoes and added a few leaves of spinach.'}]

og:title: Transport Yourself to New Orleans With an Oyster Po’ Boy
og:description: A classic oyster po' boy recipe that will transport you to New Orleans.
Title: Oyster Po’ Boy
Author: Joy Monnerjahn
Description:
Oyster Po’ Boy Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 20 mins; Total Time: 35 mins; Servings: 4
to 5 servings
Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups mayonnaise, 1/3 cup heavy cream, 1/4 cup Creole mustard, 3 tablespoons thinly sliced green onions, 1 tablespoon paprika, 2 teaspoons Cajun seasoning, such as Slap Ya Mama, 2 teaspoons horseradish, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, 1 teaspoon Louisiana hot sauce, 1 teaspoon sweet pickle relish, 1 cup self-rising cornmeal mix, such as White Lily, 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 tablespoon Cajun seasoning, such as Slap Ya Mama, 1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt, or to taste (adjust based on the saltiness of your oysters and Cajun seasoning), 1 1/2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper, 2 to 3 quarts canola or vegetable oil, for frying, 1/2 gallon (about 40) freshly shucked oysters, in liquid, French bread, Shredded lettuce, Dill pickles, Sliced tomatoes, Sliced white onions
Reviews: [{'name': 'Karishma P', 'review': 'The oysters were unbelievably crispy and well-flavored! They remained crispy even an hour after frying. Everyone loved the balance of flavors in the sandwich, with the combination of the salty, crispy oysters, the tangy pickles, the creamy remoulade, and the lettuce and tomatoes.'}]

og:title: The 1-Minute Cucumber Sandwich I'm Eating All Summer Long
og:description: All you need for the perfect summer sandwich is three ingredients and about one minute of time. I eat this easy cucumber sandwich all season long.
Title: 1-Minute Cucumber Sandwich
Author: Laurel Randolph
Description: 1-Minute Cucumber Sandwich Recipe
Ingredients: 1 Persian cucumber or a roughly 4-inch section cut from a hothouse cucumber, 2 slices bread, preferably whole wheat, 2 to 3 tablespoons vegetable or chive cream cheese, or to taste, Salt and freshly ground pepper, optional

og:title: How To Make the Best Tomato Sandwich, According to a Tomato Farmer
og:description: I talked to a tomato farmer, author, and educator about the absolute best way to make a tomato sandwich. His recommendation might surprise you.
Title: The Best Tomato Sandwich
Author: Rachel Levin
Description: The Best Tomato Sandwich Recipe

og:title: The Best Way To Upgrade Your Tomato Sandwich
og:description: This tomato sandwich recipe gets a big flavor boost from a packet of Hidden Valley Ranch seasoning.
Title: The Best Way To Upgrade Your Tomato Sandwich
Author: Nathan Hutsenpiller
Description: The Best Way To Upgrade Your Tomato Sandwich
Ingredients: 1 (8-ounce) block cream cheese at room temperature, 1/2 cup mayonnaise, 1 (1-ounce) packet Hidden Valley Ranch seasoning, 2 slices white bread, 1 ripe tomato, sliced, 1 ripe avocado, sliced (optional)

og:title: The Tomato Sandwich I've Been Making Since College
og:description: During my college days, I fell in love with a tomato sandwich popular on campus called the Marv ‘n’ Joe. Named after two professors, I now make it at home every single summer.
Title: The Tomato Sandwich I've Been Making Since College
Author: Claudia Cash
Description: The Tomato Sandwich I've Been Making Since College
Ingredients: 1 large slice sourdough bread, cut in half, or 2 slices of smaller bread, 2 tablespoons garlic butter, divided, see tip below, 2 large slices heirloom tomato, 1 teaspoon olive oil, divided, 1 teaspoon balsamic vinegar, divided, 2 slices provolone cheese, Shaved Parmesan cheese, to taste

og:title: My Favorite Tomato Sandwich Takes 3 Minutes To Make
og:description: Every summer, I can’t get enough of my home-grown tomatoes. My favorite thing to do with them is make this super easy, 3-minute tomato sandwich.
Title: My Favorite Tomato Sandwich Takes 3 Minutes To Make
Author: Emma Christensen
Description: My Favorite Tomato Sandwich Takes 3 Minutes To Make
Ingredients: 2 slices sandwich bread (I like sourdough), 2 slices provolone or other favorite cheese, or enough to cover your sandwich, Handful of fresh basil, 1/2 ripe avocado, 1 big tomato, sliced, or enough to cover your sandwich, Sprinkle of salt, preferably something flaky like Maldon

og:title: The 1-Ingredient Upgrade for the Tastiest Tortilla Soup Ever
og:description: Over a decade ago, Simply Recipes' founder Elise Bauer shared her easy trick for making the most flavorful tortilla soup. Try it once and you won't make it any other way.
Title: The 1-Ingredient Upgrade for the Tastiest Tortilla Soup Ever
Author: Myo Quinn
Description: The 1-Ingredient Upgrade for the Tastiest Tortilla Soup Ever

og:title: The 20-Minute Dinner I Make When I’m Too Tired to Cook
og:description: Store-bought mirepoix and jarred minced garlic make this pantry-friendly tomato orzo soup recipe ready in just 20 minutes. Bulked up with hearty chickpeas and creamy orzo pasta, it will keep you going on cold winter days!
Title: The 20-Minute Dinner I Make When I’m Too Tired to Cook
Author: Alexandra Shytsman
Description: Tomato Orzo Soup Recipe (20 Minutes)
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, 3 cups fresh or frozen mirepoix (about 1 pound), 1/4 teaspoon salt, plus more to taste, 1 tablespoon jarred minced garlic, or 3 garlic cloves, minced, 1 teaspoon dried oregano, 1 teaspoon smoked paprika, Freshly ground black pepper, to taste, 1 quart (32 ounces), vegetable broth, 1 (15-ounce) can chickpeas, drained and rinsed, 1 (15-ounce) can tomato sauce, 1/2 cup orzo pasta, Minced fresh parsley, for serving, optional

og:title: This 15-Minute Sloppy Joes Has a Smart Shortcut
og:description: Liven up the same old sloppy Joe with spicy, extra-savory chorizo. This dinner is ready in 15 minutes and is extra fun with avocado slices and crunchy corn chips.
Title: This 15-Minute Sloppy Joes Has a Smart Shortcut
Author: Sara Bir
Description:
Chorizo Sloppy Joes Recipe (15 Minutes)
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 20 mins; Servings: 4 servings; Yield: 3 cups chorizo mixture
Ingredients: 1 1/4 pounds  bulk fresh Mexican chorizo, 1 (8-ounce) package red chile enchilada sauce (preferably Frontera Red Chile Enchilada Sauce with Roasted Tomato and Garlic), 1/2 cup water, 4 sesame seed hamburger buns, split and toasted, 1 large avocado, thinly sliced, 3/4 cup corn chips (such as Fritos), roughly crushed if needed

og:title: The 4-Ingredient Chicken Salad I Make At Least Once a Week
og:description: This light and easy California chicken salad requires just four ingredients and 10 minutes to make. Toss rotisserie chicken with store-bought dressing, red onion, and avocado for a satisfying lunch.
Title: California Chicken Salad
Author: Sara Haas, RDN, LDN
Description:
California Chicken Salad Recipe (4 Ingredients, 10 Minutes)
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 20 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 1/4 cup thinly sliced red onion, 2 cups chopped rotisserie chicken (from 1 rotisserie chicken), 1/2 cup creamy Vidalia onion salad dressing (or creamy Italian dressing), divided, 1 large avocado
Reviews: [{'name': 'Eileen Santos', 'review': 'I prefer eating avocado as dessert by adding sugar and milk.....never tried on meals or bread....others use avocado in cakes,ice cream,milkshake sold commercially here in our local area-lhin from Markna.Phils'}, {'name': 'Laurel L', 'review': 'So quick and easy but delicious. I love the avocado since it adds extra creaminess without the mayo. I ate mine on whole grain bread with sprouts.'}]

og:title: This Easy Greek Salad Dressing Is Elite
og:description: You’ll never have another boring salad again! Make this zippy and bright Greek salad dressing using pantry ingredients you probably already have.
Title: Greek Salad Dressing
Author: Laurel Randolph
Description:
Fresh & Simple Greek Salad Dressing Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Total Time: 5 mins; Servings: 6 servings; Yield: 1 scant cup
Ingredients: 2 cloves garlic, finely minced or grated, 1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil, 3 tablespoons red wine vinegar, 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, 1 teaspoon dried oregano, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more to taste, 1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes, 1/2 teaspoon Dijon mustard, 1 teaspoon honey, optional
Reviews: [{'name': 'Jack Jones', 'review': 'Great flavor, only dressing I use now for all salads. Definitely more than the sum of its parts. Perfect blend, but sometimes I add a teaspoon of minced shallots if on hand.'}, {'name': 'Robin St Germain', 'review': 'Love this dressing!'}, {'name': 'Coco', 'review': 'This dressing was a nice change of pace from the balsamic vinaigrette we usually make in my house! Keeping it in rotation for sure. I added a little more salt and honey.'}]

og:title: Make This Super-Simple Salad in About 5 Minutes!
og:description: This super-simple salad is the perfect way to get greens on the table fast—and to use up any extra herbs you have lying around the house.
Title: Green Salad with Fresh Herbs and Red Wine Vinaigrette
Author: Georgia Freedman
Description:
Green Salad with Fresh Herbs and Red Wine Vinaigrette Recipe
Prep Time: 8 mins; Total Time: 8 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 1 large head butter lettuce (about 9 inches wide at crown), 1/2 cup lightly packed flat-leaf parsley leaves, roughly chopped, 1/4 bunch chives (about 35 thin chives), cut crosswise into 1/2-inch pieces, 8 large mint leaves, very thinly sliced, 1 1/2 tablespoons olive oil, 2 teaspoons red wine vinegar, 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard, 1 teaspoon water, 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
Reviews: [{'name': 'Haley', 'review': 'I loved this vinaigrette and the fresh herbs in the salad. I will definitely be adding this to my rotation!'}, {'name': 'Kenna Crook', 'review': 'Amazing recipe.'}]

og:title: The Secret to a Better Grilled Cheese Sandwich
og:description: Say no to burnt bread and unmelted cheese. This is my easy trick for making better grilled cheese sandwiches.
Title: For the Best Grilled Cheese, Start in the Microwave
Author: Munni Pramanik
Description: The One Trick for Better Grilled Cheese Sandwiches

og:title: Try This Sabich Recipe, the Classic Israeli Street Food Sandwich
og:description: This classic vegetarian sandwich with unique layers of crispy fried eggplant, nutty tahini, boiled eggs, and refreshing Israeli salad.
Title: Homemade Sabich
Author: Micah Siva, RD
Description:
Homemade Sabich Recipe (Israeli Street Food Sandwich)
Prep Time: 30 mins; Cook Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 45 mins; Servings: 4 servings; Yield: 4 sandwiches
Ingredients: Vegetable oil, for frying, 1 medium Globe eggplant or 2 medium Italian eggplants, cut into 1/2-inch rounds, Sea salt, for the fried eggplants, 1 plum tomato, diced, 1/2 English cucumber, diced, 2 tablespoons chopped flat leaf parsley, 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, 1/4 teaspoon sea salt, 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 1/4 cup tahini, 1 clove garlic, minced, 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, 1/4 teaspoon sea salt, Pinch of ground cumin, Pinch of freshly ground black pepper , 3 tablespoons water, plus more as needed, 4 (8-inch) pita, 1/4 cup store-bought or homemade hummus, 4 medium eggs, hard-boiled and peeled, 1/4 cup store-bought or homemade sliced pickles, Amba sauce, for serving (optional; see recipe note)

og:title: These Cheesy Pull-Apart Sliders Start with King's Hawaiian Rolls
og:description: These pull-apart rolls with meat sauce and Parm sliders are the ultimate crowdpleaser.
Title: Hawaiian Roll Sliders with Meat Sauce and Parm
Author: Laura Manzano
Description:
Hawaiian Roll Sliders with Meat Sauce and Parm Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 30 mins; Total Time: 40 mins; Servings: 6
to 8 servings
Ingredients: Nonstick cooking spray, 5 cloves garlic, grated , 1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, 2 1/2 teaspoons garlic powder, divided , 2 teaspoons kosher salt, plus more for garlic butter, 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more for garlic butter, 1 (12-count) package King's Hawaiian sweet rolls , 1 medium onion, diced (about 1 1/2 cups), 1 1/2 pounds ground beef (85% lean), 2 tablespoons Italian seasoning, 1 (6-ounce) can tomato paste, 1 cup water, 8 ounces sliced low-moisture mozzarella cheese (about 8 slices)
Reviews: [{'name': 'Greg', 'review': 'Help a novice, will the recipe change by leaving out the beef, for a vegetarian meal?'}]

og:title: My Family's "Hot Sammies" Are Always a Hit
og:description: A Southern classic, funeral sandwiches are for so much more than funerals. The warm and gooey ham and cheese sandwiches are a family favorite no matter when and where you serve them.
Title: Funeral Sandwiches
Author: Laurel Randolph
Description:
Funeral Sandwiches Recipe (30 Minutes)
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 30 mins; Servings: 12 servings; Yield: 24 sandwiches
Ingredients: 1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, softened, 1/2 small yellow onion, finely chopped (1/4 cup) or 2 tablespoons dried minced onion, 1 tablespoon poppy seeds, optional, 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard, 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, 2 (12-ounce) packages Hawaiian sweet rolls, 1 pound thinly sliced deli ham, 1 (6-ounce) package Swiss cheese slices
Reviews: [{'name': 'Jackie Iannarelli', 'review': 'These look really good! I'll be serving these at my next pot luck later this month'}, {'name': 'Cathy', 'review': 'I was always taught to spread both sides of the bread before assembling, rather than putting half of the butter mixture on top of the rolls.'}, {'name': 'DDean', 'review': 'Was there really a need to rename these? They have been known as ham and cheese sliders for years!'}, {'name': 'gaeilgesinger1 .', 'review': 'would have to be a different meat other than pork. I should think a thinly sliced roast beef, pastrami, or turkey ham would substitute nicely.'}, {'name': 'Jasmine S', 'review': 'A delicious, easily upgraded ham sandwich.'}]

og:title: You've Never Had a Club Sandwich Quite Like This
og:description: What makes this club sandwich the ultimate? Oven roasted turkey, crispy bacon, fresh veggies, and a homemade garlic aioli! This club sandwich takes a little time to build, but it’s worth every step.
Title: Ultimate Club Sandwich
Author: Nick Evans
Description:
Ultimate Club Sandwich Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 80 mins; Total Time: 100 mins; Servings: 6 sandwiches
Ingredients: 1 (2 to 3) pound turkey breast,  bone-in and skin-on, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 12 slices bacon, 1 loaf (18 slices) white sandwich bread, 6 slices sharp cheddar cheese, 3 avocados, pitted and sliced, 2 tomatoes, 1 head romaine lettuce, 1 head garlic, 1 cup mayonnaise, Juice from 1/2 lemon, Pinch salt
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Mary', 'review': 'Delicioco'}, {'name': 'Finny', 'review': "Why not call it garlic mayo? 

Aioli is what the name implies an emulsion of oil and garlic. That's it.

Garlic aioli would mean garlic garlic oil. Just like chai tea means tea tea.

No need for trendy 'false' descriptions"}]

og:title: Turkey Grilled Cheese Sandwich with Pickled Onions
og:description: Two slices of light rye bread, sauteed in butter, with slices of jack cheese, leftover turkey, arugula and pickled onions.
Title: Turkey Grilled Cheese Sandwich With Pickled Onions
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Turkey Grilled Cheese Sandwich with Pickled Onions Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 15 mins; Serving: 1 serving; Yield: 1 sandwich
Ingredients: 2 slices rye bread, 2-3 tablespoons butter, 4 slices leftover turkey, 3 slices Monterey Jack cheese, 2-3 pieces arugula (optional), A handful of sweet pickled onions or another sweet pickle
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Gary', 'review': 'Turkey Melt.'}, {'name': 'Judy', 'review': '

I made a Turkey Wrap instead of a sandwich, with butter-sauteed leftover roast turkey meat, with lettuce and cherry tomatoes and drizzled with a mayo-mint sauce mix! Great way to use up the turkey and its accompanying sauce with a light twist. It was all then wrapped up in a flour tortilla and chowed down while watching holiday movies =D

'}, {'name': 'Tempy', 'review': "

We spent thanksgiving here down at my roomate's mom's house. Being southern to the bone, no matter how many years she lived in Cali, we had plenty of cornbread and collard greens left over. She makes a very spicy and tender rendition of the greens. For the last of the left-overs we had turkey sandwiches with collard greens, swiss cheese, turkey meat and a little bit of left over gravy on some think texas toast bread. It was great!

"}, {'name': 'Maggie', 'review': "

I usually put the turkey, or another type of meat such as: eye of round roast, ham, pepperoni, etc., on a tortilla with red onion slices, shredded low - fat Cheddar, low - fat Mozzarella and Monterey jack cheeses and a piece of whatever lettuce I have handy. Then wrap it all up and heat it on a non - stick grill over medium heat until all sides are browned and the cheeses are melted. I don't use any butter and the low - fat cheeses lower the calorie count.

\n\n

However, your recipe was great and I enjoyed it immensely. Thanks for the recipe I e-mailed it to a friend I know will love and appreciate it.

"}, {'name': 'Akrista', 'review': '

Great idea for a "grown up" grilled cheese sandwich. I love adding extra ingredients to spice up my grilled cheese sandwiches or any sandwich for that matter - and the pickled onions are on my list of must try recipes. I suppose the recipe would work just as well with sweet onions (my favorite), or both red and sweet - hmmm...., that\'s an idea.

'}]

og:title: Make Your Grilled Cheese a Bit Fancy With Smoked Salmon and Gruyere
og:description: How to make a toasty, cheesy grilled cheese sandwich with Gruyere, smoked salmon, and Meyer lemon.
Title: Smoked Salmon and Gruyere Grilled Cheese Sandwich
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Smoked Salmon and Gruyere Grilled Cheese Sandwich Recipe
Cook Time: 20 mins; Total Time: 20 mins; Servings: 4 sandwiches
Ingredients: 1/2 Meyer lemon, thinly sliced, seeds removed, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 8 slices French bread, 4 ounces smoked salmon, 4 ounces Gruyere cheese, sliced or shredded, 1 Tbsp chopped chives, Butter
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Weiwen Ng', 'review': "

I just did these with preserved lemons made from regular lemons. It was very, very good. However, I am going to get a bunch of Meyer lemons when they're in season and preserve them.

"}, {'name': 'Lynda', 'review': '

I have a thing for smoked salmon and cheese. I love these and the lemon is wonderful with it.

One of my favorites is an open faced toasted bun topped with smoked salmon and OKA cheese slices...

You melt them under the broiler and serve with thinly sliced avocado and fresh dill

'}, {'name': 'julie', 'review': '

I live in NH--where does one find Meyer lemons? This recipe intrigues me.

You might be able to find preserved lemons at a specialty market. Meyer lemons are grown where they grow other lemons, definitely not in New Hampshire. ;-) They come in season in the winter months. Whole Foods may carry them when they are in season. ~Elise

'}, {'name': 'Dana', 'review': "

I've made this twice now for parties. Both were huge hits! And really easy to make.

"}, {'name': 'Dennis', 'review': '

You forgot the chives!! Thanks for the call out.

Best - Dennis

'}]

og:title: Tarragon Egg Salad
og:description: Chilled egg salad with fresh tarragon, fennel, red bell pepper, and green onions.
Title: Tarragon Egg Salad
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Tarragon Egg Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 15 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 10 to 12 hard-boiled eggs*, peeled and chopped, 1/3 cup mayonnaise, 2 teaspoons Dijon mustard, 1/2 cup fennel, chopped (about 1/2 of 1 large bulb), 1/2 cup red bell pepper, chopped, 1/2 cup green onions, chopped, including the greens, 1/4 cup packed fresh tarragon leaves, chopped, 2 teaspoons cider vinegar, Salt and pepper, to taste
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Heather', 'review': 'I found your blog over a decade ago and still use your recipes. This one is simple and excellent. It's an elevated take on a classic. Thank you very much.'}, {'name': 'American in Portugal', 'review': 'Delicious! I live in Portugal, and rarely find green onions in the markets, so I substituted the same amount of finely chopped leek (only the pale green part).'}, {'name': 'Dana Jones', 'review': 'Absolutely delicious! The prep time was near an hour when you include cooking, cooling and peeling eggs. I subtracted the time I took to look up how to cut fennel'}, {'name': 'Nis', 'review': "

Hi Elise, I'm in Sri Lanka. We don't get Tarragon here. Nevertheless, this picture looks so appealing and I really really want to try this out. Could you please tell me how Tarragon tastes like. Then probably I can think of a substitute that is available here. Thanks a lot...

I'm really really enjoying your blog. Thanks a lot for so many inspiring ideas.

Hi Nis, it tastes like fennel. You could use some ground toasted fennel seeds in the salad, or use some freshly chopped fennel fronds (leaves).

"}, {'name': 'Gabby', 'review': "

Wow.... Delicious! Eating it now! Try to use the best eggs available to you (from a local farmer raising pastured chickens, I'd recommend). The better the eggs the better the egg salad. YUM.

Thanks for the recipe!

"}]

og:title: Gruyere, Apple, and Fig Jam Panini
og:description: BEST Grilled Cheese Panini! With nutty gruyere cheese, tart green Granny Smith apples, and sweet fig jam.
Title: Gruyere, Apple, and Fig Jam Panini
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Gruyere, Apple, and Fig Jam Panini Recipe
Prep Time: 6 mins; Cook Time: 5 mins; Total Time: 11 mins; Servings: 2 servings; Yield: 2 sandwiches
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons butter, at room temperature, to make it easy to spread, 4 slices rustic whole-grain bread, sliced from a dense bakery loaf, 2 tablespoons fig jam, 4 ounces Gruyere cheese, thinly sliced, 1/2 medium Granny Smith apple, cored and thinly sliced
Reviews: [{'name': 'Jayne', 'review': 'Oh yes! I just remembered about my brie. Have got to make this with the last of my fig jam soon. Thanks for reminding me about it!'}, {'name': 'momofnine', 'review': 'This sounds like such a "fallish" panini. Can\'t wait to try it with hardy homemade bread and apples from our old orchard. Thank you!'}, {'name': 'Katie H.', 'review': "We don't have a panini press and also like using a cast iron pan, but what I've found really improves any grilled cheese is weighting the sandwich with whatever you've got- another, smaller cast iron, a bacon press, or when we grill our grilled cheeses in the summer, a brick wrapped in aluminum foil. For some reason, smooshing the sandwich makes it better."}, {'name': 'beth', 'review': "what's hilarious to me, looking at the recipe again this morning, is how i completely misread it. got home last night and had a grilled cheese - with balsamic fig jam, cheddar, and pear. :) quite tasty, and thanks for the inspiration!"}, {'name': 'Rachel @ Bakerita', 'review': "All the recipes from Kathy's book look phenomenal, and this one is no exception! I'm kicking myself for forgetting my panini press at home so I can't make all these lovely paninis at school! Yours looks beyond delicious."}]

og:title: This Hot Turkey Sandwich Is Thanksgiving Leftovers Perfection
og:description: The easiest way to prepare turkey leftovers, as an open-faced sandwich, topped with leftover turkey and gravy.
Title: Hot Turkey Sandwich
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Hot Turkey Sandwich Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 5 mins; Total Time: 10 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 1 1/2 pound leftover turkey meat, sliced, 1/2 cup or so leftover turkey gravy, Stock or water (to thin the gravy if needed), 4 large slices rustic bread
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Scott_Lloyd', 'review': 'Very true to the tradition — except that you need a scoop of mashed potatoes on the side to complete the dish.'}, {'name': 'norm', 'review': 'great'}, {'name': 'Rick Grunwald', 'review': "This sounds good but a REAL thanksgiving evening sandwich must have stuffing and cranberry sauce. Nothing less than a gourmand's delight will do. :))"}, {'name': 'Mallory', 'review': "

Yep we always do this with our leftovers too! It's especially good with a dollop of cranberry sauce right on top!

"}, {'name': 'Cookie', 'review': '

Oh, wow...thanks. THAT\'S the step I was missing: heating up the gravy with the turkey slices.

\n\n

We never did turkeys when I was growing up. Always a pair of fresh capons, roasted on a spit over a charcoal fire in the large dining room fireplace of our 19th-c Bucks County farmhouse. I remember basting the birds with melted butter and red wine vinegar to the whine of the rotisserie motor and the spitting of the juices on the coals. My dad had installed a 1\' by 4\' by 6" deep open charcoal grill "basket" with a removable electric rotisserie in the big old fireplace. Can you picture that? Sans the rotisserie, we\'d also grill thick marinated Porterhouses year-round. Not quite the fireside cooking the original owners had known, but it was so commonplace for me that I didn\'t realize till years later how unusual those meals were.

'}]

og:title: Dress Up a Simple Burger: Make Jim’s Famous A1 Hamburger With Fresh Rosemary
og:description: Try this juicy, grilled A1 hamburger recipe seasoned with fresh rosemary and topped with all the fixings!
Title: Jim’s Famous A.1. Hamburger Recipe
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Jim’s Famous A1 Hamburger Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 15 mins; Servings: 3
to 4 servings
Ingredients: 1 pound ground beef, an 80/20 mix of ground chuck or sirloin is best, 2 heaping tablespoons chopped fresh rosemary leaves, 2 tablespoons A.1. sauce, Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, about a half a teaspoon each, 4 hamburger buns, Lettuce, Sliced tomatoes, Sliced onions, Sliced avocado, Mayonnaise, Ketchup, Mustard
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Patricia', 'review': "I love rosemary, but 2T sounds like a lot for 1 lb of beef. I'm interested in hearing from anyone who used that amount: was it okay or overwhelming? Would you use less the next time?"}, {'name': 'Mark M', 'review': "When you are making that burger I would grind up the rosemary in a spice grinder. It'll flavor the meat better."}, {'name': 'AndrewAtlanta', 'review': '

had this today for lunch... was great! though I may add an egg next time per Brian... to hold the meat together.

'}, {'name': 'Randi Lynne', 'review': '

I made these two nights ago and was delighted with the rosemary flavor in the burgers (used regular beef). Rosemary is one of my favorite herbs and I had never thought about it going in my burgers. It probably will from now on. :)

'}, {'name': 'Brad', 'review': '

A1 is like HP, should be a good substitute!

'}]

og:title: For Dr. Seuss Day, Make a "Greens" Eggs and Ham Grilled Cheese Sandwich
og:description: Here's an immensely satisfying grilled cheese sandwich with slices of ham, a fried egg, wilted baby spinach, and gruyere cheese on rye.
Title: Greens, Eggs, and Ham Grilled Cheese Sandwich
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Greens, Eggs, and Ham Grilled Cheese Sandwich Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 15 mins; Serving: 1 sandwich
Ingredients: Butter, 1 large egg, 2 slices rye bread, Enough sliced ham to form a 1/4-inch layer to cover a slice of rye bread, Small handful of baby spinach (or sliced young chard), A few slices of gruyere cheese
Reviews: [{'name': 'Chris', 'review': 'This is not a grilled cheese. This is a melt!'}, {'name': 'Edith', 'review': 'Wonderful recipe. Wonderful nod to Dr. Seuss. Will add this tasty sammie to the rotation.'}, {'name': 'Tempy', 'review': 'This sounds delicious! I would probably add a bit of diced or minced spicy chillies for kick, since my house is filled with fire lovers. The recipe is a beauty all on its own, though!'}, {'name': 'Kayleigh', 'review': "Hey everyone! Has anybody tried this sandwich with any other types of meat? Like turkey, maybe? I'd like some input.. I'm not a huge fan of ham because I only eat lighter colored meat!"}, {'name': 'Jonathan', 'review': "Sounds really good. If you wanted actual green eggs instead of greens and eggs, you could blend up the spinach into the eggs. Of course, you would have to do scrambled or something instead of a fried egg in that case. \n\nMy favorite version of green eggs is to beat together an egg with avocado. Because avocados are similar to eggs in terms of protein and fat content, they work together well. It's a good way to use an avocado that's a little past it's prime, when it starts getting stringy, or not quite ripe and still a little hard, without just making guacamole. I usually use a 4/1 ratio, so 4 eggs to 1 avocado for omelets, or for something like this, 1 egg to 1/4 avocado, and maybe thin it out with a little milk if it's too thick."}]

og:title: Pan Bagnat Is the Ultimate Fast and Fancy French Sandwich
og:description: Pan bagnat is the ultimate make-ahead picnic sandwich! Find some crusty bread, good quality canned tuna, a few choice toppings, and you're on your way. It seems fancy, but this French tuna sandwich couldn't be easier.
Title: Pan Bagnat (French Tuna Sandwich)
Author: Sally Vargas
Description:
Pan Bagnat (French Tuna Sandwich) Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Pressing: 20 mins; Total Time: 40 mins; Servings: 4 servings; Yield: 2 sandwiches
Ingredients: 1/2 small red onion, thinly sliced, 2 (5-ounce) cans oil-packed tuna fish, 1/4 cup olive oil, 2 anchovy fillets, finely chopped, 1/4 cup pitted Nicoise or Kalamata olives, 1 to 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar, 2 (10-inch) baguettes, or 1 full-sized baguette, cut in half (see Recipe Note), 1 garlic clove, peeled, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 2 hardboiled eggs, sliced, 2 tomatoes, sliced, 12 large basil leaves
Reviews: [{'name': 'monastrell', 'review': 'mejor atun o bonito en escabeche'}, {'name': 'monastrell', 'review': 'mejor con atun en escabeche la diferencia es grande por el punto de vinagre que se agrega y si es bonito en escabeche mejor'}, {'name': 'Melissa English', 'review': 'Best. Sammich.Ever.'}, {'name': 'Estoy Listo', 'review': "I've been craving this sandwich ever since I first ate one. Followed the recipe exactly. I've fixed them several times for others, and everyone's loved them."}, {'name': 'Michael Schertz', 'review': 'I wonder how this would be with the red onions picked (brine of sugar and vinegar)?'}]

og:title: Make the Most Tender French Dip Sandwiches When You Sous Vide
og:description: Sous Vide French Dip Sandwiches! Cooking sous vide makes the most tender roast beef EVER. This is a perfect starter recipe if you're new to sous vide cooking.
Title: Sous Vide French Dip Sandwiches
Author: Emma Christensen
Description:
Sous Vide French Dip Sandwiches Recipe
Prep Time: 45 mins; Cook Time: 18 hrs; Total Time: 18 hrs 45 mins; Servings: 6
to 8 sandwiches
Ingredients: 3 pounds boneless beef top or bottom round roast, 1 teaspoon salt, plus more to taste, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, plus more to taste, 1 to 3 tablespoons cooking oil, like canola or grapeseed, 1/2 cup red wine, 2 cups low-sodium beef broth or stock, 1 bay leaf, 1 large yellow onion, or 2 small yellow onions, thinly sliced (1 to 1 1/4 pounds), 6 to 8 French rolls or hoagie buns, Sliced provolone cheese, optional
Reviews: [{'name': 'Monica', 'review': "Excellent recipe! I'm making it again. I will never eat a French dip from a restaurant ever again. I love the sear first and sear again. So full of flavor. Do you have a recipe for a 4lb pork loin roast? Thanks, I'm new to sous-vide."}, {'name': 'Thomas', 'review': "Awesome recipe. I've made it twice for guests, it's foolproof and the meat is tender and flavorful. Love the idea of using the jus in the sous vide bag. Mixed it with homemade beef broth and it was magical"}, {'name': 'Robert Harrington', 'review': "I used bolillos rolls from the market...Johnny's au jus and top round on sale for $3.99 a pound. In the oven it's 17.5 minutes for pound at 350 degrees for medium. I like kosher half sours tomatoes and blue cheese on the side!"}, {'name': 'Charles Freeman', 'review': "My wife didn't know I just fed her a $6/lb piece of meat until after I told her and even then she wouldn't believe me. This was amazing. I'd recommend this to anyone."}, {'name': 'Cris Sumski', 'review': 'For a first timer this was a great step by step guide with an excellent result! Followed instructions as written without changing anything. Will be looking for other recipes you post! Thank you so much for the great tutorial!'}]

og:title: Pull Out the Grill for This Chipotle Grilled Chicken with Avocado Sandwich
og:description: Grilled chicken with avocado sandwich, seasoned with chipotle. The fire of the chipotle chile powder is balanced out by the creamy cooling power of the avocado.
Title: Chipotle Grilled Chicken with Avocado Sandwich
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Chipotle Grilled Chicken with Avocado Sandwich Recipe
Total Time: 0 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, 1 tablespoon lime juice, 1/2 teaspoon chipotle chili powder (less or more depending on how much heat you want), 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts (about 2 breast halves), 4 small slices Monterey Jack cheese, 4 sets hamburger buns, 1 avocado, peeled, seeded and sliced, Iceberg or lettuce of preference, Mayonnaise
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Lisa S.', 'review': "ok, this just got added to the rotation. Some nice heat of the Chipotle. Now, I made some changes, had a Chipotle-adobe-tomato sauce in the fridge so used some of that, not the powder. Worked perfectly. So a Chipotle in adobo sauce would probably work here too, just puree it. I didn't have Monterey Jack cheese, so used a Fiesta cheese blend that had it as 1 of the 3 cheeses. Worked perfectly. And I didn't slice my avocado, it was too soft and just mashed by cutting. Added a pinch of salt and a splash of lime to slow the oxidation down, but it will be gone by lunch tomorrow."}, {'name': 'ARmike', 'review': "This tip has really helped me with Avacoado and sandwiches. Mash your slices into a paste, add the mayo if you want, and us it as a spread. I like it chunky. It does't slide out the sandwich. I always end up with one or two slices in my hand or half way out or on the plate.\nThis is much easier."}, {'name': 'Ryan Tipton', 'review': '

Made it last night and it was a hit! Also made some homemade mayo for the first time with grilled onion in it. Wow was it tasty with the chili powder and lime! Thanks for the recipe Elise!

'}, {'name': 'Nancy', 'review': '

Maybe you can try a little of Russian Dresssing and it well give you a great taste instead of mayo.

'}, {'name': 'Jennifer Ford', 'review': "

I brought this to a BBQ last night and it was delicious! I'll be bookmarking this one for sure...

"}]

og:title: Avocado Lettuce Tomato Sandwich (ALT)
og:description: Sliced avocado and tomato, lettuce with toasted whole wheat bread.
Title: Avocado Lettuce Tomato Sandwich (ALT)
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Avocado Lettuce Tomato Sandwich (ALT) Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 10 mins; Serving: 1 sandwich
Ingredients: 2 slices toasted whole grain bread, 1/2 whole avocado, sliced (see How to Cut and Peel an Avocado), 2 leaves lettuce (Boston Bibb or butter lettuce work well), 2 to 3 slices fresh tomato, Kosher salt, Mayonnaise
Reviews: [{'name': 'sharon', 'review': 'yummy is all I can say'}, {'name': 'Steve', 'review': 'When I first had this sandwich in San Francisco it was with Alfalfa sprouts and maybe a little Mayo, in the 1970s it was the best sandwich I had ever had. (It may have been preceded with a little pot).'}, {'name': 'Amanda', 'review': "I love making this... I use brownberry Heath nut bread, I toast it in the oven and put a slice of deli American cheese on it. I also add sliced red onion and it's amazing!!"}, {'name': 'Kevin', 'review': 'Add a thin layer of Marmite (or Vegemite) if you dare.'}, {'name': 'Paul Hutchinson', 'review': 'Great recipe I love avocado! I like to put Italian dressing on my sandwich.'}]

og:title: This Classic Reuben With Homemade Russian Dressing Is Pure Sandwich Bliss
og:description: No need to dine out to have a classic Reuben sandwich when you can perfect it at home. Pile corned beef, tangy sauerkraut, from-scratch Russian dressing, and melty Swiss cheese on dark rye, and you’re on your way to sandwich bliss.
Title: Reuben Sandwich
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Reuben Sandwich Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 6 mins; Total Time: 21 mins; Servings: 4 servings; Yield: 4 sandwiches
Ingredients: 1/3 cup mayonnaise, 1 1/2 tablespoons ketchup, 1-1/2 teaspoons prepared horseradish, 1/2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce, Freshly ground black pepper, to taste, 2 tablespoons butter, softened, 8 slices rye bread, 8 slices Swiss cheese, 3/4 pound corned beef brisket, thinly sliced, 1/2 pound sauerkraut, 1/4 cup Russian dressing
Reviews: [{'name': 'Steve qualls', 'review': 'Made the sandwiches yesterday to try out new Rye bread recipe. The bread was just ok because of the rise but the sandwiches were great. Crispy toast and tasty inside with the dressing recipe. The melted cheese made turning the sandwiches over was a little tricky. Will definitely do this again after our traditional St. Paddy’s day corned beef and cabbage leftovers.'}, {'name': 'Christopher moore', 'review': 'The only difference between this recipe and mine is the dressing. I make homemade Russian with homemade Mayo. You can’t get the proper heat with store bought… thousand island or other wise…'}, {'name': 'Court', 'review': "That Russian dressing is liteally Cane's Sauce. I know, I used to work at Cane's."}, {'name': 'Chicago guy', 'review': 'I will stack the meat and cheese on a plate and microwave for a minute or two. Toast the bread separately and combine all, adding hot giardiniera.'}, {'name': 'Greg Lacy', 'review': 'I like to use pumpernickel bread for maximum flavor. Thousand Island with Bacon dressing adds a good zing to it also. Sauerkraut with caraway seeds is good too. Grilled on a cast iron skillet with butter. Also, use regular Swiss cheese that is cut from a loaf for best flavor. Not baby Swiss. Add plenty of spices when you boil the corn beef also. These are super yummy.'}]

og:title: Toast Up English Muffin Tuna Melts That the Whole Family Will Love
og:description: Tuna salad and cheese on English muffins combine for family-friendly melts that kids love.
Title: English Muffin Tuna Melts
Author: Nick Evans
Description:
English Muffin Tuna Melts Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 30 mins; Servings: 4
to 8 servings; Yield: 8 tuna melts
Ingredients: 1 medium carrot, 5 radishes, 1/2 pickle, 3 to 4 tablespoons pickle juice, 1 stalk celery, minced, 1/4 cup minced red onion, 2 tablespoons minced red bell pepper, Juice of 1/2 lemon, 2 cans (about 10 total ounces) albacore tuna, oil or water packed, 1/8 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 1/3 cup mayonnaise, 4 whole English muffins, 8 slices swiss cheese
Reviews: [{'name': 'Jody Campbell', 'review': 'Thanks for this recipe. I am not a big fan of canned tuna. But i am blessed to get a lot from my local food bank. Since most tuna melts have tomato slices on them the i get ulcers from the acid. This is the perfect recipe to switch in the mixed veg and swiss cheese (one of my favorite things). I already make a pickled veg mix. Thanks for the recipe and Peter\'s name of "Cat Burgers"'}, {'name': 'Tina', 'review': 'This was great! The tuna salad was delicious. Because my husband prefers a very toasty bread I toasted the English Muffin on both sides under the broiler (brushed both sides with olive oil) before topping with the cheese/tuna salad . Then I heated them up under the broiler vs baking. We also put a slice of tomato under the top cheese layer. They turned out absolutely fantastic, we will definitely make again. :)'}, {'name': 'Peter', 'review': 'English Muffin Tuna Melts aka "Cat Burgers". Their good though. Grew up on these.'}, {'name': 'NATE k', 'review': 'ihave eaten and loved tuna two or 3 times aweek for 60 years!! this reciepe is agift from GOD!!!'}, {'name': 'Laurie Anzovino', 'review': 'Always delicious. Added pickle. Yum!!\nWhat did Lebron think?'}]

og:title: This Avocado Tuna Salad is Perfect
og:description: This avocado tuna salad uses creamy avocado instead of mayo for a fresh and easy twist on the classic. Red onion and celery add some crunch, while lemon juice gives it some zing.
Title: Avocado Tuna Salad
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Avocado Tuna Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 10 mins; Servings: 2 servings
Ingredients: 1 5-ounce can tuna, preferably packed in olive oil, drained, 1/2 ripe avocado, roughly chopped, 1/2 cup minced celery, 1/4 cup minced red onion, 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil, 2 teaspoons lemon juice, 1 teaspoon lemon zest, 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro or parsley, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, Freshly ground black pepper
Reviews: [{'name': 'Richard Richardson ', 'review': 'Just made this since I happen to have all the ingredients on hand. Love it! Even my spouse (she doesn't like mashed avocado) ate it!'}, {'name': 'Taylor', 'review': 'Delicious!!! Loved this recipe and how simple it was! I ate my salad with some avocado slices on sourdough bread. I added a tiny squeeze of light mayo to the salad as well, and it was perfect. Will definitely be in my lunch rotation!'}, {'name': 'looking for new recipes', 'review': 'I would.give these tuna recipes a 5-star rating without anything even slightly hot. I have a very sensitive mouth and can't stand anything hot or Spicey. I'm going to get all these ingredients and try them all. Thanks!'}, {'name': 'Camelia', 'review': 'Eating it as I am writing this comment - This is so tasty and amazing! Thank you.'}, {'name': 'Sharon', 'review': "I haven't made this yet, but I love everything about it, so I know it'll be good. What I really came here to say at the moment is that if you put the avocado pit in the container, it'll keep the salad from browning for a bit."}]

og:title: Grab a Knife and Fork for This Cheesy, Saucy Croque Monsieur Sandwich
og:description: The classic French croque monsieur is a toasted ham and gruyere cheese sandwich that's topped with a bechamel sauce. It's a real knife and fork sandwich that's a creamy delight!
Title: Croque Monsieur Sandwich
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Croque Monsieur Sandwich Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 20 mins; Total Time: 25 mins; Servings: 4 sandwiches
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, 1 1/2 cups milk, A pinch each of salt, freshly ground pepper, nutmeg, or more to taste, 1 1/2 cups Gruyère cheese, grated (about 1 1/2 cups grated), 1/4 cup Grated parmesan cheese (packed), 8 slices French or Italian loaf bread, 12 ounces ham, sliced, 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Jeanne', 'review': 'Worst I have ever experienced!
Followed your recipe to a T
bechemel to thick ... too much
bechemmel sauce boring even with added nutmeg
 two bites - threw it out'}, {'name': 'Someone Else', 'review': "That should be called Coma la Fromage. That was pretty stupid delish. Now it's off to sleepy time."}, {'name': 'Steve', 'review': 'Truly excellent! Bravo!'}, {'name': 'Angela', 'review': "I love the béchamel sauce sooooo much!! I literally make twice the amount just so I can have it like soup too!! I know...not healthy but it's soooo good."}, {'name': 'Malika A. Black', 'review': "I just made my first homemade loaf of white bread and was looking for recipes to make with it. Croque Monsieur is one of them. 
I found many recipes on Google, but this version with bechamel sauce looks delicious. Maybe it makes the sandwich softer ?
I only have Mozzarella and Cheddar at home. I'm sure it won't be as delicious ! So I have to buy some Gruyère Cheese to make it. Thanks!"}]

og:title: This Creamy Avocado Chicken Salad Skips the Mayo
og:description: Avocado replaces the mayo in this quick and easy chicken salad with apple for a surprise crunch.
Title: Avocado Chicken Salad
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Avocado Chicken Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 10 mins; Servings: 2 sandwiches
Ingredients: 1 cup finely chopped cooked chicken, 1 ripe avocado, seeded and peeled (see How to Cut and Peel an Avocado), 1 apple, peeled, cored, and finely chopped, 1/4 cup finely chopped celery, 1/4 cup finely chopped red onion, 2 tablespoons finely chopped cilantro or parsley, 2 teaspoons lime juice or a tablespoon of lemon juice, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, Pinch freshly ground black pepper, Sandwich bread or salad greens
Reviews: [{'name': 'Leah Powers', 'review': 'Guys, I don’t usually review recipes. Mostly because I’m a caterers kid and I’m always doctoring stuff to use what I have on hand etc. but THIS chicken salad was the best I’ve ever had! I followed the recipe and it was so fresh, crisp and delicious. I decided to try adding a small scoop of Mayo and drop of Dijon mustard which held it together a little more but it did not ‘need’ it for flavor. I’m sharing this recipe with my people. So good. I can’t believe this doesn’t have more stars.'}, {'name': 'Amy Baker', 'review': 'Unbelievably delectable flavor combo. Increased the chicken to 2cups and kept all other ingredients as directed. Molded into romaine lettuce leaves for freshness and increase crunch.'}, {'name': 'Komplikashen', 'review': 'Since the salad already has a southwestern flair with the avocado, cilantro and lime juice, I tried a batch with diced roasted green chiles to give it more of a kick. For those who enjoy slightly spicier dishes, it came out great... for added crunch to complement the apple and celery, finely diced jalapeño also worked well.'}, {'name': 'Debra Folger', 'review': 'I was wondering what kind of apple did you all use?'}, {'name': 'Mary', 'review': "I was looking for something different for lunch and I had an avocado and leftover roasted chicken so I made it without parsley or cilantro as I did not have them, and it was phenomenal! Can't wait to make it again with the herbs!!"}]

og:title: Make a Patty Melt at Home, Never Look Back
og:description: Switch up your homemade burger game and make patty melts this week. All you need are caramelized onions, Swiss cheese, burger patties, and toasted bread.
Title: Classic Patty Melt
Author: Nick Evans
Description:
Patty Melt Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 40 mins; Total Time: 50 mins; Servings: 2 sandwiches
Ingredients: 1 sweet yellow onion, thinly sliced, 2 tablespoons butter, divided, 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar, 8 ounces 90/10 ground beef, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, 4 slices sandwich bread, 4 slices Swiss cheese, Mustard, optional
Reviews: [{'name': 'Julie', 'review': 'Made it tonight, it was a hit. Tasted like we had ordered it when going out to eat. Used light rye and pepperjack cheese. This gets a two 👍👍 in my recipe file on my iPad.'}, {'name': 'CC', 'review': 'Where is the thousand island sauce??? Mustard??? Really???'}, {'name': 'Jaime Williams', 'review': 'I never knew how good caramelized onions are. This was a hit with my entire family. I used Texas toast for some until I ran out and used wheat for the remainder. Home made fried on the side with apple sauce. So yummy. Some wanted provolone and others wanted pepper jack. Thanks for a great dinner!'}, {'name': 'dianne', 'review': 'TEXAS TOAST is a great bread for this'}, {'name': 'Gina ', 'review': 'So good!! Used dark rye and it was EXCELLENT!'}]

og:title: Sausage, Peppers, and Onions Will Never Go Out of Style
og:description: This classic recipe cooks Italian sausages with bell peppers, sweet onions, crushed tomatoes, and garlic. You can serve this versatile combo on a hoagie roll, over pasta, or with polenta.
Title: Easy Sausage, Peppers, and Onions
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Easy Italian Sausage, Peppers, and Onions Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 40 mins; Total Time: 50 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, 4 Italian sausage links (sweet, hot, or a couple of each), 1 large yellow onion, sliced into 1/4-inch half-moons, 1 green bell pepper, sliced into 3-inch strips, 1 red bell pepper, sliced into 3-inch strips, 1 bell pepper of another color (yellow or orange or purple), sliced into 3-inch strips, Salt, to taste, 4 garlic cloves, sliced into slivers, 1/2 cup Marsala or red wine, optional, 1 (15-ounce) can crushed tomatoes, 1 tablespoon dried oregano, 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes, optional
Reviews: [{'name': 'gordon_wagner', 'review': 'Easy and delicious!'}, {'name': 'Sandi Luker Atcheson', 'review': 'This recipe was amazing - best sausage, peppers and onions I've ever made. Served it over rice and it was great.'}, {'name': 'April', 'review': 'The is is a huge hit every time I make it. The marsala takes it to the next level. It is now in my regular rotation.'}, {'name': 'Margaret Pritchard', 'review': 'This was easy and delicious. I added a bit of paprika for a bit more spice and smokiness as well. Will be making again.'}, {'name': 'John Bentley', 'review': 'So delicious and so easy to make. The aroma during cooking filled the kitchen and I couldn’t wait to taste the dish. Well worth it. Thank you 🙏'}]

og:title: Here are Steven Raichlen's Tips for Grilling the Best Burgers
og:description: To make this recipe, the only one you'll ever need for grilled burgers, we tested all sorts of methods for mixing, shaping, and grilling. We even talked with grilling expert Steven Raichlen, so you can trust our recipe will turn out perfect grilled burgers, every time.
Title: How To Grill the Best Burgers
Author: Summer Miller
Description:
How To Grill the Best Burgers
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 5 mins; Total Time: 15 mins; Servings: 6 servings; Yield: 6 burgers
Ingredients: 2 pounds (32 ounces) 80/20 ground beef, cold, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tablespoons minced onion, 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce, 1 3/4 teaspoons freshly ground pepper, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, 6 hamburger buns, Butter for buns
Reviews: [{'name': 'Martha', 'review': 'Best. Burgers. Ever. Every time.'}, {'name': 'Glenda', 'review': "So impressed! The best burger I've ever done!! Thank you so much🙏🏽"}, {'name': 'AMM', 'review': 'This is now the only hamburger recipe I use...they make the perfect hamburgers!! I love the tips and follow them every time, and it really works. I have converted my father, who has grilled hamburgers his whole life, to making these as well. Great recipe!!'}, {'name': 'jeff', 'review': "My girlfriend said these are the best burgers I've ever cooked .... BY FAR.\nThanks for the help!"}, {'name': 'vanillachino', 'review': 'I enjoyed this recipe so much that I had to search for it again because I forgot to save it. For me the amount of salt & pepper it calls for is what gives it such a great taste. The rest of the seasonings are great to. I’ll be using this recipe a lot.'}]

og:title: The Best Grilled Cheese Sandwich Recipe, Hands-Down
og:description: Everything you need to know about making the best grilled cheese sandwich! Mayo or butter? Lid on or off? There's more to a good grilled cheese recipe than you might think!
Title: How to Make a Grilled Cheese Sandwich
Author: Sara Bir
Description:
How to Make a Grilled Cheese Sandwich
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 5 mins; Total Time: 10 mins; Serving: 1; Yield: 1 sandwich
Ingredients: 3 ounces (about 2/3 to 1 cup) shredded cheddar, Swiss, Jack, or fontina cheese, 2 slices sandwich bread, preferably 1/2-inch thick, 2 teaspoons mayonnaise or butter
Reviews: [{'name': 'Anne', 'review': 'I put a big pot lid over the sandwiches to aid in melting the cheeses. It helps!'}, {'name': 'Embeya', 'review': "Woooow.....Homemade!!! It's the only thing that taste good! And so easy to do…\n\nI think I will look for these and try your recipe this weekend. Thank you for sharing!"}, {'name': 'Kirk', 'review': 'Recently got an outdoor griddle top. Would you recommend making them on that? Or no? Was thinking of doing that as I could do several at a time for the family.'}, {'name': 'a', 'review': 'Muenster cheese is another good choice.'}, {'name': 'Anne', 'review': 'Mayo - all the way!'}]

og:title: How to Make the Best Cuban Sandwich at Home
og:description: Here's how to make the BEST traditional Cuban sandwich, a.k.a. a Cubano, at home! Layers of mojo-marinated pork roast, ham, cheese, and pickles make this sandwich outstanding. Serve toasted grilled bread sandwich hot or cold!
Title: Cuban Sandwich (Cubano)
Author: Marta Rivera
Description:
Cuban Sandwich (Cubano) Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 25 mins; Servings: 8
to 12 sandwiches
Ingredients: 1 (1-pound) loaf Cuban or Italian bread, 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened, 1 small clove garlic, crushed, 2 tablespoons yellow mustard, 8 ounces thinly sliced Swiss cheese, about 10 slices, 1 pound shredded pork roast, heated until warmed through, Sliced dill pickles, as needed, 10 slices Black Forest or smoked ham, Potato chips, Dill pickles
Reviews: [{'name': 'Peter S Valenti III', 'review': 'The fraud continues with stories like these that claim a traditional cuban sandwich comes from Miami or Cuba..the one and only traditional Cuban Sandwich is a creation from Tampa cigar factory workers and salami isn\'t added for "saltiness" as lazy writers might put in because it\'s easier than actual research, the ingredients are representative of the original factory workers who were Cubans, Sicilians and German. The contributions are boiled ham, pickles, swiss cheese and mustard from the Germans. Salami from the Sicilians and the bread and roast pork from the Cubans. This used to be common knowledge but with the population of Tampa growing the way it has over the last few decades it\'s hard to find many people here that are from here any more so you get these phoney stories made up by people because they sound good.'}, {'name': 'Rosemary Richards', 'review': 'The Cubano originated in Cuba, BUT the Cuban sandwich originated in Tampa to feed the Italian and Cuban immigrants working in the cigar factories'}, {'name': 'kenhowes', 'review': 'The point of the foil is that it will stay warm longer. You wrap it with the shiny side in.'}, {'name': 'A@4U', 'review': 'Had leftover roasted pork tenderloin and was looking for an option other than pork-fried rice. Delicious! While not authentic to reviewer below, we enjoyed our quick & easy Cuban-style sandwiches with what I had on hand ... leftover roasted pork tenderloin, Brioche buns, maple-glazed deli ham, and dill pickle chips and baby Swiss. I do smear both cut sides with the garlic butter before toasting and adding mustard, however. Thank you for the inspiration!'}, {'name': 'Yolanda', 'review': "Eating my 'sandwiche cubano' right now, very delicious!"}]

og:title: Crispy Baked Fish Sandwich with Avocado Mayo
og:description: Craving fried fish, but looking for something slightly healthier? Try these crispy baked fish sandwiches with avocado mayo and pickled onion. It’s the creamy, crunchy, tangy bite you’ve been looking for.
Title: Crispy Baked Fish Sandwiches with Avocado Mayo and Pickled Onion
Author: Katie Morford, MS, RD
Description:
Crispy Baked Fish Sandwiches with Avocado Mayo and Pickled Onion
Prep Time: 30 mins; Cook Time: 12 mins; Total Time: 42 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 1/3 cup apple cider vinegar, 1 tablespoon sugar, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/2 medium red onion, thinly sliced, 1 1/4 pounds firm white fish such as halibut, cod, or grouper, 1 1/4 teaspoons kosher salt, divided, 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1 cup panko style breadcrumbs, 1 tablespoon garlic powder, 1 tablespoon ground cumin, 2 large eggs, 1/4 cup all-purpose flour, Non-stick cooking spray, 1 large ripe avocado, peeled and pitted, 1 tablespoon lime juice, 2 tablespoons mayonnaise, 4 soft sandwich buns, such as brioche, 2 cups romaine hearts, shredded, 2-3 tablespoons pickled jalapenos
Reviews: [{'name': 'Jack', 'review': "The crunchy fish, creamy avocado mayo, and tangy pickled onion all combine to create a flavor profile that'll have your taste buds singing! Loved your recipe!!"}, {'name': 'Daveyboy', 'review': 'Best fish sandwich ever!!! We used cod. Thank you for posting recipe!'}, {'name': 'Anne Murphy', 'review': "This was absolutely delicious. It's a shame halibut is SOOOO expensive right now - but this was totally worth it. I'll definitely be making this again."}]

og:title: Kentucky Hot Brown Is a Major Upgrade to the Turkey Sandwich
og:description: Celebrate the Kentucky Derby with this open-faced sandwich piled high with roasted turkey, tomatoes, smothered in a mornay sauce, and topped with bacon.
Title: Kentucky Hot Brown
Author: Vivian Jao
Description:
Kentucky Hot Brown Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 20 mins; Total Time: 30 mins; Servings: 2 servings; Yield: 2 open-face sandwiches
Ingredients: 4 slices bacon, 4 thick slices Texas toast or white sandwich bread (not the buttered kind), 10 ounces deli-sliced roast turkey, 1 tomato, 1/8 teaspoon kosher salt, optional, 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, optional, 1/2 teaspoon chopped fresh parsley, for garnish, 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, 1 cup whole milk, room temperature, 1/2 cup heavy cream, room temperature, 1/4 cup (1 ounce) grated Pecorino Romano, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 1/8 teaspoon ground nutmeg
Reviews: [{'name': 'Strapper Nick', 'review': "I had a perfect Ky Hot Brown at The Biltmore Stable Cafe years ago. Tried one in Lexington a year ago but just wasn't anywhere near as good as that one."}, {'name': 'Mike in Indiana', 'review': 'what are the diagonal pieces of toast for? Sopping up the remaining sauce?'}]

og:title: Need an Big Party Please? Try Braised BBQ Beef Sandwiches
og:description: Perfect for big parties: Shredded, slowly braised chuck roast in barbecue sauce for sandwiches.
Title: Braised BBQ Beef Sandwich
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Braised BBQ Beef Sandwich Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 3 hrs 30 mins; Total Time: 3 hrs 35 mins; Servings: 12 sandwiches
Ingredients: 1 (3-pound) chuck roast, rinsed and dried, 2 medium onions, chopped, 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil, 1 (28-ounce) can whole tomatoes (preferably plum tomatoes), 1 (18-ounce) bottle of your favorite barbecue sauce (or 2 1/4 cups of your favorite homemade barbecue sauce), Salt and freshly ground black pepper, 12 sandwich or hamburger buns
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Jenny K.', 'review': 'Thanks for the recipe! Turned out great. I used a 1.5 lbs roast and cooked for 2.25 hours. Beef was tender and flavorful.'}, {'name': 'Rose', 'review': 'I like to cook for large amounts of people and would like to make it for about 80 to 100. How much meT do I need?'}, {'name': 'Stephanie', 'review': "This was so good! The meat just fell apart and as so flavorful. It also halved really well, since my roast was only 1 1/2 pounds. I did add a hatch style pepper with the onion (they're seasonal in my garden right now, so I'm pretty much adding them to everything!). This was very easy and tasted like it took much more time. For those of you interested, if you just pull the roast out of the pan, you could just serve it like a regular roast and top it with the sauce instead of shredding it. Next time I'll try this recipe with pork! It's usually what I buy since beef is so expensive. Got my chuck roast on sale, and I'm sure glad I chose this recipe for cooking it!"}, {'name': 'Phil', 'review': 'Hello, Elise...
I have a question about a plate I see in your "Braised BBQ Beef Sandwich" recipe.
About 25 yrs. ago, I bought a set of dishes like this one, Cobalt blue and bright white. Most have been broken. I can not find them any where! Can you point me in the right direction? 

Thank you for any and all help you can give.

Philip M. Crow Sr.

PS- Love your site and recipes!!!'}, {'name': 'Michelle', 'review': "Not sure if I missed something, but the directions say after adding the BBQ sauce to turn up to medium high heat, but then simmer for 10 minutes? I kept it at medium high heat for 10 min. and got some crusty burnt stuff going before I raced from the dishes to stir it and save it from more burning, but was I supposed to just raise it up and then lower to a simmer? Just a little unclear to me, since medium high seems a bit hot for a simmer and it definitely needed attentive stirring to avoid a burnt bottom. Still smells delicious, but I'm going to have a time cleaning my dutch oven later!

Also, do you use boneless or bone-in chuck roast? I couldn't find the bone-in at the store, so had to go with boneless, just wondering if I should search harder next time. Thanks! I'm looking forward to the final results, love all the recipes on this site."}]

og:title: Classic Philly Cheesesteak Is a Fun, Filling Dinner
og:description: Our recipe for the classic Philly Cheesesteak is packed to the brim with thinly sliced steak, onions, provolone cheese, and Cheez Whiz. It's easy to make, and lets you get a taste Philadelphia anytime you want!
Title: Philly Cheesesteak
Author: Nick Evans
Description:
Philly Cheesesteak Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 17 mins; Freeze steak: 10 mins; Total Time: 37 mins; Servings: 2 servings; Yield: 2 sandwiches
Ingredients: 10 to 12 ounces ribeye steak, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper, 2 tablespoons olive oil, divided, 1/2 medium sweet onion, sliced, 1/2 green bell pepper, sliced, 1/2 red bell pepper, sliced, 2 ounces (3 slices) provolone cheese, 2 hoagie rolls, toasted, 1/4 cup Cheez Whiz, warmed, Fresh thyme, for garnish, optional
Reviews: [{'name': 'BB', 'review': 'Bell peppers NEVER ever go on a Philly cheesesteak. I live in Philadelphia and I'd get laughed at if I expected bell peppers.'}, {'name': 'Michael H', 'review': 'Just what I wanted.'}, {'name': 'HBcook', 'review': "I made this for 2 of us and pretty much as written and it is EXCELLENT. BEST cheese steak I've ever had. No Thyme, doesn't need it but the cheese whiz is a bonus!! Rib eye is a must!"}, {'name': 'Penny Pearson', 'review': "Well we love Philly steak and last had it whilst visiting Florida mall in 2014 from the UK. My first attempt using rib eye steak have caramelised onion few mushrooms and a bit of red pepper we don't have those rolls here nor the cheese so have adapted to toasted soft rolls and cheddar cheese - \ntastes ok but will try brioche rolls next time put more seasoning in and try a different cheese - thanks for the recipe"}, {'name': 'JJK', 'review': "Wit refers to the orange plastic cheese not onions. Provolone is the way to go anyway. Peppers are just an option not the standard. However, be creative!!! More emphasis should be placed on the roll, it can make or break the sandwich. In my opinion, John's Roast Pork in South Philly is the best. Also, try their Roast Pork Sandwich, it's orgasmic!!!"}]

og:title: Skip the Trip and Make the Best Nashville Hot Chicken at Home
og:description: This fried Nashville hot chicken sandwich is spicy, hot, and just a little bit sweet.
Title: Nashville Hot Chicken
Author: Irvin Lin
Description:
Nashville Hot Chicken Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 24 mins; Total Time: 44 mins; Servings: 10 servings; Yield: 10 sandwiches
