Ingredients: 4 cups (560g) all-purpose flour, 1 tablespoon cayenne pepper, 1 tablespoon paprika, 1 tablespoon kosher salt, 1 tablespoon black pepper, 2 cups buttermilk, 1/4 cup hot sauce, like Tabasco or Frank’s, 2 large eggs, 1 tablespoon kosher salt, 10 boneless, skinless large chicken thighs (or 3 chicken breasts, see note above), Oil for frying, like peanut or rice bran oil, 1/2 cup used frying oil, 1/4 cup butter, 2 to 6 tablespoons cayenne pepper, depending on your heat preference, 1 to 2 tablespoons brown sugar, depending on your sweetness preference, 1 teaspoon chili powder blend, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, 1 teaspoon onion powder, 1 teaspoon paprika, 1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt, 1 teaspoon black pepper, 10 burger buns, Dill pickle slices, or bread and butter if you prefer
Reviews: [{'name': 'Amanda ', 'review': 'This is the best hot chicken sandwich!! My step son always request this since hot chicken sandwiches are his favorite. I soak the chicken in the buttermilk for a few hours and use cornstarch in the flour mixture for extra crispiness. You can serve these without the paste for anyone who isn't into super spicy and these are still delicious with a bit of a kick.'}, {'name': 'Alan Crowder', 'review': 'I just made this for the second time. It was absolutely great the first time around. This time I marinated the chicken in the wet mixture for a couple of hours. Then I just coated it well with the flour mixture. No need to dip and flip or double coat. Didn’t think about it this time but next time I’ll add some cornstarch to the dry mixture and see how that does for the crispness. I also increased all of the hot ingredients because I really like it spicy. Used pickle relish and slice of cheese. Fantastic!'}, {'name': 'Karen', 'review': 'Has anyone made this in advance and served the following day?'}, {'name': 'Amber “Aleigh79” T', 'review': 'Takes a long time to make but the spice paste is out of this world! My husband loved this. In our regular recipe rotation for sure.'}, {'name': 'Jeffrey Lachance', 'review': 'Amazing, best hot chicken sandwich I have ever had'}]

og:title: This Fish Po' Boy Isn't Just Any Old Sandwich
og:description: Celebrate New Orleans cuisine with a fish po’ boy loaded with crispy fried catfish, crunchy lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, onions, and a spicy remoulade sauce.
Title: Fish Po’ Boy
Author: Joy Monnerjahn
Description:
Fish Po’ Boy Recipe
Prep Time: 30 mins; Cook Time: 30 mins; Total Time: 60 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups mayonnaise, 1/3 cup heavy cream, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, 1 teaspoon Louisiana hot sauce or Tabasco, 1 teaspoon sweet pickle relish, 2 teaspoons Cajun seasoning, such as Slap Ya Mama Cajun seasoning , 1 tablespoon sweet paprika, 1/4 cup creole mustard, spicy brown mustard, or Dijon mustard, 2 teaspoons horseradish, 3 tablespoons green onions, thinly sliced, 1/2 cup celery, minced , 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper, plus more to taste, Canola oil for frying, approximately 3 to 4 cups , 3 pounds catfish fillets, 2 cups yellow cornmeal, 1 tablespoon cajun seasoning, 1 teaspoon cayenne pepper, 4 large eggs, 1 teaspoon water, 2 loaves French bread, 3 cups iceburg lettuce, shredded, 1 cup dill pickle rounds, 3 medium beefsteak tomatoes, sliced, 1 medium onion

og:title: Philly Cheesesteak Sloppy Joes Are The Best of Both Worlds!
og:description: Combine the best of two classic sandwiches—sloppy joes and Philly cheesesteaks—for these cheesy, meaty, and saucy cheesesteak sloppy joes!
Title: Philly Cheesesteak Sloppy Joes
Author: Nick Evans
Description:
Philly Cheesesteak Sloppy Joes Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 30 mins; Total Time: 40 mins; Servings: 6 servings; Yield: 6 sandwiches
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, 1 small white onion, chopped, 1 green bell pepper, seeded and chopped, 1 pound lean beef, 90/10 blend, 1/2 cup beef stock, 1/4 cup ketchup, 2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce, 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 12 slices provolone cheese, divided, 6 bun brioche buns store-bought or homemade
Reviews: [{'name': '1vafamily', 'review': 'made this tonight. very yummy and easy to make!'}]

og:title: Grilled Cheese Sandwich with Sauerkraut on Rye
og:description: Grilled cheese sandwich with Gruyere Swiss cheese and sauerkraut on rye bread. Great combination!
Title: Grilled Cheese Sandwich With Sauerkraut on Rye
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Grilled Cheese Sandwich with Sauerkraut on Rye Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 15 mins; Serving: 1 sandwich
Ingredients: 2 slices dark rye bread, 4 thin slices aged Gruyere Swiss cheese, 1/3 cup sauerkraut, drained and heated, 2 teaspoons butter
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Ella', 'review': '

This was very tasty! Made it with goats milk white cheddar, with a little dijon mustard. My husband liked it with the Swiss, but thought I should have put more saurekraut and maybe a little more mustard. Also used dill rye bread...

'}, {'name': 'Hannah', 'review': "

I know this sounds odd, but I always put mustard and some Tony's on the bread before I make my grilled cheese sandwiches. It gives it a little extra kick. I always made my boyfriend's sandwiches without it until one day (when he was hungry enough to want some of MY sandwich too!) he took a big bite out of mine and said, hey, why is yours so much better than mine?
\nYour sandwich looks awesome too! I love making grilled cheese with something other than cheddar (though you can't beat the classic when you're not feeling well).

"}, {'name': 'Daniel', 'review': '

This is as good as it sounds- very tasty and moresish- definitely give it a go!

'}]

og:title: The Perfect Lazy Lunch: Eggs Nested in Sautéed Chard and Mushrooms
og:description: Runny eggs, steamed on a bed of sautéed chopped chard, onions, and shiitake mushrooms.
Title: Eggs Nested in Sautéed Chard and Mushrooms
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Eggs Nested in Sautéed Chard and Mushrooms Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 25 mins; Serving: 1 serving
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, 1/2 cup chopped onion, 8 ounces fresh chard, 2 to 3 large shiitake mushrooms, sliced into 1/4-inch thick slices, Salt and freshly ground black pepper, 1 to 2 eggs
Reviews: [{'name': '3rdGenVetKin', 'review': 'My husband couldn\'t stop murmuring \n"YUM, YUM, YUM"...that is the equivalent of my cat purring:) Wonderful and super easy ... we had it for dinner last night! Great recipe!!!'}, {'name': 'Kelly', 'review': 'Put this together for breakfast this morning using Swiss chard from my garden and left over eggs. Didn’t have mushrooms but added some chopped up garlic scapes and butter instead of olive oil. It was delicious! Will become part of the regular rotation.'}, {'name': 'Dolores Ferrero', 'review': "I got the most beautiful chard in this week's produce box, and had all the other ingredients on hand, so this made a delightful Saturday morning breakfast. Thank you so much for this simple yet special recipe."}, {'name': 'Emily', 'review': 'We harvested a lot of chard before our first hard freeze and wondered what to do with lots of chard and stems? We tried this recipe as we had all the other ingredients on hand. Yum, yum! An instant classic for our household. We brainstormed variations as we were eating it but really enjoyed the flavor combination given in the recipe.'}, {'name': 'Maria', 'review': "I cannot figure out how to cook this so that the eggs are runny! It takes more than 10 minutes on low heat to cook the eggs all the way through, and then by the time they're done the yolk is chalky. Does anyone have any tips?"}]

og:title: For a Hearty Salad, Toss Shrimp With Arugula, Beans, and Cherry Tomatoes
og:description: A refreshing and filling quick salad for lunch or dinner.
Title: Shrimp, Arugula, White Bean, and Cherry Tomato Salad
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Shrimp, Arugula, White Bean, and Cherry Tomato Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 20 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 1 pound (16-20 count) shelled and deveined shrimp, 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, 2 (15-ounce) cans cannellini white beans, rinsed and drained, 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved or quartered, 1/2 cup red onion, finely diced, 3/4 teaspoon grated lemon zest, 3 handfuls baby arugula leaves, 3 tablespoons red wine vinegar, 1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
Reviews: [{'name': 'Maria ', 'review': 'Is the carb count of 57 for the whole recipe amount?'}, {'name': 'Deborah Wenzler', 'review': 'A really tasty summer dinner salad! I added a bit of fresh lemon juice and 2 tsp of dijon mustard to the dressing for an extra boost of flavor. YUM!'}, {'name': 'Torrey', 'review': 'Very nice quick dinner. Also used one can of beans, and a sprinkle of feta. Lovely combination of flavors, would make again.'}, {'name': 'Jacqueline', 'review': 'This salad was delicious! Topped it with a bit of Feta cheese.'}, {'name': 'Amanda', 'review': 'This was really good! I used one can of beans and thought it was plenty. Great summery salad.'}]

og:title: This Chickpea Salad Sandwich Is Your New Lunch Hero
og:description: Pop open a can of chickpeas and make this chickpea salad sandwich. Loaded with fiber and protein, ready in 15 minutes.
Title: Chickpea Salad Sandwich
Author: Sally Vargas
Description:
Chickpea Salad Sandwich Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 15 mins; Servings: 2; Yield: 2 sandwiches
Ingredients: 1 (15-ounce) can chickpeas, rinsed and drained, 2 ribs celery, diced, 2 tablespoons capers, rinsed and drained, 3 tablespoons mayonnaise, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1/2 teaspoon Dijon mustard, 1/8 teaspoon salt, 2 pinches black pepper, 4 slices sandwich bread, 1/2 avocado, 2 tablespoons roasted almonds, coarsely chopped, 2 to 4 tomato slices, Handful watercress or other greens, such as lettuce, arugula, or spinach
Reviews: [{'name': 'Shirley DiMartino', 'review': 'This Is a wonderful healthy sandwich . Very satisfying and filling but I only eat half.'}, {'name': 'Jill Smith', 'review': 'lots of carbs'}, {'name': 'Sophie', 'review': 'This sounds wonderful but the calorie content and fat is absolutely ridiculous...no way would I eat a sandwich that caloric or so much fat'}, {'name': 'Nicki Nuns', 'review': 'That is a crazy amount of calories for a chickpea sandwich! How about switch out mayo for Greek yogurt? The sodium is ridiculous as well.'}, {'name': 'Judy', 'review': "I'm not even sure what made me try this, as I don't really care for chickpeas. But I thought it was delicious!! I omitted the almonds as I didn't have any and went a little lighter on the lemon juice. A winner!"}]

og:title: Italian Sub Meets Classic Grilled Cheese in These Italian Grilled Cheese Sandwiches
og:description: Italian grilled cheese sandwiches are a gooey match made in heaven: three kinds of Italian deli meat, provolone, and buttery toasted bread.
Title: Italian Grilled Cheese Sandwiches
Author: Nick Evans
Description:
Italian Grilled Cheese Sandwiches Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 20 mins; Total Time: 30 mins; Servings: 4 sandwiches
Ingredients: 8 slices sandwich bread, 8 slices provolone cheese, 4 ounces Genoa salami, 4 ounces prosciutto, 2 ounces pepperoni, 1/2 cup fresh basil leaves, loosely packed, 2 tablespoons butter, 1 cup hot pickled cauliflower, chopped, 1/2 cup green olives(Castelvetrano), chopped, 1/4 cup banana peppers
Reviews: [{'name': 'Carol Heisey Howell', 'review': 'Loved your write-up, especially about the 2 and 4 yr. olds. :)'}, {'name': 'Justin', 'review': 'Ive been making these for years. You can put anything on a melt. I call them grilled cheese sands. But, it really is a melt. Got to put banana peppers in the melt and go with mayo on the outsides. My wife made a grilled cheese sandwich and kind of messed up and put mayo on the outsides. Happy accident! Try this, rotisserie chicken, slice of ham and swiss cheese. Chicken Cordon Blue in a melt! Awesome!'}, {'name': 'Rose Steele', 'review': "This is basically a Muffeletta melt. What a great idea. You can use olive salad (home made or jarred) instead of giardiniera. Can't wait to make it."}, {'name': 'Angelo Polazzon ', 'review': 'Excellent toasties made this way. All Italian'}, {'name': 'Linda ', 'review': 'Please prepare a recipe to print on ONE page, saving on ink and paper.'}]

og:title: Use Your Pantry Staples for This Special Canned Salmon Macaroni Salad
og:description: Made with canned salmon, this quick and easy lunch or dinner is ready in just about 30 minutes.
Title: Salmon Macaroni Salad
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Salmon Macaroni Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 20 mins; Total Time: 30 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 1/2 pound (about 2 cups) dry macaroni, Kosher salt, 2 (7-ounce) cans salmon, 1/2 cup mayonnaise (plus more to taste or for added smoothness), 1 teaspoon mustard, 1 teaspoon lemon zest, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1/3 cup chopped shallots, red onions, or green onions (with onion greens), 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley, 1 tablespoon chopped fresh dill (or 1/2 teaspoon dried dill), 2 ribs celery, chopped, Tabasco, to taste (we used about 10 drops), Freshly ground black pepper
Reviews: [{'name': 'Lori T', 'review': 'I make it often!'}, {'name': 'Donna Trimm Calk', 'review': 'Is it mustard powder or mustard like you put on your hotdog?'}, {'name': 'Taryn', 'review': "This was one of my favourite meals that my grandma used to make as a kid, and I've been wanting to make it for years but didn't have access to her recipe. Thank you so much for posting this! It tastes perfect :)"}, {'name': 'Beth K.', 'review': 'I love this salad and make it frequently. However, I now need to reduce the carbs in my food, particularly high glycemic index carbs. Do you think it would be tasty subbing cannellini beans for the macaroni? Or, other suggestions?'}, {'name': 'Beth K.', 'review': 'I love this salad, and make it regularly. However I am trying to reduce the carb content in the food I need, especially carbs with a high glycemic index. Do you think it would be good if I subbed in cannellini beans or similar for the macaroni? Or, other suggestions?'}]

og:title: If You Love Quesadillas, You Have to Try an Arizona Cheese Crisp
og:description: Arizona Cheese Crisps are open-faced quesadillas made with extra large, thin flour tortillas, toasted with butter and cheese, and served with strips of mild green chiles.
Title: Arizona Cheese Crisp
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Arizona Cheese Crisp Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 20 mins; Serving: 1 serving
Ingredients: One large, burrito-size (13-inch diameter or larger) flour tortilla, 1 tablespoon butter, 1/2 cup grated cheddar cheese, 1 or 2 roasted green chiles, peeled, seeded, cut into strips (optional)
Reviews: [{'name': 'David E. Roy, Ph.D.', 'review': 'Having grown up in Tucson, I remember these quesadillas with great fondness. I cannot remember the restaurant's name where I had the best of these, but it was on the way out of town going east.'}, {'name': 'Theresa Marik', 'review': "Why doesn't my tortilla get very crisp?"}, {'name': 'David Brooks', 'review': 'Born and raised in Phoenix 70 years ago. Ate cheese crisps all the time at various restaurants like La Cucaracha but the best is at El Bravo in Sunnyslope (north Phoenix). Don’t pass up the shredded beef tacos and especially the red chili burro enchilada style. Carmen and Lorraine Tofoya have ruled for 45+ years over 30 in same 7th st location. I’m in North Carolina now and really miss Sonoran Mexican food. It’s the best!'}, {'name': 'Luxornv', 'review': 'My grandmother used to make these when I visited on weekends when I was younger. Reading the comments jogged my memory that she said it originated from Garcias when they had previously lived in Phoenix in the 70s. I needed a recipe for these though because the appliance we had used to make these was broken and I just needed to dial in the temperature.'}, {'name': 'Kevin Sotomayor', 'review': 'Big Surf is on McClintock, not Scottsdale road'}]

og:title: Whip Up This Easy-To-Make White Bean and Tuna Salad Quickly
og:description: Simple tuna and white bean salad, a classic combination and so easy to make!
Title: White Bean and Tuna Salad
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
White Bean and Tuna Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 15 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 1 cup chopped red onions or shallots, The zest and juice of 1 lemon or 2 limes (can sub a tablespoon or two of cider vinegar), 2 (5- to 6-ounce) cans tuna packed in olive oil, 2 (15-ounce) cans cannellini or Great Northern white beans, rinsed and drained, 1/2 cup (loosely packed) chopped parsley or arugula, or 2 tablespoons thinly sliced mint, A few splashes Tabasco sauce, or 1 minced Serrano chili or 1 teaspoon red chili flakes, 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, Salt and more extra virgin olive oil, to taste
Reviews: [{'name': 'Lindsey', 'review': 'The salad was healthy- it helped me get my needed protein and fiber for the day. But it didn’t taste that great. I basically followed the recipe except added my homemade picked red onions as I thought it would make it a little jazzier. The parsley was an odd flavor add. Maybe it would have been better with some mayo or garlic/onion powder but as is, not yummy.'}, {'name': 'Hucho23', 'review': 'whenever I see Simply Recipes recipe esp when it hits on the top I am rest assured, that's all I will need. Been a fan for a long long time!'}, {'name': 'MB', 'review': 'So simple and delicious. I didn't have tuna in oil in the pantry, so just added good quality EVOO to taste.'}, {'name': 'K J R', 'review': 'Elise, I’ve been a Simply Recipes fan for close to 20 years! I made a very similar dish (adding pasta, capers, celery, and artichoke pesto) off the top of my head a few days ago, and only just now thought to look it up, so this recipe must have been lingering somewhere in my subconscious mind. I’ve always learned so much and made many, many delicious meals from Simply Recipes. Thank you for all you do!!'}, {'name': 'Ludmila V', 'review': 'Thank you so much for posting this recipe!'}]

og:title: How to Make the Perfect Tomato Sandwich, According to a Tomato-Obsessed Southerner
og:description: This perfect tomato sandwich recipe comes straight from the South and takes just five minutes to make. It features juicy slices of peak-season tomato, soft white sandwich bread, and tangy Duke’s mayonnaise for a classic summertime meal.
Title: How to Make the Perfect Tomato Sandwich, According to a Tomato-Obsessed Southerner
Author: Stephanie A Ganz
Description:
Perfect Tomato Sandwich Recipe (5 Minutes)
Prep Time: 5 mins; Total Time: 5 mins; Servings: 2 servings
Ingredients: 4 slices white sandwich bread, 4 teaspoons mayonnaise (preferably Duke’s), 1 perfectly ripe summer tomato (such as Beefsteak or Brandywine), sliced into 1-inch-thick slices, Kosher salt, Freshly ground black pepper, optional
Reviews: [{'name': 'Rebecca Boykin ', 'review': 'Yes I LOVE Tomato Sandwich.. I've always made them this exact way..Except for the Mayo..Growing up in California I'd never heard of Dukes.\nI use Best Foods\nThey are delicious'}, {'name': 'LizaJane', 'review': 'Good! I might add a little coarsely grated parmesan cheese.'}, {'name': 'Tina Blackburn ', 'review': 'Absolutely the best summer sandwich and even better if the tomatoes are fresh from the garden'}, {'name': 'Beachbum5', 'review': 'Finally, someone who actually knows about REAL tomato sandwiches. Nothing fru fru will do. Simple is BEST and allows the flavor to shine. Just don’t forget the salt. Pure AWESOMENESS!!'}, {'name': 'Trod Runyon', 'review': 'Absolutely right. I do lightly toast my white bread and then skim a bit of butter over it before adding the mayo. The taste of summer.'}]

og:title: Make Chopped Cheese—the NYC Bodega Staple—at Home
og:description: Make this beloved NYC sandwich at home with seasoned ground beef, American cheese, a hoagie roll, and your choice of toppings. It’s a filling handheld meal that will only take 30 minutes of your time.
Title: Chopped Cheese
Author: Nick Evans
Description:
Chopped Cheese Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 20 mins; Total Time: 30 mins; Servings: 6 servings; Yield: 6 sandwiches
Ingredients: 2 pounds (80/20 blend) ground beef, 1 white onion, chopped, 4 clove garlic, chopped, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper, 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce, 6 hoagie or bolillo rolls, 12 slices American cheese, 6 tablespoons mayonnaise, Shredded iceberg lettuce, for serving, Tomato slices, for serving
Reviews: [{'name': 'Deborah Moran', 'review': 'Perhaps the name being "chop" is because a lot of New Yorkers refer to ground beef as "chop meat" (or chopped meat). I did not know this until I dated and married a New Yorker.'}, {'name': 'lilmeme', 'review': 'Ok im bugging out rt now cuz i have lived in every main borough in NYC (except Staten Island) and every single chopped cheese i tried all tasted the same and ingredients were different than what was said here. In all the corner stores I’ve personally tried they only put the burger patties on the fryer with sazon on the burger maybe some salt with yellow American cheese and thats it. Obviously the lettuce tomato bun etc etc but the only seasoning is sazon and salt. Id love to know where i can fond your type cus it sounds much more delicious. I personally find that they put too much sazon or salt and it ends up being too salty for me so id love to try the way stated above'}, {'name': 'BoomingEchoes', 'review': "Not saying I hate the theorizing in the history section, but I grew up in a small Westchester town with 2 of the best texas chili places ever, and my favorite comfort food from either was a chilli cheese burger wedge with ketchup. Reason I bring this up is the fact that it's completely possible to put a full burger patties on a sub roll without chopping them up.\n\nThis isn't meant to distract from chop cheese. They're awesome. It's just to point out how... Off... The theory is of why you'd chop it up."}, {'name': 'Jackie', 'review': 'A chopped up cheeseburger'}, {'name': 'Jessica', 'review': 'What kind of hoagie roll is that?'}]

og:title: Melty, Crunchy, and Gooey: It’s Time to Make a Vegan Patty Melt
og:description: Perfectly toasted bread, melted cheese, sweet caramelized onions, and a thin plant-based patty—all dripping in tangy Thousand Island dressing. Make this vegan patty melt recipe stat!
Title: Vegan Patty Melt
Author: Julie & Amy Luxemberg
Description:
Vegan Patty Melt Recipe (with Homemade Thousand Island)
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 30 mins; Total Time: 40 mins; Servings: 2 servings; Yield: 2/3 cup dressing, 2 patty melts
Ingredients: 1 large white or yellow onion, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar, 1/2 cup vegan mayonnaise, 2 tablespoons ketchup, 1 tablespoon dill relish, 1/2 teaspoon pickle juice, 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/4 teaspoon sweet paprika, 1/8 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 2 Impossible Burger Patties or other plant-based burger patties, thawed overnight in the refrigerator if frozen, 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard, optional, 1 tablespoon salted vegan butter or olive oil, 4 slices rye bread, 4 slices smoked provolone, Swiss, or cheddar vegan cheese, 2 tablespoons vegan Thousand Island, divided, 1/2 cup caramelized onions, divided, Sliced pickles, optional
Reviews: [{'name': 'Dan S', 'review': 'Tastes almost exactly like a classic patty melt. Love the homemade dressing! We also dipped fries in it.'}]

og:title: Turn Leftover Ham Is the Tastiest Ham Salad For Sandwiches
og:description: This easy ham salad is a great way to use leftover ham. It features diced ham, hard-boiled eggs, pickle relish, mayo, onion, celery, bell pepper, and mustard.
Title: Ham Salad
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Ham Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 10 mins; Servings: 3
to 4 sandwiches; Yield: 3 cups
Ingredients: 2 cups finely diced or ground ham (about 3/4 pound), 3 large hard-boiled eggs, chopped, 1/4 cup sweet pickle relish, 1/4 cup mayonnaise, 2 tablespoons minced green onion, 2 tablespoons minced celery, 2 tablespoons minced red bell pepper, 1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley, 2 teaspoons Dijon mustard, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, Large pinch cayenne, optional, Salt and black pepper, to taste
Reviews: [{'name': 'Marguerite Subranni Rigby', 'review': 'I used all the ingredients, but adjusted amounts for less leftover ham. I blitzed everything in stages in the food processor, starting with the ham and ending with the eggs. Really good ham salad!'}, {'name': 'Julia', 'review': 'I halved the Dijon and relish and added apples.'}, {'name': 'Dave', 'review': 'Great! I added a couple of tablespoons of maple syrup (grade B) and it was a terrific "mystery" ingredient. Goes well with ham.'}, {'name': 'El', 'review': "Excellent! The lemon juice and cayenne really lift the flavor of the salad. This one's a keeper!"}, {'name': 'Chris', 'review': 'I like all of the ingredients. \nI used two eggs, and less ham. I added some paprika. I think I added too much relish, I should have measured it.'}]

og:title: If You Like Pâté, It's Time You Tried a Homemade Liverwurst Sandwich
og:description: This classic liverwurst sandwich features German liverwurst pork sausage on your choice of bread with lettuce and mayonnaise. Don't forget the onions!
Title: Liverwurst Sandwich
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Liverwurst Sandwich Recipe
Prep Time: 3 mins; Total Time: 3 mins; Serving: 1 sandwich
Ingredients: 2 slices liverwurst, 2 slices white or rye bread, Lettuce, Mayonnaise, Pickled red onions, optional
Reviews:
[{'name': 'greeniebees', 'review': 'My perfect liverwurst sandwich:
*NIEDLOV'S BAKERY Rye Bread,
*Margarine (on both bread slices) 
*Any Good Liverwurst 1/4" thick smeared on one bread slice.
*Lowenserf Extra Hot Mustard & American Yellow Mustard 1/2 & 1/2 spread lightly on 2nd bread slice
*chopped onions (sort of heavy)
*Good shredded Parmesan cheese.
Try it you'll love it. (I make my own poultry liverwurst)'}, {'name': 'Bruce', 'review': 'For me gotta be pumpernickel bread, 
 Onions and yellow mustard! Mother Goose is a brand my old aunt used to swear by!'}, {'name': 'Bubbles', 'review': "My husband and I loved Liverwurst, but our kids hated it. He and I also loved calves liver, which the kids hated. They do to this day, just don't know what is good! I hope Liverwurst is served in Heaven, because I am still loving it down here and pray he is getting his! I have it sliced at my HEB Grocers in Texas, they do a great job."}, {'name': 'mike “M&M” mckeown', 'review': 'When I read there title it said mayo, yuck! Then I read the post and it says mustard, yes! Then the ingredient list said mayo, yuck!
The creamy pâté and mild flavor of liverwurst needs the acidity of mustard to set it off, not the mild tangy creaminess of mayo. Mayo is too heavy for the already heavy pâté.
Personally I like liverwurst, mustard, onions, lettuce, and tomato on a multi grain.'}, {'name': 'Philip', 'review': "I would find it difficult to have a Liverwurst sandwich without the onions pickled or fresh. I have added some Limburger just because. There was a time when a sandwich like this was the preferred sandwich of hard working men in cities like New York and Philadelphia. At one point in history Limburger was a staple in every house. It was like having butter. In the 30's one can only imagine the discussions that took place at lunchtime as they consumed their sandwiches and had a bottle of good German beer (home made). My Dad shared a story about going to a Catholic Boys School in Jersey City and how the German Nuns would drink beer at lunch."}]

og:title: Cue the Nostalgia With These Homemade Pizza Bagels
og:description: You can assemble and bake these deeply nostalgic pizza bagels in almost the same time it takes to pull the frozen kind out of the freezer.
Title: Homemade Pizza Bagels
Author: Nick Evans
Description:
Homemade Pizza Bagels Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 20 mins; Servings: 4 servings; Yield: 8 pizza bagels
Ingredients: 4 full-sized plain bagels, halved, 1/2 cup pizza sauce (store-bought), 8 ounces shredded mozzarella cheese, 4 ounces mini pepperoni, Dried basil, for garnish
Reviews: [{'name': 'Chase', 'review': 'I love using Dave's Killer Bread, they are already perfectly seasoned for this!'}, {'name': 'Spike', 'review': "I made an oops I cooked them for 18 minutes vs 8 - 10 minutes at 400F vs 350F, I guess I should read better and wear my glasses. But, hey they turned out great. I used a heavy cast iron griddle and probably added 20% more toppings - whatever I had as leftover in the refrigerator. I'll be making these more often and a good snack for football! It's a keeper."}, {'name': 'Amy ', 'review': 'Love making bagel pizza never had frozen one when I was a child my favorite bagel is asiago cheese bagel thank you for the recipe'}, {'name': 'Kaden Greene', 'review': 'What can be a side dish for the Homemade Pizza Bagels?'}]

og:title: The Secret to the Best Ever Tuna Salad Sandwich
og:description: Our tuna salad sandwich recipe has a secret ingredient that will change everything you thought you knew about tuna salad, plus it's easy, cheap, healthy and might already be in your fridge!
Title: Tuna Salad Sandwich
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Tuna Salad Sandwich Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 10 mins; Servings: 2 servings; Yield: 1
to 2 sandwiches
Ingredients: 1 (5- or 6-ounce) can tuna packed in olive oil, undrained, 1/3 cup cottage cheese, 2 tablespoons mayonnaise, 1/4 cup finely chopped red onion, 1 celery stalk, finely chopped, 1 tablespoon capers, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, A pinch or two fresh dill, chopped, 2 tablespoons fresh parsley, minced, 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard, 2 slices bread, lightly toasted, Lettuce, optional, Sliced tomatoes, optional
Reviews: [{'name': 'M', 'review': 'Fave tuna salad recipe, hands down. We sub shallots for red onion and it takes the bite down a notch. We love it so much….that even if I triple the recipe, it’s gone in one sitting for a family of four.'}, {'name': 'Jim Haertjens', 'review': 'big money saver here....for those looking to pinch pennies.'}, {'name': 'punter58', 'review': 'Sensationally clean and filling top up for lunch. Don't know why some would add cheese and make it a melt but it takes all kinds of palates to make the world go round'}, {'name': 'Robert', 'review': 'If you have a simple taste all I use in mine is drained tuna, quartered bread and butter pickles, and mayonnaise.'}, {'name': 'LizS', 'review': "Really delicious. I used Greek yogurt in place of mayo, dried herbs (1/3 measure as stronger) then topped with cheddar and grilled to make it an open-faced melt. I don't know what is giving it that extra lovely oomph - possibly the lemon - but immensely enjoying it. New post-workout indulgence. Thank you!"}]

og:title: Cheesy Shrimp Quesadillas Are a Weeknight Win
og:description: These quick and easy shrimp quesadillas are oozing with melted Monterey Jack cheese and packed with pan-seared shrimp, onions, cilantro, and avocado.
Title: Shrimp Quesadilla
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Shrimp Quesadilla Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 25 mins; Serving: 1 serving
Ingredients: 1/4 pound of medium-small raw shrimp, peeled and deveined, 1/4 teaspoon chipotle powder, Pinch salt, Pinch ground black pepper, 1 tablespoon lime or lemon juice, 2 1/2 teaspoons extra virgin olive oil (divided, 2 teaspoons and 1/2 teaspoon), 1 tablespoon chopped red onion, 1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro, plus more for garnish, Salt and pepper, 2 medium flour tortillas, 1/2 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese, 1/4 avocado, sliced, Dollop sour cream or crema fresca
Reviews: [{'name': 'Gary Ashman', 'review': 'Any way to lower the calorie count, which seems high?'}, {'name': 'Kristen Chang', 'review': 'Marinating for 10 minutes ruined the shrimp! They began to “cook” right away but I followed your directions. What a waste of ingredients as I ended up tossing it all. Just sautéing the shrimp in the oil with the spices added during cooking would’ve been way better.'}, {'name': 'Paula Altz', 'review': 'Very yummmy! Used up all my leftovers from shrimp tacos. I made two meals for the price of one! Loved the tip to cook the tortillas till they puffed up before adding the filling. Thanks for the great recipe.'}, {'name': 'Barbara Ford', 'review': "Love it, with slight moderation on my part... I put a little mayonnaise with salsa mixed and brushed on both sides before putting cheese or anything else on cooked tortillas, and build from there... It just lights up my world!!! It is now my Comfort food if I'm having a bed day or I just can't get to sleep, To be really honest any excuse for work... LOL"}, {'name': 'Magalys Perez', 'review': "My kids and I loved this!! Everything tasted fresh and super quick to make!! \nI've been a big fan of Simply Recipes since 2008 and enjoy most of the recipes. I always get super big compliments and wows when I make the caramelized onions/Gorgonzola tart. It's out of this world, and it tastes like I'm a superstar in the kitchen! \nThanks, Elise and Co"}]

og:title: How to Make Easy Korean Steamed Eggs In The Microwave
og:description: Gyeran jjim cooked in the microwave is the fastest and simplest way to get light, fluffy, and custardy steamed eggs. This 5-ingredient Korean dish is an easy meal or side any time of day!
Title: Gyeran Jjim (Korean Steamed Eggs)
Author: Joy Cho
Description:
Gyeran Jjim (Korean Steamed Eggs) Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 5 mins; Total Time: 10 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 6 large eggs, 1 1/8 teaspoons kosher salt, 3/4 teaspoon instant dashi powder like Ajinomoto Hondashi, 3 imitation crab sticks, cut crosswise into 1/2-inch pieces, 1 1/2 cups water, 1 scallion, root trimmed and diced
Reviews: [{'name': 'Eric', 'review': 'Can you cook this in the oven? If so, how long and at what oven temp?'}]

og:title: Master the French Omelette with This Recipe!
og:description: With a little practice and just the right amount of confidence, you can master the process.
Title: French Omelette
Author: Sally Vargas
Description:
French Omelette Recipe
Prep Time: 3 mins; Cook Time: 5 mins; Total Time: 8 mins; Serving: 1 serving
Ingredients: 3 large eggs, Pinch salt, Pinch white pepper, 1 tablespoon unsalted butter, Finely chopped chives or parsley, for garnish
Reviews: [{'name': 'David Downing ', 'review': 'More information in the well timed and beautifully taken photos than the text.\nI include a "bit of water" while making omelets, yeilding an even softer end result.'}, {'name': 'Coco M', 'review': 'I am the only one in my family who enjoys the “baveuse” texture of French omelets, so I just ate this myself. It was simple and really good, and a very fast breakfast for something that can seem so intimidating. Even if it doesn’t come out perfectly shaped, it’s still yummy. Delicate, light yellow shell of egg surrounding creamy curds. I’ll have to have this breakfast more often and work on my technique in the process.'}, {'name': 'Amy31', 'review': 'Yummy!'}]

og:title: The Easiest Crunchy, Spicy Noodles You’re Sleeping On
og:description: Got 15 minutes and a craving for something spicy, crunchy, and carby? These noodles with spicy cucumbers and as much chili crisp as your heart desires fit the bill.
Title: Noodles with Cucumbers and A Lot of Chili Crisp
Author: Myo Quinn
Description:
Noodles with Cucumbers and A Lot of Chili Crisp Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 10 mins; Rest Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 30 mins; Servings: 3 servings
Ingredients: 4 Persian cucumbers (about 12 ounces total), cut into 1/4-inch rounds, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, 6 ounces dry ramen, rice, or soba noodles, 3 tablespoons chili crisp, plus more to taste, 2 tablespoons toasted sesame oil, 1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds, 2 teaspoons sugar, 1 large clove garlic, minced
Reviews:
[{'name': 'brushjl', 'review': 'Excellent, cucumbers, noodles and chili crisp. A trifecta!'}, {'name': 'Daniel Waylonis', 'review': 'Totally love this. My only suggestion is to put the sliced cucumbers in a container, salt them heavily, and let them drain water out overnight. Wash them the next day and continue with the process.'}, {'name': 'Jenny', 'review': 'Yummy but especially love the ease and easily adaptable!'}, {'name': 'Paul Daugherty', 'review': "The temperatures in Central Virginia are going up to 90 this week. Made a batch over the weekend for my stay-in-air-conditioning lunches. I used Fly by Jing Sichuan Chili Crisp and Sun ramen noodles. It's a keeper. Myo's soba noodle recipe also piqued my interest. Thinking dinner with sous vide shrimp.


Thank you for posting this recipe"}, {'name': 'Heather Blosser Herschberger', 'review': 'I have something in my refrigerator called Hot Oil. Is that the same as chili crisp?'}]

og:title: This Shakshuka Recipe Has a Trick for Perfectly Cooked Eggs Every Time
og:description: Shakshuka is an easy-to-make recipe where eggs simmered in tomato sauce are seasoned with cumin and smoked paprika. Top it with cilantro, feta, and olives then serve it for breakfast, lunch, or dinner.
Title: Shakshuka with Feta, Olives, and Peppers
Author: Sally Vargas
Description:
Shakshuka with Feta, Olives, and Peppers Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 30 mins; Total Time: 50 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 teaspoon smoked paprika, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1/4 teaspoon Maras or Aleppo pepper flakes, or 1/8 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes, 1 large yellow onion, halved and thinly sliced, 2 cloves garlic, thinly sliced, 1 red bell pepper, seeded and thinly sliced, 1 yellow bell pepper, seeded and thinly sliced, 1 can (28 ounces) whole peeled tomatoes, preferably San Marzano, 1/2 teaspoon salt, or to taste, 4 ounces feta cheese, crumbled, 1/3 cup pitted Kalamata or other olives in brine, 4 large eggs, 1/4 bunch cilantro, leaves coarsely chopped (for garnish)
Reviews: [{'name': 'Deborah', 'review': "This was delicious! I was inspired to try it after hearing Gal Gadot say how much she loved to eat shakshuka with olives and feta. Thank you! It's a keeper!"}, {'name': 'mdcomm', 'review': "Thank you so much for this recipe, Sally! I made it last night, had it for breakfast this morning, and I was in heaven. It's SOOOO good!!! I know shakshuka from my marriage to a Tunisian, and this recipe is very close to what I remember. We didn't add the feta or olives, but those make it more delicious and are a perfect complement. I like this dish spicy, and have harissa from Tunisia (from Trader Joe's) but it isn't nearly as spicy as the harissa we used in the past, which came from an Arab grocery store. So I just used a lot of it, plus quite a bit of Italian Bomba hot pepper sauce (also from TJs). I am going to make it again tomorrow! This may be my new everlasting breakfast. [PS Tunisians eat this dish at all hours of the day; it is a favorite standby of everybody. We had plenty of shakshuka for dinner...]"}]

og:title: The 3-Ingredient Egg Salad I Make Every Week
og:description: My 3-ingredient egg salad is so easy and delicious, and it’s great for meal prepping. Serve it as a sandwich, on a salad, with crackers, and more.
Title: The 3-Ingredient Egg Salad I Make Every Week
Author: Stephanie A Ganz
Description: The 3-Ingredient Egg Salad Recipe I Make Every Week
Ingredients: 6 large eggs, 1/4 cup mayonnaise, 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard, Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

og:title: The 4-Ingredient Chicken Salad I Can’t Stop Eating
og:description: For a super flavorful chicken salad that’s ready in minutes, make this recipe. It just takes four ingredients for a lunch you’ll want to eat again and again.
Title: The 4-Ingredient Chicken Salad I Can’t Stop Eating
Author: Sheela Prakash
Description: The 4-Ingredient Chicken Salad I Can’t Stop Eating
Ingredients: 1/4 cup mayonnaise, 3 tablespoons chili crisp, 1 pound (about 3 packed cups) shredded cooked chicken, 1 large English cucumber, chopped (about 2 1/2 cups), 1/2 cup chopped cilantro (optional), Salt, to taste

og:title: Hot Ham and Cheese Sliders For the Win!
og:description: These warm, cheesy hot ham and cheese sliders are perfect for a crowd and a delightful simple lunch that comes together in less than a half hour.
Title: Hot Ham and Cheese Sliders
Author: Ross Yoder
Description:
Hot Ham and Cheese Sliders Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 25 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings; Yield: 12 sliders
Ingredients: 3 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened, 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard, 2 teaspoons minced shallots, 2 teaspoons chopped parsley, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1 (12-count package) Hawaiian slider rolls, 1/2 pound sliced Swiss cheese, about 12 slices, 1/2 pound thin-sliced deli ham

og:title: Skip the Drive-Thru and Make Taco Bell's Crunchwrap Supreme at Home
og:description: Recreate Taco Bell's iconic Crunchwrap Supreme at home—it's incredibly easy and arguably better than the drive-thru version.
Title: Copycat Crunchwrap Supreme
Author: Devan Grimsrud
Description:
Copycat Crunchwrap Supreme Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 20 mins; Total Time: 40 mins; Servings: 4 servings; Yield: 4 Crunchwraps
Ingredients: 1 pound lean ground beef, 3 tablespoons taco seasoning, 2 tablespoons water, 5 large (12-inch) flour tortillas, 1/3 cup store-bought nacho cheese or queso, 4 tostada shells or 1 cup tortilla chips, 1/3 cup sour cream, 1 1/2 cups shredded iceberg lettuce, 1/2 cup chopped tomatoes, 1 cup shredded cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese, 4 teaspoons vegetable oil, Hot sauce, for serving
Reviews: [{'name': 'Laurie Dodd', 'review': 'Yummy! I cook mine in a nonstick pan without adding any oil. I like putting a small ceramic plate on top to weight it down while it cooks, using that to flip it. Instead of buying tostadas, I just layer tortilla chips for the crunchy level. A new favorite!'}, {'name': 'Karole J. Grace', 'review': 'Complicated to make, 1st time, but delicious, and I get faster with each attempt!'}, {'name': 'Betty', 'review': 'This was easy, delicious and surprisingly fun to make and eat. I added a little extra cheese but overall I had fun making it and the family loved them.'}, {'name': 'Tracey ', 'review': 'These always turn out fantastic! Key thing to remember...do not over stuff them, or they fall apart when you try to flip them.'}, {'name': 'Tamara woop', 'review': 'Yummy. We made these. We made the quest since it’s super quick and easy to make. This was delicious. Yummmm'}]

og:title: Major Lunchbox Upgrade: Chickpea Panini
og:description: Coming up short on lunchbox inspiration? This chickpea panini is for kids and grown-ups alike—a one-bowl affair of chickpeas, lemon juice, shredded carrot, and goat cheese, tucked into a crusty baguette.
Title: Chickpea Panini
Author: Katie Morford, MS, RD
Description:
Chickpea Panini Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 10 mins; Servings: 3 servings; Yield: 3 sandwiches
Ingredients: 1 (15-ounce) can chickpeas, 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, plus more for assembling, 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, plus more for assembling, 1/4 teaspoon ground cumin, 3 ounces soft goat cheese (chèvre), 1 loosely packed cup grated carrot (from 1 medium carrot), 1 (18-inch) baguette, 1 1/2 cups lightly packed arugula, Salt to taste

og:title: These Loaded Veggie Sandwiches Are Anything But Boring
og:description: Make the most of summer produce—juicy tomatoes, crisp cucumbers, crunchy sprouts, and creamy avocado—with this loaded veggie sandwich. It’s easy to customize!
Title: Loaded Veggie Sandwich
Author: Laurel Randolph
Description:
Loaded Veggie Sandwich Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 10 mins; Servings: 2 servings; Yield: 2 sandwiches
Ingredients: 2 medium Persian cucumbers, 1 large heirloom tomato, 4 (1/2- to 3/4-inch) slices rustic sourdough or country bread, 2 to 3 teaspoons mayonnaise, 2 to 3 teaspoons stone-ground mustard, 1 medium ripe avocado, 1 cup broccoli or alfalfa sprouts, 2 pinches kosher salt, 2 pinches freshly ground black pepper, 1/4 cup pickled red onions, 2 large butter lettuce leaves, 2 to 4 slices (2 ounces) sharp cheddar cheese
Reviews: [{'name': 'Tara Lee Hammer', 'review': 'Great! People are not aware how tasty and delicious and filling these veggies sandwiches are! They are fabulous. More, please'}]

og:title: The Secret to a Better Chicken Salad Will Surprise You
og:description: This family favorite chicken salad has a secret ingredient that makes all the difference.
Title: Classic Chicken Salad
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Easy Chicken Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Poaching chicken: 20 mins; Total Time: 30 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 1 pound raw boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 2 1/2-inch chunks (or 2 to 3 cups cooked chicken meat), 2 ribs celery, chopped, 1/2 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped, 4 to 6 green olives, pitted and minced, 1/4 cup chopped red onion, 1/2 to 1 apple, cored and chopped, 1/3 head iceberg lettuce, sliced and chopped, 5 tablespoons mayonnaise, 1 tablespoon plum preserves, or any sweet berry preserve (or a lesser amount of honey), 2 teaspoons freshly squeezed lemon juice, Salt and pepper to taste
Reviews: [{'name': 'Edmund Perez', 'review': 'turned out great!'}, {'name': 'Bob', 'review': 'Great recipe! However, we switched out the white meat for dark: we always use thighs for chicken salad. It has a much nicer texture. Normally we add cranberry sauce to our chicken salad, but the plums add a more interesting flavor!'}, {'name': 'Brian', 'review': 'I make a sauce of mayonnaise and yogurt, mixed with some celery seed, curry powder, and a bit of freshly ground black. I toss together diced chicken that I have cooked on the grill, diced red onion, diced celery and some raisins. Spread on some fresh multi-grain bread, topped with bib lettuce, and you have yourself a yummy sandwich.'}, {'name': 'brushjl', 'review': "I'll take chicken salad anyway I can get it. This was good, but I've had better."}, {'name': 'Cusie', 'review': 'I used canned chicken, broke into not in cubes but big chunks, and grapes, came out wonderful!'}]

og:title: This Make-Ahead Salad Is Delicious (and So Affordable)
og:description: Julia Turshen's carrot salad recipe is easy, delicious, and perfect for when you need a make-ahead salad.
Title: This Make-Ahead Salad Is Delicious (and So Affordable)
Author: Julia Turshen
Description:
A Great Carrot Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 10 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil, 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, 1 teaspoon honey (or maple syrup), 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, 4 large carrots (3/4 to 1 pound), peeled, sliced into thin coins (or coarsely grated), A large handful of fresh flat-leaf parsley (or any soft green herb), roughly chopped, 1/3 cup golden raisins, 2/3 cup pitted green olives, preferably Castelvetrano, roughly chopped, 1/3 cup roasted almonds (salted or not, up to you!), roughly chopped

og:title: Moroccan Grated Carrot and Beet Salad
og:description: Moroccan shredded carrot and fresh beet salad with raisins, cumin, cinnamon, and paprika, and an honey lemon dressing.
Title: Moroccan Grated Carrot and Beet Salad
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Moroccan Grated Carrot and Beet Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 15 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 2 cups grated carrots (from about 3 carrots), 1 cup grated fresh beets (from about 1 medium-sized peeled beet), 1/2 cup golden raisins, 1/2 teaspoon paprika (sweet, not hot), 1/4 teaspoon ground cumin, 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon, Small pinch salt, Small pinch cayenne, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 2 teaspoons honey, 2 tablespoons sliced fresh mint leaves
Reviews: [{'name': 'Minda Chow', 'review': 'WOW. How something so delicious and refreshing could be so healthy for you. I had “old” red and orange beets sitting in my fridge and it tasted just fine with the fresh carrots. As w another reviewer, I would lessen the cumin and increase the cinnamon. I’d also like to try it with half orange juice. Thank you for sharing such a wonderful recipe. Recipes like this would make me eat more veggies!'}, {'name': 'David Leyland', 'review': 'Really enjoyed this salad when I served it with a roast cauliflower tagine! Thank you!'}, {'name': 'Laurel', 'review': 'Okay stupid question...are you shredding raw beets or cooked?'}, {'name': 'Sandy', 'review': 'Sorry, but to me, this salad tasted like dirt. I am not a fussy eater, but had to toss this one out-maybe it was the older beet I used-yes, it was raw-followed your recipe too, but it still tasted like dirt to me.'}, {'name': 'Urvi Sukul Singh', 'review': 'Really nice.Such a simple recipe yet so healthy and refreshing.All the ingredients were easily available, except that I used golden syrup in place of honey and it turned out well.'}]

og:title: This 4-Ingredient Carrot Salad is a French Favorite
og:description: This classic French-style carrot salad recipe is made with just four ingredients. It's one of the easiest salad recipes to prepare and is terrific for outdoor gatherings.
Title: Classic Carrot Salad With Apples, Raisins, and Mayo
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Classic Carrot Salad Recipe (4 Ingredients)
Prep Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 15 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 3 to 4 cups freshly grated carrots (from 4 to 6 medium-sized carrots), 1/2 to 1 cup raisins (regular, golden, or a mix), 1 large apple, (peeled or not, your preference) cored and chopped, 1/4 to 1/3 cup mayonnaise
Reviews: [{'name': 'Fogle Kathy', 'review': 'I used golden raisins, much sweeter and added an 1/2T of honey!'}, {'name': 'Ethan Carroll', 'review': 'Was pretty good'}, {'name': 'Eleanor Cummings', 'review': 'I add crushed pineapple to mine; my sister adds chopped orange segments.'}, {'name': 'Kristine Phillips', 'review': 'Yum!'}, {'name': 'brushjl', 'review': "Great simple salad. I used Japanese mayonnaise, cuz that's my new thing. But the texture and sweet apply and raisin additions were delicious."}]

og:title: Festive Beet Citrus Salad with Kale and Pistachios
og:description: Healthy and Colorful Beet and Kale Salad! Paleo and vegan, with red and golden beets, blood orange slices, kale, and toasted pistachios.
Title: Festive Beet Citrus Salad with Kale and Pistachios
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Festive Beet Citrus Salad with Kale and Pistachios Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 75 mins; Marinating: 60 mins; Total Time: 2 hrs 35 mins; Servings: 8
to 10 servings
Ingredients: 6 to 10 large beets (about 4 to 5 pounds), a mix of red, pink, and golden, 2 to 3 blood oranges (or Cara Cara or navel oranges or a mixture), 1 bunch kale (lacinato or dinosaur kale if available), center ribs removed, leaves thinly sliced, 1 cup roasted pistachios, roughly chopped, 1/4 cup chopped fresh mint leaves, 3 tablespoons chopped Italian parsley, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1/2 cup good quality extra virgin olive oil, 6 tablespoons seasoned rice vinegar (or unseasoned rice vinegar plus 2 teaspoons of sugar), Zest 1 orange, Zest 1 lemon, 2 tablespoons capers, coarsely chopped, 1/2 teaspoon salt, Freshly ground black peppe, to taste
Reviews: [{'name': 'Mark Anderson', 'review': "I thought that 4 to 5 pounds of beets was too much, but it wasn't. I thought it would be way too much salad for six, and I was wrong about that too. This is a great salad--clean, crisp, and savory. And the leftovers (if you're lucky) make a great lunch."}, {'name': 'Tushar', 'review': 'I love how you use Kale in this - we use it with Citrus fruits, Gorgonzola and Walnuts: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9Ey5usZmw5Y'}, {'name': 'RosSumiati', 'review': 'I read this recipe, and find the Roasted Beets with Balsamic Glaze recipe too, perfect twins for me. Thank you, best regards'}]

og:title: Orange and Beet Salad
og:description: Brighten you day with this colorful beet salad with sliced beets, navel oranges, red onions, arugula in a light vinaigrette.
Title: Orange and Beet Salad
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Orange and Beet Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 45 mins; Total Time: 55 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 1 bunch beets, leaves removed (save them for beet greens!) - about 4 or 5 medium sized, scrubbed clean, 2 large naval oranges, peels cut off with a small small knife and sliced, 1/2 bunch arugula leaves, cleaned, and any thick stems removed, Several thin slices of red onion, 1/4 cup chopped walnuts, optional, 3 tablespoons white wine vinegar, 1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil, 1/4 teaspoon dried mustard, Salt and pepper, to taste
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Linda Grimes', 'review': 'Beautiful and delicious salad...I made a small change...added some thinly sliced raw fennel. Love the crunch and texture.'}, {'name': 'gil', 'review': "

Can you freeze cooked beets?

"}, {'name': 'Beau Smith', 'review': '

Yum! Made this salad tonight... it was so good. Highly recommended.

'}, {'name': 'Will Capellaro', 'review': "

"}, {'name': 'Cindy', 'review': "

"}]

og:title: Jazz Up Your Arugula Salad With Sweet Beets and Tangy Goat Cheese
og:description: The perfect salad: Arugula, beets and goat cheese is dressed in a simple lemon vinaigrette and finished with toasted walnuts.
Title: Arugula Salad With Beets and Goat Cheese
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Arugula Salad with Beets and Goat Cheese Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cooking the Beets: 60 mins; Total Time: 70 mins; Servings: 2 servings
Ingredients: 2 medium beets, cooked (roasted* or boiled**) until a fork easily goes in one (about an hour), peeled, diced into bite-sized pieces, 2 handfuls (about 2.5 ounces) fresh baby arugula, 4 tablespoons goat cheese (about 1.5 ounces), 1/4 cup roughly chopped toasted walnuts, 3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, 1 1/2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1/4 teaspoon dry powdered mustard, 1/2 teaspoon sugar, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon pepper
Reviews: [{'name': 'Kris Moore', 'review': 'Can I use picketed beets instead ?'}, {'name': 'Laura', 'review': 'Pretty good, I used canned beets. \nThe dressing is delicious.'}, {'name': 'Delores', 'review': 'What happen to putting the red onions in the salad. Was on the shopping list, but instruction to put in the salad.'}, {'name': 'giantsfan', 'review': 'delicious combination of ingredients. this is the star of the meal.'}, {'name': 'jo.m.bradley', 'review': 'Love this combination and add pomegranate seeds if any are on hand. Great flavor, texture and mouth experience. Yummy.'}]

og:title: Orange Blossom Carrot Salad
og:description: Middle Eastern carrot salad! Shredded carrots and golden raisins dressed with honey, lemon and orange blossom water.
Title: Orange Blossom Carrot Salad
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Orange Blossom Carrot Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 15 mins; Servings: 6
to 8 servings
Ingredients: 1 pound carrots (with small cores), peeled and coarsely grated, 1/2 cup golden or crimson raisins, 1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil, 2 tablespoons honey, 2 tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons freshly juiced lemon juice, 2 tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons orange flower water, 3/4 teaspoon ground ginger, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, or more to taste, Salt and pepper, lightly sprinkled to taste, Fresh mint, chopped, for garnish
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Deborah01', 'review': "I am trying to eat healthier, but don't like raw carrots. This recipe was so good that I saved it for future meals and ate a ton of raw carrots!. I had no orange blossom water, so used orange juice. It worked beautifully!"}, {'name': 'Jess', 'review': "

I also like to use English lavender (it's sweeter than others) instead of orange flower. And carrot salad is even more delicious with some sour cream or yogurt mixed in!

"}, {'name': 'Georgia', 'review': '

I like all kinds of carrot salad, but my favorite is fresh grated carrots, stir in well drained crushed pineapple and sprinkle a little sugar over. No mayo or anything else. Very simple. Sometimes for variety I also stir in raisins.

Sounds like the other carrot salad we have on the site. ~Elise

'}, {'name': 'Katie', 'review': '

I made this salad yesterday for lunch today, and it was delicious. The orange blossom aroma fragranced my kitchen beautifully. I substituted dried cranberries for raisins ('cause I like 'em better) and it worked really well. Thanks for sharing the recipe! I think I'll try the rose petal flan next.

'}, {'name': 'Ally', 'review': '

This was quick to fix and quite delicious! The carrots came pre-grated in a zippy bag from the store so I just mixed everything in the bag. Didn't dirty anything but measuring spoons - my kind of "cooking!"

As a diabetic, I'm always looking for quick and taste tempting ways to get more veges every day. Thank you so much!

'}]

og:title: Jeweled Carrot Salad with Apple and Pomegranate
og:description: Shredded carrot salad with apples, pomegranate seeds, raisins, craisins, mayo, lime juice, and honey.
Title: Jeweled Carrot Salad with Apple and Pomegranate
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Jeweled Carrot Salad with Apple and Pomegranate Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 15 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 2 cups freshly grated carrots (from 2 to 3 large carrots), 1 large sweet apple, peeled, cored, chopped, 1 tablespoon freshly squeezed lime juice, 2 teaspoons honey, 2 tablespoons mayonnaise, 1/4 cup raisins, 1/4 cup craisins, 1/2 cup pomegranate seeds
Reviews: [{'name': 'Beth C.', 'review': 'A new favorite! So much better than the mayo laden version I remember'}, {'name': 'Ginger', 'review': 'It was great, but I wondered about using plain yogurt instead of mayo?\nThanks!'}, {'name': 'Janice', 'review': "This is a great winter-time salad. I try, as much as possible, to cook seasonally and still have carrots and apples in storage from my garden. It's April so I didn't have pomegranate but the salad was still very good. This serves at least 6-8 at my house and we think it's good the next day as well. Thank you for a variation on carrot raisin salad."}, {'name': 'Ambar', 'review': 'Great recipe! Thank You!'}, {'name': 'stacey', 'review': 'i know it says serve immediately, but i wanted to make this salad and bring to a potluck. would it not keep if i made it the night before?'}]

og:title: Love Avocado? Then You'll Love This Avocado Beet Salad with Citrus Vinaigrette
og:description: Simple and healthy, this beet and avocado salad is sprinkled with pistachios and drizzled with a citrusy vinaigrette!
Title: Avocado Beet Salad with Citrus Vinaigrette
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Avocado Beet Salad with Citrus Vinaigrette Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 40 mins; Total Time: 60 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 4 medium beets (any color), green tops removed, beets scrubbed clean, 1 just-ripe avocado, 4 ounces mixed green lettuces, 2 tablespoons pistachios, chopped, 1 tablespoon minced shallot, 2 tablespoons rice vinegar (unseasoned), 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice, 1 tablespoon fresh orange juice, 2 teaspoons lemon zest, 1 teaspoon orange zest, Pinch salt, 1/3 cup good quality extra virgin olive oil
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Rhona', 'review': 'I added some honey as one reviewer wrote and thought it was a great addition to the dressing, along with a little Dijon mustard. I used butter lettuce and some beet greens, and a bit of frisée, for the salad. As long as I was juicing an orange, I also used some segments in the salad. A very nice dish!'}, {'name': 'Sharon', 'review': 'Seriously delicious. I had no idea how well beets and pistachios complement one another!'}, {'name': 'Macmonk', 'review': "The salad dressing...meh. Needed a tsp of honey.
Toasted walnuts or macadamia nuts would be better.
Butter lettuce would be a better choice.
Yellow beets won't stain a cutting board.
No Ground pepper?"}, {'name': 'Pam', 'review': 'We tried this using mustard greens and a medley of beets. The spicy greens with the rich avocado was divine.'}, {'name': 'Judy B.', 'review': 'Mad about avocados and beets! This looks like the perfect, brightly flavored salad to go with the grilled chicken we are doing next weekend! So easy and so lovely to look at. Thanks, Elise!'}]

og:title: Red Flannel Hash Is a New England Tradition
og:description: New England red flannel hash is made with cooked potatoes, beets, corned beef that are all fried up with onions and butter. It's ready in 25 minutes.
Title: Red Flannel Hash
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Red Flannel Hash Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 25 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 4 tablespoons butter, 1 cup onion, chopped, 2 cups cooked corned beef, chopped, 1 1/2 cups cooked beets, chopped, 1 1/2 cups cooked potatoes, chopped, 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce (optional, and use gluten-free Worcestershire sauce if cooking gluten-free), 1/4 cup (packed) fresh parsley, chopped (optional), Freshly ground black pepper to taste
Reviews: [{'name': 'Estoy Listo', 'review': "It should be noted that this will turn your insides red. Don't be alarmed."}, {'name': 'Susa', 'review': 'I am a New Englander. My ancestors arrived in the NH colony in 1637. My red fannel hash recipe is at least 250 yrs old. The hash is made with all the leftover veggies from a boiled dinner. Cabbage, potatoes, turnip, carrots, onions, beets. The cooked veggies are put through a meat grinder with a course blade. Mix throughly and place in an oiled cast iron fry pan. If you want meat, serve it on the side \nGlad I could clear up what red flannel hash!'}, {'name': 'ed dugan', 'review': "Use canned whole beets and dice them. Use canned diced potatoes as well. A little chopped onion, sweet pepper and parsley will give you everything you need but the corned beef.Incidentally, NEVER use corned beef round, only brisket. I'm a chef and published cookbook author and I NEVER work harder than I have to. This is quick, easy and delicious."}, {'name': 'Thomas', 'review': "I have been making this for many years after St Paddy's day except I use goose fat in place of the butter. So so good."}, {'name': 'Mike', 'review': 'It would probably be great with a little fennel added.'}]

og:title: Eat Like the French With Poached Egg and Bacon Salad (Salade Lyonnaise)
og:description: Traditional French salade Lyonnaise with frisee lettuce, bacon, croutons, a poached egg, and a Dijon vinaigrette.
Title: Poached Egg and Bacon Salad (Salade Lyonnaise)
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Poached Egg and Bacon Salad (Salade Lyonnaise) Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 20 mins; Serving: 1 serving
Ingredients: 2 strips bacon, 1 slice French or Italian bread, 1 teaspoon butter, 1 large poached egg, 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil, 1 tablespoon wine vinegar, 1/2 teaspoon Dijon mustard, Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper, to taste, Handful fresh frisée lettuce, torn into bite sized pieces, 1 teaspoon chopped shallots
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Steve j', 'review': "I' practicing making the perfect French poached egg. I'm getting better but still have some growth available. I did find 30 days ago in Lyon France that the French can screw it up too."}, {'name': 'nola2chi', 'review': 'LOL.....Of course, being a French salad, there are a number of scoldings and adjustments in the comments. Lets just say, a tad snippy, and very French. Yum it is! Why has it become hard to find frisee, or endive of any sort, in the markets?'}, {'name': 'Melina', 'review': "

Thank you very much for the recipe. I fell in love with the similar salad i had at a 5star hotel and I've been craving it for so long!I have added anchovy bit to it like the hotel did. it tastes wonderful!

"}, {'name': 'Paulaladawn', 'review': "

Thank you so much for having this in your archives. I just returned from France and had this salad in Lyon (the city/people for which it is named). I can't wait to try it out.

FYI the bacon in France was thick cut chunks and just cooked through not crisp. I am not a crouton lover but fresh fried in butter adds an amazing texture.

"}, {'name': 'Dave', 'review': '

The dressing is incorrect for a Salade Lyonnaise. The dressing should be made by frying the bacon in some olive oil. When the bacon is crisp, crumble it up and then sautee some shallots (or onion) in the bacon, oil, and rendered bacon fat. (The use of the rendered bacon fat is critical as it provides the unctuous texture which elevates the salad.) Add the mustard and vinegar and whisk into a vinaigrette.

The warm bacon vinaigrette gets tossed with the frisee, which will very lightly wilt the lettuce. Then add the warm poached egg on top.

THAT is a salad lyonnaise - a contrast of textures with the warm bacon dressing, barely wilted bitter greens and egg yolk.

'}]

og:title: Toss Poached Salmon With Celery, Onion, and Capers for a Light Meal
og:description: Cool off with this easy Salmon Salad! Poached salmon is gently tossed with celery, red onions, capers, and dill and is perfect for a brunch or light lunch.
Title: Fresh Salmon Salad
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Fresh Salmon Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 9 mins; Chilling time: 30 mins; Total Time: 54 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 1 pound salmon fillet, cut in half, 1/2 teaspoon sea salt, for the rub, 4 cups water, 1 1/2 teaspoons sea salt, for the poaching liquid, 1 slice lemon, 1 teaspoon lemon juice, 1 teaspoon extra virgin olive oil, 2 stalks celery, finely chopped, 1/2 red onion, peeled, finely sliced, 1 tablespoon capers, strain out the pickling juice, 1 teaspoon lemon zest, 3 tablespoons lemon juice, 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil, 2 tablespoons fresh dill, chopped, 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Paula', 'review': "So, I don't like salmon. Like, at all. But, for some reason, I found myself with a filet in the fridge. I ignored it as long as I could, but my conscience won't let me waste food, so I needed a quick, easy, yummy recipe to change my mind about salmon. This recipe may have done it! I followed another reviewers suggestion to add balsamic, and also added a clove of crushed garlic, & then piled it all on top of a butter lettuce mix, & oh my goodness! Yum! I don't know that I'm totally sold on salmon yet, but I will definitely make this again!"}, {'name': 'Michael', 'review': '

I made two slight modifications... extra olive oil (as I am an olive oil pig), and a tablespoon or two of balsamic vinegar. The latter put the deliciousness through the roof - try it! Yum.

'}, {'name': 'Melanie', 'review': '

A thank-you is long overdue, Elise! This has been my "summer staple" since you posted it - I just can't get enough!

Over the years I've made just a couple changes - I thinly slice (like paper thin) a bit of English cucumber if I have it, and I also plop my red onion slices in a pot with boiling water and a decent amount of vinegar for just a few minutes - it cuts the bite of them a little AND they turn hot pink!

Everyone I serve this to swoons over how tasty and pretty it is, and I have you to thank! So, THANKS!

- Longtime lurker ;)

'}, {'name': 'Carolyn', 'review': "

What's the recipe for the dressing mixture?

The dressing mixture is the celery, red onion, capers, lemon juice, olive oil, and fresh dill. ~Elise

"}, {'name': 'Mc Muffin', 'review': '

Really easy to do and super delicious! Thank You for this one.

'}]

og:title: Build the Perfect Fall Salad With Endive Walnuts, Pears, and Gorgonzola
og:description: The perfect fall salad has crisp endive plus walnuts, chopped pear, and blue cheese.
Title: Endive Salad with Walnuts, Pears, and Gorgonzola
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Endive Salad with Walnuts, Pears, and Gorgonzola Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 10 mins; Servings: 2
to 3 servings
Ingredients: 3 endive heads, sliced first lengthwise, then crosswise in 1/2-inch slices, 2 tablespoons chopped walnuts, 2 tablespoons crumbled gorgonzola or other blue cheese, 1 Bartlett pear, cored and chopped, 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, 2 teaspoons cider vinegar (balsamic is good too), Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
Reviews: [{'name': 'Alan', 'review': 'I bought mountain, not dolce, Gorgonzola. Even though fresh out of the refrigerator, it was uncrumbleable, regardless whether I used the fork mashing method or the finger method. The cheese, which I had bought at one of New York\'s premier cheese vendors, was apparently just too creamy to cooperate. Eventually I had to pull it apart, but the pieces were far from anything resembling crumbs. I made the dish for a party of 20 people. The recipe said "serves 2 to 3." Following the old precept of better too much than too little, I used 30 endives, 10 pears, and the proportional amount of walnuts and Gorgonzola. When I got to the party, my host, shocked by the huge amount of material, had me serve only one-third of what I had made. Of that one-third, only slightly more than half was taken by guests. Okay, you can say that it had been my choice to follow the precept. But even so, I would have to say that "serves 2 or 3" should be applied only when this salad is going to be served as a main course. Let my experience serve as guidance for people who make this tasty dish for parties. As regards crumbling Gorgonzola, I don\'t know what to suggest.'}, {'name': 'Sandy S', 'review': 'Just wanted to say that I made this salad using a handful of cress with some other mixed greens as I could not find any endive or other substitutes. It was very good! A wonderful change from other green salads. I look forward to making it with endive.'}, {'name': 'Rhonda', 'review': 'Hello again! I just tried this using the above tweeks, and added another - radicchio instead of endive (store was out). It is amazing and colorful! Thanks for the inspiration, Elise. I now have a new favorite salad!'}, {'name': 'Rhonda', 'review': "My pear tree exploded with fruit this year! I can't wait to try this with one of my fresh, ripe, organic pears! I have some sherry vinegar on hand so I think I'll try that instead of the cider vinegar. And I have Roquefort Bleu instead of the gorgonzola. My mouth is watering as I type!"}, {'name': 'Greg', 'review': 'This was a great salad...I could not find really ripe pears so I added honey to brighten up the flavor...everyone loved it!'}]

og:title: Use Up Leftover Turkey in This Quick, Flavorful Curry Turkey Salad
og:description: Curried turkey salad with apple, raisins or dried cranberries, green onions, celery, cilantro, honey, ground ginger, curry, mayo and yogurt.
Title: Curry Turkey Salad
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Curry Turkey Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 15 mins; Servings: 2 servings
Ingredients: 1/2 tablespoon yellow curry powder, 1/4 cup plain yogurt, 1/4 cup mayonnaise, 1 tablespoon honey, 1/4 teaspoon ground ginger, Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, 2 cups chopped cooked turkey meat, 1 apple, peeled, cored, chopped and sprinkled with 1 teaspoon lemon juice to keep them from discoloring), 1/4 cup raisins and/or dried cranberries, 2 tablespoons chopped green onion or chives, 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro (can substitute parsley), 1 rib celery, chopped
Reviews:
[{'name': 'roderick Patterson', 'review': 'I make a curry chicken salad with (1/2 less sugar) “craisans”. But toss pine nuts or cashews or (pecans, walnuts, etc) in melted butter & dark brown sugar then toast. Toasting really wakens the oils in the nuts & the butter & sugar almost give it a (cashew brittle, etc) flavor. This is why the (1/2 less sugar craisans are used) Based on around 2-1/2 lbs of Chicken, I’ll start with the binding mixture. In mixing bowl, add 1-1/2 cups mayo, 3 TBSP (level or heaping is your option🤷‍♂️, I do 1 heaping & 2 level, I like the nutty taste of yellow curry) of yellow curry, 1 to 1-1/2 TSP of kosher salt & same of white pepper. Also add 1/4 cup dry white wine, 1/3 cup chutney(Major (?) brand recommended, available in Asian/Indian section). Whisk or use a processor to blend. Also prep 1/4 to 1/3 cups of both celery and scallions. Mix all together except the nuts and refrigerate overnight the add nuts. I don’t do the Waldorf “apple” thing as it puts the sweet level over the top. I believe that’s it, I keep so many recipes in my head so I build by taste. Also the preparation of the chicken is left to preparer, big or little chunks or shredded(processor). I prefer a combination of shredded & little chunks. I’d imagine turkey can be used in place of the chicken but despite both being poultry they have distinct flavors. Great on Hawaiian Rolls or for the carb conscience wrapped in Bibb lettuce leaves, Lowe’s foods carries firm heads of Bibb which will provide dozens of leaves as opposed to the soft hydro fluffy “perfect” looking leaves. Makes enough for at least a dozen people, depending on other dishes it could easily feed 2 dozen.'}, {'name': 'Marcela Beth Clay', 'review': 'Have made this recipe with salmon, grapes, walnuts, and apples, as well as one time with cooked chicken breast & toasted almonds substituting for turkey. Best part of the recipe is the curry sauce - toasting the curry releases some over-the-top flavors.'}, {'name': 'Denise', 'review': "

We received a whole frozen turkey for Christmas but went out of town for the holiday, so last night we pulled apart the turkey pieces (slicing the breast off the bone to help with cooking time) and marinated them in a garlic, basil, and soy sauce vinaigrette. Instead of baking, we grilled the pieces for about 20 minutes total. It was delicious and now we have a ton of turkey to use for recipes like this! We made this recipe today- delicious! Didn't have yogurt so I substituted sour cream which worked fine. A few chopped pecans might be a nice add next time. Thanks for the recipe.

"}, {'name': 'Carolyn', 'review': "

A chime-in from another vegetarian- I am about to post a turkey-style seitan recipe I've been tweaking and using this season on my own site, and I think your recipe will work spectacularly with a non-bird alternative. Curry anything gets my attention every time, especially when accompanied by fruit. Who says the meal has to put you to sleep in order to be good- salads of all kinds need to be more front and center on everyone's plate!

"}, {'name': 'berkeley girl', 'review': "

I'm a vegetarian, so have no leftover turkey, but this worked great w/ sliced tempeh. I didn't have any celery, ginger powder, herbs, or mayonnaise, but the concept still worked great! I sauteed the tempeh briefly in olive oil & 1/2 of the curry powder, added chopped spinach and cooked for less than 1 min, then added both to the dressing and mixed in the raisins and apples. A nice spicy salad.
-berkeley girl

"}]

og:title: Sautéed Shaved Brussels Sprouts with Lemon Will Be Your New Favorite Side Dish
og:description: This quick shaved Brussels sprouts recipe sautés the veggie in olive oil with garlic, mustard seeds, and lemon. It's a tasty, versatile side dish.
Title: Shaved Brussels Sprouts with Lemon
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Shaved Brussels Sprouts with Lemon Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 25 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 1 pound Brussels sprouts, tough or wilted outer leaves peeled off and discarded, 2 teaspoons lemon juice, 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, 1 clove garlic, minced, 1 tablespoon mustard seeds, 2 tablespoons dry white wine or vermouth, 2 teaspoons lemon zest, 1/4 teaspoon salt and pepper, to taste
Reviews: [{'name': 'Ajidulce', 'review': 'I love the fine texture of the Brussels sprouts shaved'}, {'name': 'Stacy', 'review': 'Would this be good with bacon? Thanks! Looking forward to trying it for Thanksgiving!'}, {'name': 'Sandra', 'review': "I made this yesterday but didn't put the lemon zest in it. I also used chardonnay as the wine and added a qtr of thinly sliced yellow onion and it was DELICIOUS! There wasn't any left so I am making it again this coming weekend."}, {'name': 'Janie', 'review': "I just made this and it is wonderful! Very light and delicate flavors. I didn't have mustard seeds so I subbed Nigella seeds (halved the amount) and subbed white zinfandel for the dry wine. I would like to make it exactly as you have it but this was so nice that I may always use my subs. Thank you for a new fav! What do you like to serve with it?"}, {'name': 'Jessica', 'review': 'Can this be made ahead and then warmed before serving?'}]

og:title: 25-Minute Sesame Noodle Salad Is the Perfect Cold Dish on a Hot Day
og:description: Quick and easy! Thin noodles infused with a sesame, honey, soy sauce dressing.
Title: Sesame Noodle Salad
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Sesame Noodle Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 25 mins; Total Time: 35 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil or vegetable oil, 3 tablespoons dark sesame oil, 1/2 teaspoon crushed dried red pepper or chili powder (optional), 3 tablespoons honey, 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 12 ounces vermicelli, thin spaghetti, or angel hair pasta, Salt, 2/3 cup coarsely chopped cilantro, 1/3 cup chopped roasted salted peanuts, 1/3 cup thinly sliced green onions, 1/2 cup diced red bell pepper, 1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds
Reviews: [{'name': 'Ray', 'review': 'Why boil sauce first?'}, {'name': 'Debbie', 'review': 'How do you think the dressing would taste if I added a teaspoon of peanut butter to it?'}, {'name': 'Deepa Muschke', 'review': 'Excellent!! I added Tataki beef to it!'}, {'name': 'Robin', 'review': 'Love this salad ! I add edamame to mine gives it a little more texture. We eat it for work lunch all week.'}, {'name': 'Tamantha', 'review': 'Tried this when a friend made it and now looking to make it myself! How long do you think you could store the dressing for?'}]

og:title: Bay Shrimp and Avocado Salad
og:description: Easy shrimp and avocado salad! Pink shrimp and creamy avocado are a perfect match, especially with a crisp vinaigrette.
Title: Bay Shrimp and Avocado Salad
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Bay Shrimp and Avocado Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 10 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 1/4 cup white wine vinegar, 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil, 1 medium green onion, thinly sliced, Pinch of salt, 3/4 pound cooked bay shrimp or extra small shrimp that are cooked, peeled, and de-veined, most of the shrimp roughly chopped, 3 medium ripe avocados, Lettuce, preferably butter lettuce or red leaf lettuce, 2 tablespoons chopped roasted hazelnuts, almonds, or pistachios, 1 tablespoon chopped cilantro, Lemon slices for garnish
Reviews:
[{'name': 'LJWR', 'review': 'I wish SimplyRecipes would have an option for printing a picture along with the recipe. Is there a way to do that?'}, {'name': 'yrba', 'review': "Beautiful presentation! I'm going to make this right now, substituting lime juice for the vinegar. 
Also, I don't have cilantro on hand, but do have fresh dill and flat leaf parsley, so 
will use those. 
Tomorrow I'll buy cilantro. 
Putting this over bagged fresh spinach, as I don't have lettuce. 
Thank you for the inspiration!"}, {'name': 'Jean', 'review': "How do you prep bay shrimp? I've bought a bag in the past and the next day it smelled off."}, {'name': 'Adriana', 'review': 'What a sophisticated dish. My entire family LOVES it. The only change i made to it was to add tarragon to it. Now i am going to try other of your recipes with the hope of find new favorites.
