Thank you for this outstanding recipe!'}, {'name': 'Noel', 'review': 'made it using a red wine vinaigrette instead of the one provided here, absolutely divine!'}]

og:title: If You've Never Tried Nopalitos Cactus Salad, It's Time For Something New
og:description: This easy, budget-friendly salad is a classic Mexican cactus salad with chopped prickly pear cactus paddles (nopalitos), tomatoes, onions, and radishes.
Title: Nopalitos Cactus Salad
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Nopalitos Cactus Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 25 mins; Servings: 6 servings
Ingredients: 1 pound (450 g) fresh chopped nopalitos, 1 pound cherry tomatoes, quartered (about 3 cups), 1 cup chopped red radishes, 1 cup finely chopped red onion, 3 tablespoons lime juice, 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 1/2 cup chopped cilantro
Reviews: [{'name': 'Ann', 'review': 'Can you freeze the cactus salads'}, {'name': 'Elisa', 'review': "Mexican here, you have to cook the nopalitos longer than 1 minute. They are supposed to be soft and not really that crunchy. My mom says it should be for a few minutes until they actually are soft but not to long. \nAlso, if you cook them on a copper pod they don't loose color and become super green!"}, {'name': 'Suzy', 'review': 'easiest recipe! my grandmother made these as a kid, and i hated them. Now i miss her and her nopales. She added a can of pinto beans, which i also did. hearty!'}, {'name': 'Henrietta Bojorquez', 'review': 'My mother used to make nopales for us growing up. She fried them along with cut up wieners and a red sauce. I want to make this recipe and another but all recipes seam to have cilantro in them. I hate cilantro, so what can I use? I have heard about using parsley instead.'}, {'name': 'Marie Schick', 'review': 'can you freeze chopped Nopalito?'}]

og:title: Take Your Taste Buds on an Exotic Adventure With Thai Noodle Salad
og:description: Ready to take your taste buds on an exotic adventure? This Thai Noodle Salad is the answer! Freshly chopped vegetables, tropical fruit, chewy rice noodles, and a creamy peanut dressing make for an irresistible vegetarian side dish or light lunch.
Title: Thai Noodle Salad with Peanut Sauce
Author: Jessica Gavin
Description:
Thai Noodle Salad with Peanut Sauce Recipe
Prep Time: 25 mins; Cook Time: 5 mins; Total Time: 30 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 1 small head (about 2 cups) romaine lettuce, 1/4 head (about 2 cups) red cabbage, 1 large red bell pepper, 1 large carrot (about 1/2 cup) carrot, 1 mango, 1/4 cup cilantro leaves, plus more for garnish, 1/4 cup green onions, plus more for garnish, 1/4 cup roasted peanuts, roughly chopped, plus more for garnish, 8 ounces (227 grams) pad Thai rice noodles, 1/3 cup creamy peanut butter, 3 tablespoons lime juice, 3 tablespoons water, 3 tablespoons brown sugar, 4 teaspoons rice wine vinegar, 4 teaspoons soy sauce, 1 teaspoon sesame oil, 1/4 teaspoon fish sauce, 1/2 teaspoon Sriracha or chili paste, 1/2 teaspoon minced ginger, 1/2 teaspoon minced garlic
Reviews: [{'name': 'Sage', 'review': 'Delicious! I added chicken and it made a great dinner that my husband and I both loved. Only change I'll be making in the future is doubling the sauce--it's excellent and there wasn't enough of it the first time'}, {'name': 'Eileen', 'review': 'No Mango, any substitutes or could I use frozen mango?'}, {'name': 'Yvonne', 'review': 'This is a great salad..easy to make and very tasty! My company loved it!!'}, {'name': 'Steph', 'review': 'The best! I had some leftover roast beef and added it went great with the dressing!'}, {'name': 'Max', 'review': 'Can this be made with Wow butter as a substitute for peanut butter, due to allergies?'}]

og:title: Asian Zucchini Noodle Salad
og:description: Fresh veggie salad tossed with a sesame rice vinegar dressing is light, fresh, and easy!
Title: Asian Zucchini Noodle Salad
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Asian Zucchini Noodle Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Total Time: 20 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 3 to 4 zucchinis (1 1/2 pounds total), 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1 1/2 cups thinly sliced and roughly chopped red cabbage, 1 large carrot, grated (about 1 cup), 1/2 large red bell pepper, thinly sliced then cut into 1-inch segments, 2 green onions, thinly sliced on the diagonal, 1/2 bunch cilantro, chopped, leaves and tender stems (about 1/2 cup), 1/3 cup seasoned rice vinegar*, 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, 1 1/2 teaspoons dark roasted sesame oil, 1 clove garlic, minced (about 1 teaspoon), Pinch red pepper flakes
Reviews: [{'name': 'Susan Seeber', 'review': 'I made this salad. Added some rice vermicelli. No cilantro so used Thai basil. \nvery delicious. I have leftovers. Maybe I’ll make rice paper rolls.'}, {'name': 'Jenni D', 'review': "How is this dish a day after making? I want to make this ahead of time for supper tomorrow as I won't have time to prepare everything I'm making the day of. Plus it will be a bonus to eat for lunch tomorrow at work :-)"}, {'name': 'Jenni D', 'review': "Why can't I print this?"}, {'name': 'Bren', 'review': 'How do I pin this?'}, {'name': 'Barb Grunwald', 'review': "Beautiful colors and very tasty. We have a somewhat similar recipe with rice etc. that calls for peanut butter and I think I'll add that next time - would give it a little more oomph. Definitely keeping this recipe!"}]

og:title: This Mexican Octopus Salad Is Fresh and Flavorful
og:description: Mexican style octopus salad, with tomatoes, green and red onion, cucumbers, and cilantro.
Title: Octopus Salad (Ensalada de Pulpo)
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Octopus Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 2 hrs; Total Time: 2 hrs 15 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 2 pounds octopus, cleaned, Salt, Several large sprigs of fresh oregano, Several large sprigs of fresh parsley, Several sprigs of fresh cilantro, 1 cup seeded, chopped cucumber (peeled if the peels are thick and bitter, otherwise leave them on), 1/2 cup finely chopped red onion, 3 green onions, sliced, including some of the darker green ends, 1 fresh jalapeno, seeded and minced (test for heat, if really hot, only use a small amount), 1/2 cup loosely packed chopped fresh cilantro, including tender stems, 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano, 2 tablespoon lime juice, 2 tablespoon cider vinegar, 1/4 cup olive oil, 2 cups chopped, seeded tomatoes
Reviews: [{'name': 'Alex', 'review': 'What could I use in place of tomatoes? One of my kids has an allergy to raw tomatoes'}, {'name': 'Steve', 'review': 'Sorry, but I’m a word fanatic. Just for future reference, despite popular belief, the plural of octopus is octopuses, not octopi. “Octopi” would be Latin, but octopus is a Greek origin word, thus “octopuses.” Just thought you would want to know. \nI look forward to making this recipe today.'}, {'name': 'Jenny', 'review': 'In place of octopus, would it be sacrilegious to use equivalent amount of shrimp instead??'}, {'name': 'Marisol Hernandez', 'review': 'Is there a nutrition fact for this? Like the calorie amount, etc?'}, {'name': 'Dee', 'review': "It's fabulous if you put the cooked octopus on the grill and get a nice char on it. Then proceed with the recipe constructing the salad. I can get cooked Spanish octopus in a cryovac at Costco which can just be grilled to char then chopped. I add garlic, slightly pickle the red onion, use some chopped tender celery , half of a red bell pepper and add a bit of fresh parsley and oregano with the cilantro. Canned, rinsed garbonzo beans/chickpeas would also be a great addition to make it a nice lunch salad over a bed of boston lettuce greens. I add chopped fresh avocado with the tomatoes prior to serving. I think it is better on day 2 or 3."}]

og:title: Get Your Veggies in With Easy Sesame Noodle Salad and Sesame Ginger Dressing
og:description: Asian-inspired noodle salad with plenty of colorful veggies and a sesame ginger dressing.
Title: Sesame Ginger Noodle Salad
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Sesame Ginger Noodle Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 30 mins; Total Time: 50 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 10 ounces Chinese noodles, for making chow mein, 1/3 cup soy sauce, 2 to 3 cups raw bite-sized broccoli florets (from about 1 head broccoli), Salt, 4 ounces mung bean sprouts (about 1 1/2 cups), 3 green onions, thinly sliced white and green parts, 1 red bell pepper, cored and seeded, thinly sliced and cut into 1-inch-long pieces, 1/4 large purple cabbage, cored and thinly sliced (about 2 cups), 1 large carrot, peeled and slivered (just continue to peel with a peeler), 1 (1-inch) piece fresh ginger, peeled and roughly chopped, 4 tablespoons sugar, 1 medium clove garlic, roughly chopped, 1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes, 1/3 cup canola, rice bran, or vegetable oil, 1/3 cup unseasoned rice vinegar, 4 teaspoons dark sesame oil
Reviews:
[{'name': 'HoppingGoose', 'review': 'made this a couple of days ago. approved by hubs. he is a vegetarian. this is a wonderful option for a potluck gathering.
thinking whether adding shrimp would go well?'}, {'name': 'Ruth', 'review': "Loved this! I made a mistake and cut back on how much soy sauce I tossed on the noodles (hubby always complains that food is too salty when I use soy, even the most sodium reduced I can find). In the end the salad could have used that extra salt so lesson learned! I thought the sugar seemed high too, but I ended up adding pretty much exactly what it called for. Doubled the dressing so I've still got a bunch in the fridge that I'll happily use over the coming days. I used Farkay dried chow mein noodles because I had them and they worked great."}, {'name': 'Julia', 'review': 'This was delish! I included chopped cilantro and mint, left out broccoli since I was "pantry shopping". Threw some leftover roast pork on top. The hubby approved and had seconds! Oh, and used spaghetti, since that's what I had. Thanks for making me look like a star in the kitchen!'}, {'name': 'Sarah', 'review': 'It was WAY too sweet. Ruined the salad. I tried again, using 2 T sugar instead of the 4 T, and that was better. The 2T nicely balanced the hot, salty, and sour elements, without being teeth-achingly sweet. (1 T would probably be even better.) Unless you're one of those people who likes their "savory" food to be sticky sweet, cut way back on the sugar.

Odd thing- the photos of the completed dish show white noodles, but they are actually quite brown because of the absorbed soy sauce.'}, {'name': 'Vicki', 'review': 'Yummy! I omitted peppers, added lime juice and cilantro.'}]

og:title: Shake Up Your Midweek Dinner With This Easy Steak Salad
og:description: Steak salad makes a quick and easy midweek meal. Made with thin slices of pan-seared steak served over arugula and lettuce greens toss with a lemon vinaigrette.
Title: Easy Steak Salad with Lemon Vinaigrette
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Easy Steak Salad with Lemon Vinaigrette Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 20 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: Extra virgin olive oil, 1 pound flank steak or skirt steak, Salt and freshly ground pepper, 1/2 head lettuce greens, 1 bunch arugula (young leaves), tough stems removed, 1/2 red bell pepper, thinly sliced lengthwise and cut into 1-inch-long pieces, 4 scallions, thinly sliced, 1 avocado, cut into bite-sized pieces, 4 ounces goat cheese, crumbled, Pomegranate seeds or thinly sliced kumquats (optional), 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 6 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard (smooth), or 1/2 teaspoon dry mustard, Salt and pepper
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Smc', 'review': "I haven't tried this yet, but was wondering if sliced strawberries would be an ok substitute for the pomegranate seeds. Pomegranates are not in season now."}, {'name': 'Wendy', 'review': "This was an excellent way to use up leftover steaks from a barbque. I served it with sour cream potato salad and garlic bread. Didn't have the bell pepper but I did have radishes from my garden. I'm just developing a taste for arugula and this was a nice ratio to mix. Dressing was good."}, {'name': 'Emily Jaycox', 'review': 'We substituted roasted sunflower seeds (generally have these on hand for salads) for the toasted walnuts. Also, we plopped our steaks down whole on the bed of salad. And the steaks were grilled instead of pan seared. Thinly sliced red onion instead of scallions. Other than that, we used the recipe as given and it was a winner! Thank you.'}, {'name': 'Cheryl', 'review': '

Hey there,

I absolutely enjoy your reading your recipes. However, where I live, arugula is not readily available. I was just curious what type of vegetables you can substitute it with?

Fresh baby spinach, though the taste isn't even close to the same. Arugula also goes by "rocket". It grows like a weed, even more persistent than dandelions, so if you can get a hold of some seed, and have an untended patch of dirt somewhere, if you sow them you'll get an unlimited yearly supply (when in season). ~Elise

'}, {'name': 'Elise Lafosse', 'review': '

Hi Elise,

I have been meaning to tell you for awhile that this steak salad has become a staple in my household. I must make it once at least every two weeks. It is quick and easy and good, and when I just am not that creative when it comes to figuring out a meal, I always rely on this, this recipe and the seared tuna recipe as well. Thank you for making my life a little easier with this recipe.

Elise

'}]

og:title: Feast Your Eyes First With This Jeweled Salad
og:description: Breaking the fast at iftar during Ramadan means we get to eat dishes like this jeweled salad to feast and nourish ourselves.
Title: Chana Chaat (Jeweled Salad)
Author: Shayma Saadat
Description:
Chana Chaat (Jeweled Salad) Recipe
Prep Time: 30 mins; Cook Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 40 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 1 pound Yukon Gold potatoes, cut into 1/2-inch pieces, 1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon sea salt, divided, 1/3 cup olive oil, 1/4 cup fresh lime juice, (from about 2 juicy limes), 3 tablespoons light brown sugar, tightly packed, 1 teaspoon hot smoked paprika, 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper, 2 cups drained, canned chickpeas, 1 cup pomegranate arils, 1/4 cup shallots, finely diced, 1/4 cup cilantro stems, finely chopped (reserve leaves for other use), 4 fresh mint leaves chiffonade, plus a few left whole for garnish

og:title: The Only Caesar Dressing You'll Want is Vegan
og:description: You CAN enjoy the flavors of Caesar dressing without eggs, cheese, or anchovies! This quick and easy vegan salad dressing is for more than just salads—think sandwich spread and dip for veggies.
Title: Vegan Caesar Dressing
Author: Laurel Randolph
Description:
Vegan Caesar Dressing Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 10 mins; Servings: 6 servings; Yield: 1 cup
Ingredients: 4 clove garlic, 1/2 cup tahini, stirred well, 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice, 3 tablespoons nutritional yeast, 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar or caper brine, 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil, 2 teaspoons Dijon mustard, 2 teaspoons soy sauce or vegan Worcestershire sauce, 1 teaspoon agave or maple syrup, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more to taste, 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more to taste, 1/4 cup warm water, divided, plus more as needed
Reviews: [{'name': 'EmmaC', 'review': 'This was spot on!!! I used it in a giant chopped salad with kale, radicchio, and chickpeas. It would also be delicious as a dip for raw veggies. Yum!'}]

og:title: The Zero Dollar Trick for Better Green Salads
og:description: I learned an easy and free trick that restaurant chefs use for the crispiest, freshest salads.
Title: The Zero Dollar Trick for Better Green Salads
Author: Megan O. Steintrager
Description: The Zero Dollar Trick for Better Green Salads

og:title: My Grandma Winnie’s Tomato and Cucumber Salad Is My Favorite Summer Dish
og:description: This tomato, cucumber, and onion salad is fresh, crunchy, lightly sweet, and tangy. The recipe transforms peak summer produce into a refreshing, classic Southern side dish in under half an hour.
Title: My Grandma Winnie’s Tomato and Cucumber Salad Is My Favorite Summer Dish
Author: Stephanie A Ganz
Description: Tomato, Cucumber, and Onion Salad Recipe
Ingredients: 4 medium tomatoes, peeled if desired, cored, and cut into wedges, 1 English cucumber or 3 Persian cucumbers, peeled, halved, and sliced, 1/4 Vidalia or yellow onion, sliced thin, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 1/4 cup distilled white vinegar, 1 teaspoon packed brown sugar

og:title: Throwing Some Shrimp on the Grill Tonight? Make This Delightful Salad!
og:description: This light grilled shrimp salad is packed with spices and vegetables and easy to make even on a weeknight!
Title: Grilled Shrimp Salad
Author: Nick Evans
Description:
Grilled Shrimp Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 20 mins; Total Time: 30 mins; Servings: 4 servings; Yield: 4 large salads
Ingredients: 1 lime, juiced, 2 tablespoons minced cilantro, 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard, 1 tablespoon sugar, 1/3 cup olive oil, Kosher salt, to taste, Black pepper, to taste, 1 red bell pepper, seeded and quartered, 1 green bell pepper, seeded and quartered, 1/2 red onion, cut into quarters, 1 jalapeno, halved (remove seeds for less heat) , 1 tablespoon olive oil, Kosher salt, to taste, Black pepper, to taste, 1 pound shrimp (25-30 count), peeled and deveined , 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 teaspoon chili powder, 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper, 2 heads romaine lettuce, chopped, 1 cup frozen sweet corn, thawed, 1 cup cherry tomatoes, quartered, 1 avocado, pitted and chopped, 4 scallions, thinly sliced, 4-6 ounces Cotija cheese
Reviews: [{'name': 'Theresa Zeelsdorf', 'review': 'Very easy to make'}, {'name': 'maggie', 'review': 'Couldn\'t print recipe - said "access denied"'}]

og:title: This Spicy Cucumber-Jalapeño Salad Is a Summertime Must
og:description: This spicy cucumber and jalapeño salad is an easy and refreshing side for any summer meal.
Title: Spicy Cucumber and Jalapeño Salad
Author: Dalia David
Description:
Spicy Cucumber and Jalapeño Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 15 mins; Servings: 4 servings; Yield: 4 cups
Ingredients: 8 small Persian cucumbers, cut into 1/16-inch rounds (about 4 cups), 4 small jalapeños, cut into 1/16-inch rounds (about 1 cup), 1/2 cup roughly chopped cilantro, 1/4 cup rice vinegar, 3 tablespoons agave syrup, plus more to taste, 1 teaspoon sea salt, plus more to taste
Reviews: [{'name': 'brushjl', 'review': 'Loved this! My two favorite things. Cucumbers and jalapeños'}, {'name': 'Shaka Mugabe', 'review': 'How do the regular size cucumbers work with this recipe?'}]

og:title: The Best Way to Use Everything Bagel Seasoning is in This Salad
og:description: This cucumber salad is cool, crunchy, creamy, and everything (bagel seasoning) you want in an easy summer salad.
Title: Creamy Everything Bagel Cucumber Salad
Author: Sara Tane
Description:
Everything Bagel Cucumber Salad Recipe (Creamy!)
Prep Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 10 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 3/4 cup full-fat sour cream, 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, 2 tablespoons everything bagel seasoning, divided, plus more for garnish, Kosher salt, to taste, Freshly ground black pepper, to taste, 1 large or 6 small Persian cucumbers, cut into 1/4-inch slices (about 5 cups), 4 scallions, ends trimmed and thinly sliced, 1/2 medium red onion, thinly sliced, 1/4 cup chopped fresh dill, 1/4 cup capers, drained and rinsed
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Heather N', 'review': "This was really good! I love a salad heavy on dill and capers. So refreshing and great for summer. 

I thought that the title was slightly misleading in that the everything but the bagel seasoning wasn't the main flavor notes. It was so much more complex and interesting than the bagel seasoning. I understand that that's a selling point for most people making it though. 

My lemon made about 3 1/2 TB of juice so I only used 2 TB as to not overpower. 

It was too much sour cream for my taste so I would make it was less next time. Maybe 1/2 cup."}]

og:title: The Easiest Chicken Ceasar Salad Is Made on a Sheet Pan
og:description: Ready in just 30 minutes, sheet pan chicken Caesar salad is a family favorite. With tender chicken, crunchy croutons, and plenty of Parmesan, it’s a weeknight recipe for the books.
Title: Sheet Pan Chicken Caesar Salad
Author: Sara Haas, RDN, LDN
Description:
Sheet Pan Chicken Caesar Salad (30 Minutes)
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 20 mins; Total Time: 30 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, 1 teaspoon dried oregano, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, plus extra for garnish, 1/2 pound crusty French baguette, torn into bite-size pieces, 4 chicken cutlets (1 to 1 1/4 pounds total), 2 heads romaine lettuce, chopped, 1 cup cherry or grape tomatoes, halved if large, 1/2 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese, divided, 1/4 cup prepared Caesar salad dressing, plus extra for serving, 1 lemon, cut into 6 wedges
Reviews: [{'name': 'lagentille', 'review': 'Cutlets?'}, {'name': 'brushjl', 'review': 'A Caesar salad always is a good idea. This was ok, just seemed overly time-consuming.'}, {'name': 'Laurel R', 'review': 'Easy and tasty. I prepped the veggies and cheese while the chicken and croutons baked for a super quick meal with minimal clean-up.'}]

og:title: Brussels Sprouts Slaw Is the Wintry Salad of Your Dreams
og:description: Shredded Brussels sprouts form the base of this crunchy salad. Topped with cranberries, toasted nuts, red onion, and tossed with maple dressing, this Brussels sprouts slaw is a winter winner.
Title: Brussels Sprout Slaw
Author: Micah Siva, RD
Description:
Brussels Sprout Slaw Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 15 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings; Yield: 6 cups
Ingredients: 1 pound Brussels sprouts, shaved, 1/2 medium red onion, thinly sliced, 1/3 cup chopped, toasted pecans, 1/3 cup dried cranberries, 2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar, 1 tablespoon maple syrup, 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard, 1 medium clove garlic, minced, 3 tablespoons olive oil, Salt and pepper, to taste
Reviews: [{'name': 'Jonwyoming', 'review': 'This was awesome made with toasted pecans dried cherries and pomegranates.😋'}]

og:title: Roasted Root Vegetable Panzanella is the Ultimate Make-Ahead Thanksgiving Side Dish
og:description: This is a cold-weather twist on the classic Italian summer salad. Parsnips, sweet potatoes, and beets are tossed in a delicious maple brown butter dressing. It's the ultimate make-ahead side for Thanksgiving.
Title: Roasted Root Vegetable Panzanella
Author: Sheela Prakash
Description:
Roasted Root Vegetable Panzanella Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 50 mins; Rest Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 80 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 8 ounces (1/2 loaf) sourdough or country-style bread, 5 tablespoons olive oil, divided, plus more as needed, 1 teaspoon plus 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, divided, plus more as needed, 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, divided, plus more as needed, 2 pounds root vegetables, such as carrots, parsnips, sweet potatoes, and beets, peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces, 1 small red onion, cut into 1-inch pieces, 4 tablespoons unsalted butter, 1 tablespoon chopped fresh rosemary, 3 tablespoons apple cider vinegar, plus more as needed, 2 teaspoons Dijon mustard, 2 teaspoons maple syrup, 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 1 medium bunch (about 6 ounces) lacinato kale, destemmed and torn into bite-sized pieces, 4 ounces goat cheese
Reviews: [{'name': 'Leigh Campion', 'review': "I don't like kale....can I use spinach instead??"}]

og:title: Chicken Turns These Fresh Summer Salads Into Dinner
og:description: Adding chicken to a salad makes it a complete meal, and these summer salads with chicken get their inspiration from Chinese, Vietnamese, and classic American favorites.
Title: 6 Fresh and Summery Salads With Chicken
Author: Robin Shreeves
Description: 6 Fresh Summer Salad Recipes With Chicken

og:title: The “Epic” Salad Your Family Will Beg You For Again and Again
og:description: Go ahead and order the delivery pizza. Here's the one salad that'll elevate it—every pizza party deserves a crunchy, hearty, and bright salad.
Title: The “Epic” Salad Your Family Will Beg You For Again and Again
Author: Sara Tane
Description: The “Epic” Salad Your Family Will Beg You For Again and Again

og:title: This Recipe Let's You Have Your Burger and Your Salad, Too
og:description: A hamburger in salad form! Well-seasoned burger patties sit atop a bowl of crisp iceberg lettuce with all of the toppings you’d find on a hamburger.
Title: Burger Salad
Author: Coco Morante
Description:
Burger Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 25 mins; Servings: 4 servings; Yield: 4 salads
Ingredients: 1 pound ground beef (90/10 or whatever leanness you prefer), 2 teaspoons burger seasoning or 3/4 teaspoon each kosher salt and ground black pepper, mixed together, Avocado oil cooking spray, 1/2 cup mayonnaise, 1/4 cup ketchup, 2 tablespoons yellow mustard, 2 tablespoons dill pickle relish (or finely chopped dill pickle), 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/4 teaspoon onion powder, 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, 8 cups (about 16 ounces, from one medium head) chopped iceberg lettuce, 1/2 medium red or yellow onion, sliced thinly, 1 beefsteak or slicing tomato, cut into bite-sized pieces, or 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved, 24 dill pickle chips (or 2 medium-sized dill pickles, thinly sliced), 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese (I like Tillamook Farmstyle Shreds), Ground black pepper
Reviews: [{'name': 'Lori Cramer Collins', 'review': 'A bit off topic, but when eating out, I often order a hamburger with no bun (it'll come with pickles) and a green salad with thousand island dressing. Add the burger and pickles to the salad, and you have this same yummy dinner or lunch when out and about. I love the idea of adding tater tots! I'd probably put mine on the side, just like I would with a regular burger.'}, {'name': 'Jeff Cunningham', 'review': "As a Type 2 diabetic who has gotten into the habit of eating burgers of all sorts without the bun, this is exactly the sort of recipe I'll be making and tweaking on my own at home."}, {'name': 'Rachel Abi', 'review': 'Looks delicious'}, {'name': 'Annie R.', 'review': "What a fun recipe! Best part is how easy it comes together. Whole family asked to have it again sometime. So cool to enjoy a burger in a new way. I loved how the burger was the centerpiece of the salad and had a nice, burger-y char that you wouldn't get if you'd just browned the beef into crumbles. I added halved cherry tomatoes to mine because I always have tomato on my burger. We had tater tots on the side, but I added mine directly to the salad. I may just have my burgers bunless like this at home from now on!"}]

og:title: A Creamy Potato Salad with The Flavors of Sour Cream and Onion Chips
og:description: Incredibly easy to make and the star of your next cookout, this potato salad recipe captures the flavors of sour cream and onion potato chips in a creamy, dreamy side dish.
Title: Sour Cream and Onion Potato Salad
Author: Laurel Randolph
Description:
Sour Cream and Onion Potato Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 15 mins; Chill Time: 60 mins; Total Time: 85 mins; Servings: 6 servings
Ingredients: 2 pounds Yukon gold potatoes, cut into 1-inch pieces, 1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt, divided, plus more to taste, 1 bunch green onions, trimmed, white and green parts sliced, 3/4 cup sour cream, 3 tablespoons mayonnaise, 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice, 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard, 1 teaspoon dried minced garlic or 1/2 teaspoon granulated garlic, 1 teaspoon dried minced onion or 1/2 teaspoon onion powder, 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 1 bunch fresh chives, chopped, divided
Reviews: [{'name': 'Paula', 'review': 'Made this to go with chicken wings and it was delicious. I used one fresh minced garlic clove instead of dry and used the onion powder instead of minced onion. Otherwise stuck to the recipe.'}, {'name': 'Bee Dee', 'review': 'I was looking for something different from your average potato salad. And this did not disappoint! I am a huge fan of the spur cream and onion flavor. For a little more kick, I did use fresh minced garlic instead of dried or granulated. And I forgot to blanch the green onions in the potato water. Otherwise followed the recipe. It turned out great. Absolutely going to make this my go-to potato salad for parties and pot lucks!'}, {'name': 'Martha M', 'review': 'This recipe delivered what it promised. I liked the blanching of the green onions whilst draining the cooked potatoes, it softened them nicely and overall the salad had a great, classic "sour cream and onion" flavor. It is a VERY rich and creamy potato salad. I would not have served it immediately; yes it tasted good just after mixing, but was on the soupy side. Once chilled, the potatoes had absorbed some of the dressing and it was more cohesive. To that end, if I were to want to serve it immediately, I would probably cut back on sour cream in the dressing. I typically favor a potato salad with a more vinegar-y, lemony bite, but this was great - and as I previously said, it delivered on the sour cream and onion-y-ness!'}, {'name': 'Mary Gottesman', 'review': 'I love this recipe! I like sour cream much more than Mayo. I thought the mustard and lemon juice really amped up the flavor. I live alone and halved the recipe. The sour cream would be 6 Tbsp for those of you wanting to cut back on volume. I added a Tablespoon of kosher salt to the cooking water. Then I added 1/2 tsp salt after tasting the finished product. Definitely will make again.'}, {'name': 'sushil', 'review': 'Delicious Salad'}]

og:title: Bánh Mì Salad Is a Light, Crunchy Take on the Flavorful Sandwich
og:description: Turn the classic Vietnamese sandwich into a salad that’s full of color, crunch, and vibrant flavor. Bánh mì salad makes an impressive lunch or a low-key, fresh-tasting dinner.
Title: Banh Mi Salad
Author: Sheela Prakash
Description:
Banh Mi Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 20 mins; Marinate Time: 30 mins; Total Time: 70 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 1/2 cup distilled white vinegar, 1/2 cup water, 1/4 cup granulated sugar, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 2 medium carrots, 1 (6-ounce) piece daikon (no more than 2 inches wide), 2 tablespoons minced lemongrass, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tablespoon sugar, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 tablespoon fish sauce, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 1 1/2 pounds boneless skinless chicken thighs, Juice of 1 medium lime (about 2 tablespoons), 2 tablespoons mayonnaise, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 small or 1/2 medium jalapeño pepper, seeded and minced (about 1 tablespoon), 1 clove garlic, minced, 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, 2 medium romaine lettuce hearts (about 8 ounces total), chopped or sliced, 2 Persian cucumbers (about 6 ounces total), thinly sliced, 1/2 cup fresh cilantro leaves, French baguette, for serving (optional)
Reviews: [{'name': 'Laurel R', 'review': 'So, so delicious. Like a big, veg-forward, crunchy bahn mi. I made the do chua and marinated the chicken before work, baked the chicken during a break and shredded it, and then assembled for lunch. Easy peasy. Excited to eat it again tomorrow.'}]

og:title: Pizza Salad Is as Fun and Flavorful as It Sounds
og:description: The best salads are ones with plenty of flavor and fun, and this pizza salad is just that. It features all your favorite pizza toppings in one big bowl.
Title: Pizza Salad
Author: Devan Grimsrud
Description:
Pizza Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 25 mins; Total Time: 25 mins; Servings: 4
to 8 servings
Ingredients: 1/4 cup red wine vinegar, 1 teaspoon tomato paste, 2 teaspoons Dijon mustard, 1/2 teaspoon sugar, 1 1/2 teaspoons dried oregano, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, 1 teaspoon black pepper, 3/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil, 6 ounces sliced pepperoni slices, 5 ounces mini mozzarella balls (or large balls, quartered), 2/3 cup sliced black olives, 1 cup sliced red onion, 2 cups chopped bell pepper (yellow, red, green), 4 packed cups shredded iceberg lettuce, 4 packed cups chopped romaine lettuce, 1/2 cup freshly, finely grated Parmesan cheese, 4 breadsticks
Reviews: [{'name': 'Louise', 'review': 'i want to make a pizza salad for Louise and my mum'}, {'name': 'Austin S', 'review': 'This was a home run - I was really surprised by how much I liked this salad. My husband loved it too. The pepperoni gave a nice little spice and I love lots of crunch in my salad which the peppers, onion, and lettuces were perfect for. I added some trader joes cheese garlic breadsticks - loved this suggestion.'}, {'name': 'Austin S', 'review': 'This was a home run - I was really surprised by how much I liked this salad. My husband loved it too. The pepperoni gave a nice little spice and I love lots of crunch in my salad which the peppers, onion, and lettuces were perfect for. I added some trader joes cheese garlic breadsticks - loved this suggestion.'}]

og:title: For a Hearty Salad , Make Flavor-Packed Roasted Sweet Potato Salad
og:description: Roasted sweet potatoes add a ton of flavor to this healthy, hearty salad and black beans add a punch of protein.
Title: Roasted Sweet Potato Salad
Author: Sheela Prakash
Description:
Roasted Sweet Potato Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 30 mins; Total Time: 45 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 2 pounds sweet potatoes (3 medium or 2 large), 4 tablespoons olive oil, divided, 1 tablespoon chili powder, 3/4 teaspoon kosher salt, divided, plus more to taste, 1/2 medium red onion, 1 large lime, 2 (14-ounce) cans black beans, drained and rinsed, 1 to 2 packed cups baby spinach, 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more to taste, 4 ounces feta cheese, crumbled (about 1 cup)
Reviews: [{'name': 'Ria', 'review': 'Delicious! Have made this so many times. Filling and tasty! Thank you'}, {'name': 'Jo', 'review': 'Can you use frozen sweet potato that is already cubed? Will they roast as well once they are thawed prior to going in oven?'}, {'name': 'Theresa Zeelsdorf', 'review': 'Very good'}, {'name': 'Maria ', 'review': 'Thank you for the nutritional value included. 58 carbs? Per servings?'}, {'name': 'Elisabeth R', 'review': 'I made this for lunch and ate it a few days last week. So hearty and delicious! I added extra spinach and an extra splash of lime and oil.'}]

og:title: Love Olive Garden Salad? Now You Can Easily Make It at Home!
og:description: Everyone knows the best thing at Olive Garden is the unlimited salad and breadsticks. Make your own Olive Garden-style salad at home with this recipe!
Title: Copycat Olive Garden Salad
Author: Nicole McLaughlin
Description:
Copycat Olive Garden Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 15 mins; Servings: 6
to 8 servings
Ingredients: 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil, 3 tablespoons mayonnaise, 1 tablespoon white wine vinegar, 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice (from 1 lemon), 1 1/2 teaspoons granulated sugar, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, 3/4 teaspoon black pepper, 1/2 teaspoon Italian seasoning, 1 garlic clove, smashed, 1 ounce Parmesan cheese, grated (about 1/4 cup), 2 (5-ounce) packages American blend salad mix, 3/4 cup pitted black olives, 3/4 cup pickled pepperoncini, 1/2 cup thinly sliced red onion, 2 plum tomatoes, sliced, 1 (4.5-ounce) package large seasoned croutons
Reviews: [{'name': 'Anne Norman Hastings', 'review': 'This is exactly like the OG salad dressing. I throw everything into my Ninja (double the recipe). Remember to let those croutons get a little soaked!'}, {'name': ' Janet Bridges', 'review': 'OMG!! This is fantastic. I made it for my dinner guests last night. They devoured every last bit. They even used bread to scrape the remnants of dressing from the bowl. All five raved about it, and 3 of them said it was better than Olive Garden. I made it exactly as written but substituted apple cider vinegar for the white wine vinegar because I didn’t have any. This is a winner. Thank you soooooo much.'}]

og:title: The 5-Ingredient Tomato Salad I Make All Summer Long
og:description: This tomato salad is just five ingredients and takes 20 minutes to throw together. It’s the perfect summer side dish and showcases fresh, ripe tomatoes.
Title: The 5-Ingredient Tomato Salad I Make All Summer Long
Author: Alison Spiegel
Description: The 5-Ingredient Tomato Salad I Make All Summer Long
Ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds (3 to 4 medium) tomatoes, cut into chunks, 3/4 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more to taste, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 1/2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil, 1 1/2 teaspoons rice wine vinegar, 1/2 teaspoon sugar

og:title: I Can't Stop (Won't Stop) Making This Easy Greek Salad Dressing
og:description: This 5-minute crunchy Greek salad is easy to make, full of flavor, and perfect for summer. Throw it together at the last minute to complete a meal.
Title: I Can't Stop (Won't Stop) Making This Easy Greek Salad Dressing
Author: Devan Grimsrud
Description: I Can't Stop (Won't Stop) Making This Easy Greek Salad Dressing
Ingredients: 1 English cucumber, quartered lengthwise and thinly sliced, 2 scallions, thinly sliced, 3 tablespoons finely chopped fresh dill, 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more to taste, 4 ounces feta cheese, 1 lemon, 2 hearts romaine lettuce, cored and roughly chopped, 1/4 cup olive oil, Salt, to taste

og:title: The 3-Ingredient Dinner I Make All the Time
og:description: When I’m tired and need a quick and easy dinner, I turn to this 3-ingredient dumpling salad recipe. It takes about 10 minutes to make and satisfies every single time.
Title: The 3-Ingredient Dinner I Make All the Time
Author: Laurel Randolph
Description: The 3-Ingredient Dinner I Make All the Time
Ingredients: Oil, as needed for cooking the dumplings, 10 to 12 frozen dumplings, 1 Asian-style salad kit with dressing (I like Trader Joe’s Miso Crunch), 1 to 2 tablespoons, chili crisp

og:title: The 5-Minute Salad I Make Every Single Week
og:description: This easy kale salad is lemony, bright, and takes just five minutes to make. Massaging the kale tenderizes and flavors it, making it delicious as is or as a base for adding toppings and mix-ins of your choice.
Title: The 5-Minute Salad I Make Every Single Week
Author: Devan Grimsrud
Description: Easy Kale Salad Recipe (3 Ingredients, 5 Minutes)
Ingredients: Toss in shredded rotisserie or, poached chicken, Add chickpeas,, preferably crispy, !, Serve with a, boiled egg, Add any toasted nut, Serve with your favorite roasted vegetables, Top with seasoned, toasted breadcrumbs or croutons, Top with your favorite cheese; I like Parmesan or cubes of sharp cheddar, Toss in your favorite bagged salad mix to make it a mixed greens salad, Add your favorite cooked grain—I especially like, quinoa

og:title: The "Coronation Coleslaw" I Can't Stop Making
og:description: If you like coronation chicken, then you have to try coronation slaw. Creamy, tart, spiced, and sweet, it’s a wonderful mixture of flavors and textures and pairs perfect with grilled meats, fish, and just about anything else.
Title: Coronation Coleslaw
Author: Laurel Randolph
Description:
Coronation Coleslaw Recipe (20 Minutes)
Prep Time: 20 mins; Total Time: 20 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 1 (16-ounce) bag coleslaw mix, 1 tablespoon kosher salt, plus more to taste, 1 large mango, somewhat ripe to ripe, 2 green onions, 3 tablespoons mayonnaise, 2 tablespoons plain yogurt or sour cream, 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice, 2 teaspoons yellow curry powder, 1/3 cup raisins (any kind), currants, or chopped dates, 1/2 cup toasted cashews, roughly chopped, 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
Reviews: [{'name': 'Maytte', 'review': 'I'm going to add a handful of cilantro and replace the raisins with chopped dried papaya. Can't wait to try out this recipe, thank you!'}]

og:title: The 5-Minute Southern Tomato Salad I Can’t Stop Making
og:description: For a tomato salad unlike any other, make my 5-minute Southern tomato salad recipe. You just need a few ingredients, including some surprising item that makes this dish special.
Title: Southern Tomato Cracker Salad
Author: Stephanie A Ganz
Description: Southern Tomato Cracker Salad Recipe
Ingredients: 1 cup mayonnaise (I use Duke’s), 1 teaspoon apple cider vinegar, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1 pound tomatoes, stemmed and roughly chopped, 1 sleeve saltine crackers, 1/4 cup thinly sliced red onion, optional

og:title: The Cucumber Salad I've Been Obsessed With Since Childhood
og:description: Kachumber salad is a classic Indian salad made with cucumbers, tomatoes, onion, fresh herbs, and spices. It’s a quick and easy make-ahead recipe for a refreshing side dish.
Title: Kachumber Salad
Author: Annika Panikker
Description:
Kachumber Salad Recipe (Indian Cucumber and Tomato Salad)
Prep Time: 10 mins; Chill Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 25 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 1 medium red onion, diced, 1 lime, juiced (about 2 tablespoons), 1/2 teaspoon salt, plus more to taste, 1 large beefsteak or heirloom tomato, chopped, 1 large English cucumber or 2 medium regular cucumbers, chopped, 1 serrano pepper, finely diced, 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, finely chopped, 1/4 cup fresh mint leaves, finely chopped, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1/2 teaspoon chaat masala, optional
Reviews: [{'name': 'proud 2 b', 'review': 'Very delicious as is, although we did add an Avocado this last time. We needed to use it before it got too soft and it was delicious with it as well. So happy we found this recipe. Great on its own or with any meal we have tried. Thank you ❤️'}, {'name': 'Laurel L', 'review': 'So easy but so delicious! I used 4 medium Persian cucumbers and 1 large heirloom tomato. I ended up adding chickpeas to the leftovers to stretch it into a lunch.'}, {'name': 'Robert Skene', 'review': 'What is up with Raw Red Onion! Talk about Hot and Heartburn in the same breath! That is if you are lucky enough to be able to BREATHE and the Ranitidine close 🇨🇦😂'}, {'name': 'Nicholas Benedetto', 'review': 'Why doesn't anyone use celery in the cucumber salad? Or green olives. I think those would go well.'}, {'name': 'Carl Smoker', 'review': 'Very refreshing cast of ingredients.'}]

og:title: The 4-Ingredient Corn Salad I’ve Been Making for Years
og:description: Celebrate sweet, juicy fresh corn in all its glory with this easy, four-ingredient recipe. It takes mere minutes to make this corn salad—the whole family will love it.
Title: 4-Ingredient Corn Salad
Author: Sara Haas, RDN, LDN
Description: 4-Ingredient Corn Salad Recipe
Ingredients: 4 large ears sweet corn, husked and silks removed, halved, 4 green onions, ends trimmed and thinly sliced, 1 lime, zest and juiced, 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

og:title: My Mom's Secret Ingredient for the Best Chicken and Noodles
og:description: If comfort food is what you’re after, then you’ll want a bowl of my mom’s chicken and noodles.
Title: My Mom's Secret Ingredient for the Best Chicken and Noodles
Author: Sara Haas, RDN, LDN
Description: My Mom's Chicken and Noodles Recipe
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, divided, 2 medium carrots, cut into 1/4-inch slices, 2 ribs celery, cut into 1/4-inch slices, 1/2 small white onion, diced, 1 clove garlic, minced, 2 bone-in skin-on chicken breasts (about 1 1/2 pounds), 1 quart low-sodium chicken broth, Salt and pepper, to taste, 8 ounces dried, Amish, or, spaetzle, noodles, Chopped parsley for garnish, if desired

og:title: Homemade Wonton Soup Will be a Family Favorite
og:description: On chilly days, these delicate one-bite pork wontons served in a soothing chicken broth will warm you through. Homemade wonton soup is easy with this recipe.
Title: Wonton Soup
Author: Vivian Jao
Description:
Wonton Soup Recipe
Prep Time: 60 mins; Cook Time: 10 mins; Simmering Time: 2 hrs 30 mins; Total Time: 3 hrs 40 mins; Servings: 6
to 8 servings
Ingredients: 1 (4 pound) whole chicken, 15 cups cold water, 1 medium yellow onion, halved, 3 cloves garlic, smashed, 3 scallions, halved crosswise, 1-inch fresh ginger, cut into 1/4-inch coins and smashed, 1 tablespoon Tianjin preserved vegetables, finely chopped (optional), Kosher salt, for seasoning the broth to taste, 1 pound ground pork, 2 scallions, minced, 1 clove garlic, minced, 1/4-inch fresh ginger, peeled and minced, 1 large egg, 1 tablespoon Shaoxing wine, 3 tablespoons water, 1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil, 1 1/2 teaspoons cornstarch, 1 teaspoon sugar, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, All-purpose flour, for dusting the sheet pan (optional), 80 square wonton wrappers, 1 scallion, thinly sliced, 1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil
Reviews: [{'name': 'Nadya Anthony Taylor', 'review': 'Loved it! What a great recipe! I was hesitant. It does take time, but so worth it. Great flavor!'}]

og:title: This 15-Minute Corn Recipe Requires Zero Cooking
og:description: In this corn and black bean salad, fresh sweet corn is enjoyed raw, along with tender black beans, fresh greens, and a creamy, tangy lime dressing. The no-cook recipe comes together in just 15 minutes and is perfect for hot summer days when you don’t want to turn on the stove.
Title: This 15-Minute Corn Recipe Requires Zero Cooking
Author: Afton Cyrus and Melissa Gray
Description:
Corn and Black Bean Salad Recipe (15 Minutes, No-Cook)
Prep Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 15 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 4 cups (about 2 ounces) loosely packed spring mix or baby lettuces, 1 (15.5-ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed, 1 1/2 cups fresh corn kernels from 2 ears corn , 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves and tender stems, plus more for garnish, 1/2 cup crumbled Cotija cheese, divided, 1 medium lime, 1/3 cup mayonnaise, 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more for garnish, 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt
Reviews: [{'name': 'Marianne W', 'review': 'I could eat this whole bowl! It feels hearty yet light, and so packed with flavor.'}]

og:title: The 30-Minute Chicken Soup I Make When I Need Comfort
og:description: I make this quick and comforting Flipino chicken noodle soup all fall and winter long. It comes together in under 30 minutes, 3 steps, and uses easy-to-find ingredients. A secret ingredient makes this recipe extra special.
Title: Macaroni Chicken Sopas
Author: Elizabeth Ann Quirino
Description:
Macaroni Chicken Sopas Recipe (Filipino Chicken Noodle Soup)
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 25 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1 medium white or yellow onion, chopped, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 stalk celery, chopped, 1 cup diced carrots (about 2 medium), 1 tablespoon patis (fish sauce), like Red Boat, 1 cup (8 ounces) dry pasta, like elbow macaroni, 1 cup (5.5 ounces) diced or shredded cooked chicken, 2 (32-ounce) cartons chicken stock, Kosher salt, to taste, 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, or to taste, 1/4 cup milk
Reviews: [{'name': 'Nishat', 'review': 'This soup is delicious! It's so simple to make and is packed with vitamins and minerals depending on the veggies you add. \n\nThis will definitely be a firm favourite from now on so thank you for sharing 😊'}, {'name': 'Frank T', 'review': 'If you haven't add fish sauce to your delicious home classic - the chicken noodle soup - you're really missing out. This has all the nostalgic and comforting flavors with a twist and flare. This recipe has layers of flavor, even if it just a small of fish sauce is added to the recipe without overpowering the things you love about chicken noodle soup. Plus, you can use the rest of rotisserie chicken meat stuck on the carcass to make a whole new meal out of it. I am definitely adding fish sauce to my chicken noodle soup nights.'}]

og:title: The 30-Minute Greek-Inspired Dinner I’m Making All Summer Long
og:description: In this quick recipe for grilled Greek chicken salad, a lemony, garlicky vinaigrette does double duty as a marinade for grilled chicken and a bright salad dressing. The salad is packed with lots of fresh chopped veggies and salty feta and comes together in just 30 minutes.
Title: The 30-Minute Greek-Inspired Dinner I’m Making All Summer Long
Author: Rebecca Fennel
Description:
Greek Grilled Chicken Salad Recipe (30 Minutes)
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 30 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil, 1/3 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 2 teaspoons dried oregano, 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 1 1/2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breast cutlets, 1 English cucumber, 3 to 4 vine-ripened tomatoes, 1 green bell pepper, 1/4 red onion, 1 cup crumbled feta cheese, 1/4 cup chopped parsley, optional, Grilled pita bread, for serving, optional
Reviews: [{'name': 'Ellen', 'review': 'I made this for dinner tonight and it was so simple and delicious! Something you could easily pay $20 for at a bougie cafe. Perfect for lunch leftovers the next day too! Definitely adding to the rotation.'}, {'name': 'Laurel R', 'review': 'So delicious and easy! A perfect summer lunch.'}, {'name': 'Yvonne Johnson', 'review': 'Sounds very nice. I will make'}]

og:title: Curry-Scented Chicken Mulligatawny Soup Is a Comforting Anglo-Indian Treat
og:description: This curry-scented chicken mulligatawny is more than soup, it's the ultimate one-bowl meal.
Title: Chicken Mulligatawny Soup
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Chicken Mulligatawny Soup Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 50 mins; Total Time: 65 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons butter, 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil, 1 large onion, chopped (about 2 cups), 2 ribs celery, chopped (about 1 cup), 2 carrots, chopped (about 1 cup), 2 bay leaves, 4 teaspoons curry powder, 1 1/4 pound (570g) boneless, skinless chicken thighs, trimmed of visible fat, 2 cups (475 ml) chicken stock, 2 cups (475 ml) water, 1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt (or 1 teaspoon sea salt), 1/4 cup uncooked basmati rice, 2 tart apples, cored, peeled, and chopped (about 2 cups), 1/4 cup (60 ml) heavy whipping cream, 1/4 cup (60 ml) plain yogurt, for garnish, 1 tablespoon minced chives, for garnish
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Baarry', 'review': 'I've made this recipe a few times and its just the best. Even my Grand daughters eat it and they are very picky eaters. Now Winters here in Australia its time for it again with nice crusty bread.'}, {'name': 'Valerie Burks', 'review': 'Wonderful! I'm on a low sodium diet and used reduced sodium broth. Will become one of my most used winter recipes.'}, {'name': 'Marcie', 'review': 'Thank you for posting this! It is wonderful!

I was concerned about all the simmering that someone posted about. So I did a few steps differently:

I buy chicken locally, and the thighs are kind of wimpy. After I boned and skinned the thighs, I soaked them overnight in buttermilk (which I always do with chicken) seasoned with curry powder, salt, and a little sugar.

The thighs were so thin that I would not have been able to shred them, so I blotted them to get the buttermilk off and cut them into pieces. Then I threw them in with the sautéed vegies (sautéed with both Garam masala and curry powder), added a carton of chicken stock (32 oz.), and simmered with the apples for 10 minutes. I also precooked the basmati rice (I will double the rice next time!), and threw the cooked rice in the pot.

It was ready to serve, but we like thick soup, so I added some beurre manor to the pot, then served it with a small pitcher of coconut milk that people could add themselves.

One problem: No one could taste the apples!'}, {'name': 'Joe O ', 'review': 'I am a soup "guy" and this is THE best soup I have ever made. If you can get some "real" Indian curries like garam masala, or tandoori masala, Biryani masala...all the better. Remember to not boil the soup after you add the cream or it will separate. My go to now for pure flavour!'}, {'name': 'Stitch Jones', 'review': "THANK YOU for posting this recipe, my family really enjoyed it & we'll be doubling it from now on so we can enjoy even more of it!


My rice took additional 10 mins to fully cook (perhaps my simmer was lower than yours) and by the end the carrots and celery were mushy and nearly tasteless (they had now been cooked 55-60 mins). 



Do you think it would be ok to add chicken, rice, apples all together in step #2 to reduce total cooking time and maintain the texture of all ingredients?"}]

og:title: You Need to Make This Classic Mexican Chicken Tortilla Soup
og:description: Our best recipe for this classic Mexican soup is a showstopper and comfort in a bowl all at once. Stale corn tortillas make for a flavorful soup base and crispy topping, plus leftover shredded chicken or a rotisserie chicken cut down on cooking time.
Title: Chicken Tortilla Soup
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Chicken Tortilla Soup Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 20 mins; Total Time: 30 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 6 (6-inch) corn tortillas, preferably a little old and dried out, 1/4 cup corn oil, peanut oil, or extra virgin olive oil, 1/2 cup chopped onion, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 medium Anaheim, poblano or jalapeño chili, seeded, veins removed, chopped (Depending on the hotness and flavor desired. You can also mix chilies—1 Anaheim and a 1/2 jalapeño.), 4 cups chicken broth or homemade chicken stock, 1 (14.5-ounce) can crushed tomatoes (preferably fire-roasted), 1/2 teaspoon coarse salt (kosher or sea salt), 1 1/2 cups shredded cooked chicken, 1 ripe avocado, 1/2 cup (2 ounces) shredded Monterey Jack cheese (or mild cheddar), Chopped fresh cilantro, 1 lime, cut into wedges
Reviews: [{'name': 'RamaaGurubhagavathula ', 'review': 'Fantastic. It's got carbohydrates in the tortillas, protein in the chicken, fat, vegetables give vitamins and minerals...it's a balanced meal in itself..and tasty to boot.'}, {'name': 'DixieAngel_76', 'review': "Supposing one doesn't like (can't stand, actually) cilantro?"}, {'name': 'Americus91', 'review': 'This soup is delicious and so much fun to make! Made it twice following recipe exactly and it turned out great!'}, {'name': 'Craig', 'review': "I first had this soup in San Antonio years ago, and love it.\nIf you didn't want to make the red version, could you leave the tomatoes out or would that adversely affect the outcome?"}, {'name': 'Petunia', 'review': "I think this is the best soup I've ever made and I make a lot of soups!! I made this IN México so the ingredients were super cheap! I followed the recipe almost exactly but used fresh tomatoes that we threw on the charcoal grill with a few spices (canned are hard to find here) and only used 1/2 jalapeño as we are kind of wussy when it comes to spice. The recipe is small so double it if you have more than 2 people, but we couldn't get enough and ate until we were stuffed!!"}]

og:title: The Creamy Chicken Soup I Crave the Moment It Gets Cold Outside
og:description: For this creamy and cozy chicken soup recipe, skip the heavy cream or roux and lean on an everyday pantry staple to add a super-silky texture.
Title: Creamy Chicken Soup
Author: Summer Miller
Description:
Creamy Chicken Soup Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 45 mins; Total Time: 65 mins; Servings: 8
to 10 servings
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons olive oil, 6 large carrots, diced, 4 ribs celery, diced, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 large onion, diced, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/4 teaspoon freshly cracked black pepper, 2 teaspoons dried thyme, 1 bay leaf, 8 cups chicken stock, store-bought or homemade, 4 bone-in chicken thighs (about 1 1/2 pounds), 8 ounces egg noodles, 2 (15.5-ounce) cans cannellini beans, 2 teaspoons apple cider vinegar, 1/2 cup heavy cream, 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
Reviews: [{'name': 'David F', 'review': 'I love this recipe, first place I learned the white bean for creaminess. I also add mushrooms & wild rice, do healthy and the flavors work great together.'}]

og:title: This Classic Italian Wedding Soup Features Pork and Beef Meatballs
og:description: With pork and beef meatballs, greens, and tiny pasta, it's ready in about an hour from start to finish.
Title: Italian Wedding Soup
Author: Sheryl Julian
Description:
Italian Wedding Soup Recipe
Prep Time: 30 mins; Cook Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 45 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 3/4 cup tiny pasta, such as Israeli or pearl semolina couscous, orzo, ditalini, or acini de pepe, 2 quarts chicken stock, 1/2 head or bunch escarole, Swiss chard, or kale, stemmed and cut into 1-inch pieces, 1 cup freshly grated Parmesan, for serving, 1 small soft dinner roll or 2 slices white bread, torn into 1-inch pieces, 1/4 cup milk (any kind), 1 large egg, 8 ounces ground beef, 8 ounces ground pork, 1 small onion, very finely chopped, 1 clove garlic, crushed, 1/2 cup freshly grated Parmesan, 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
Reviews: [{'name': 'Elisabeth', 'review': 'Made this just this morning and it is delicious. Used frozen, homemade chix stock, kale, orzo pasta....doubled the meatball recipe and froze half for later date. This recipe was so easy. I think the main key to success/tastiness is using a really flavorful broth. Added a little lemon at the end for brightness.'}, {'name': 'Aimee', 'review': 'An old friend told me years ago to grate hard boiled eggs into the soup (the larger grate) and I have done so ever since, maybe 4 eggs total. The yolk gives the broth a creamer consistency and the egg whites just blend right into the other ingredients.'}, {'name': 'Leanne', 'review': "This soup was absolutely delicious, and seemed to taste better with each bite! I didn't have any Swiss chard or kale on hand so used about 6 cups of loosely packed spinach instead. I also happened to be using up the end of my Parmesan cheese, so I added the rind to the pot just as the meatballs were simmering and discarded it just before serving. Seriously great soup!"}, {'name': 'Cynthia', 'review': "I just made this for dinner. I cannot beleive the flavor and it's so simple! I used three different types of kale and a couple leafs of chard. The flavor of the kale with the broth is amazing! I also used the Israel couscous so the soups wasn't overwhelmed by pasta! I also replaced the ground pork with ground turkey. Very, very good."}]

og:title: This Refreshing 5-Ingredient Summer Salad Is My Picnic Go-To
og:description: You can't get a more refreshing summer salad combo than fresh peaches, cucumber, and basil. This recipe is a standout on its own but goes wonderfully with seafood or grilled chicken or pork.
Title: The Refreshing 5-Ingredient Salad I'm Making All Summer Long
Author: Kalisa Marie Levette
Description:
Peach, Cucumber, and Basil Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 10 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 1 (12 to 14-inch) English cucumber, cut into 1-inch chunks, 2 fresh peaches, cut into 1-inch chunks, 1 lime, zested and juiced, 2 tablespoons avocado oil or olive oil, 1 tablespoon honey, 4 large fresh basil leaves, plus more for garnish, 1/8 teaspoon kosher salt, or to taste, 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, or to taste

og:title: The Creamy Enchilada Soup I Make on Repeat
og:description: This crowd-pleasing creamy chicken enchilada soup recipe is full of Mexican-inspired flavors. It’s loaded with hearty chicken, corn, and beans. Ancho chile powder gives it an instant kick!
Title: Creamy Chicken Enchilada Soup
Author: Sally Vargas
Description:
Creamy Chicken Enchilada Soup Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 20 mins; Total Time: 40 mins; Servings: 6
to 8 servings
Ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 medium white onion, halved and sliced, 1 clove garlic, thinly sliced, 1 tablespoon ancho chile powder, 1 teaspoon dried oregano, 2 teaspoons brown sugar, 1/2 teaspoon salt, plus more to taste, 2 (28-ounce) cans whole, peeled tomatoes with juice, preferably fire roasted , 4 ounces (about 1 heaping cup) Monterey jack cheese, shredded, 1 cup chicken stock, 1/2 cup heavy cream, 3 cups cooked chicken, shredded, 3 cups corn kernels, fresh or frozen (no need to defrost), 1 (14.5-ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained, 1/2 cup crema, or a mix of 1/4 cup sour cream and 1/4 cup heavy cream, Cilantro leaves, Thinly sliced jalapeños, Lime wedges, Crumbled cotija cheese (or feta), Diced avocado, Warm corn tortillas, Diced white onion, Shredded Monterey jack cheese
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Ceile Phelps', 'review': 'Advise on freezing extras?'}, {'name': 'Ceile Phelps', 'review': 'What are the corn tortillas for? They're not mentioned in directions.'}, {'name': 'Susan', 'review': 'I made this last night and it’s a keeper. It’s a great way to use up some odds and ends of chicken in the freezer.
I made a few small changes, due to what I had on hand..I used 3 15 oz cans of diced tomatoes and a can of Rotel, instead of canned whole tomatoes. I put some dried cilantro in the crema.
Next time, I’ll make sure to have some of the suggested garnishes on hand. A squeeze of lime and some fresh cilantro would have been great'}, {'name': 'Angel', 'review': 'Best soup I've ever made. I substituted cotija cheese and Monterey cheese with cheddar cheese. Used 2 normal canned tomato instead of the fire roasted tomatoes and Heinz beans in tomato sauce instead of black beans.
I seasoned the sliced chicken with salt, black pepper, garlic powder, paprika and lemon seasoning. Added black pepper to the soup and more chill. Added the cilantro leaves at the end of cooking.
Only garnished with thinly sliced jalapeños, cheddar cheese and lime wedges. Perfectly served in a middle size bowl with a side of basmati rice.'}]

og:title: Need To Use Up a Bunch of Kale? Make Kale Sausage Soup with Tomatoes and Chickpeas
og:description: Hearty kale sausage soup! With Italian sausage, tomatoes, garbanzo beans, onions, garlic, and kale.
Title: Kale Sausage Soup with Tomatoes and Chickpeas
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Kale Sausage Soup with Tomatoes and Chickpeas Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 60 mins; Total Time: 75 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 1/2 pound mild Italian bulk sausage, Olive oil (if needed), 3 cups sliced onions, 5 cloves garlic, minced (about 5 teaspoons), 1 (28-ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes with their juices, roughly chopped, 8 cups chicken stock, 2 bay leaves, 2 sprigs of oregano (or 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano), 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 6 cups sliced kale (about 2 bunches lacinato kale, stems removed, leaves sliced into 1/2-inch-wide slices), 1 (15-ounce) can of chickpeas, drained, Kosher salt, to taste, 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese, for garnish
Reviews: [{'name': 'Born again conservative', 'review': 'I made this without the sausage and with white kidney beans, delicious tomato chicken stock base with Parmesan to add richness'}, {'name': 'Nicole', 'review': 'Really delicious! I used whole stewed tomatoes instead of fresh and still turned out soooo delicious!'}, {'name': 'mgperizz@gmail.com', 'review': 'Do you add the juice from the canned tomatoes too or just the tomatoes?\nThanks'}, {'name': 'Katie', 'review': 'My five year old not only liked it, but cleaned her bowl, and my son with Aspergers ate all of his and said it was okay, which for him is high praise. This is going into the regular rotation. Thank you!'}, {'name': 'Mary from NJ', 'review': "This is one of the most delicious soups I've ever made - and that's a lot of soups! I did use small white beans instead of chickpeas cause that's what I had but otherwise everything was the same. I made it Sunday afternoon and combined all except the kale. It filled 3 quart \n containers. Froze one for later. On Tuesday night I heated up two quarts, added the kale and let it simmer until kale was soft. So delicious! Great combination of flavors!"}]

og:title: This One-Pot Curry Turkey Soup Is Inspired By Mulligatawny Soup
og:description: Easy one-pot Mulligatawny-inspired curry turkey soup made with leftover turkey, apples, rice, curry powder, stock, onions, carrots, and celery. It wins over curry skeptics every time.
Title: Curried Turkey Soup (with Leftover Turkey)
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Curried Turkey Soup (with Leftover Turkey) Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 35 mins; Total Time: 55 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons butter, 2 cups chopped onion, 1 cup chopped celery, 1 cup chopped carrot, 4 teaspoons yellow curry powder, 4 cups chicken or turkey stock, 1/4 cup raw white rice (we use basmati), 2 green apples, peeled, cored, and diced, 1 teaspoon kosher salt (may add more to taste), 2 bay leaves, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, 2 cups chopped cooked turkey meat, 1/4 cup heavy cream, Sour cream or plain yogurt, for garnish, Chopped chives, for garnish
Reviews: [{'name': 'Jana', 'review': 'Could you use Yukon golden potatoes instead of apples? If so, how many?'}, {'name': 'Natalya ', 'review': 'This is mine and my husbands favorite food for Thanksgiving, just a day or two later 😉! We buy a larger turkey, so we can make a larger portion of this soup. We do make our own stock! The curry, the apples, the cream and its perfection!'}, {'name': 'Lotta Numbers', 'review': 'This recipe is a keeper, super delicious both with and without the addition of heavy cream. Other than that, the only change I made was using brown rice and adding an extra 2 TBLs of it.Thanks for sharing!'}, {'name': 'Robin Neal', 'review': 'I made this soup without the rice and later added pasta. I did not have the green apples on hand, so I skipped that. With the celery and onion I added 2 garlic cloves. This recipe is a winner!!!'}, {'name': 'Robin Neal', 'review': 'Can noodles be substituted for the rice?'}]

og:title: Whip Up a Batch of Hearty and Healthy Black Bean Soup on a Chilly Day
og:description: This hearty black bean soup is what you need on a cold and dreary day! Made with ham shanks, sweet potatoes, bell pepper, onion, cumin, and chili.
Title: Black Bean Soup
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Black Bean Soup {Hearty and Healthy}
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 105 mins; Total Time: 2 hrs 5 mins; Servings: 8 servings; Yield: 8 cups
Ingredients: 1 pound dried black beans, (about 2 cups), rinsed, soaked in 4 quarts of water overnight or 6 hours, drained, 1 pound smoked ham hock or shank, 2 bay leaves, 5 cups water, 1/8 teaspoon baking soda, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, 1 large yellow onion, finely chopped (2 cups), 1 medium sweet potato, chopped into 1/2-inch pieces (2 cups) (can substitute 2 large carrots), 1 carrot, finely chopped (1/2 cup), 1 celery rib, finely chopped (1/2 cup), 1 teaspoon salt, 4 garlic cloves, minced, 1 tablespoon ground cumin, 2 teaspoons chile powder, 2 cups chicken stock (add 2 teaspoons of salt, if using unsalted stock), 1 tablespoon molasses, 1 red bell pepper, roughly chopped, 3 to 4 tablespoons lime juice (can substitute lemon juice), Salt, Chopped fresh cilantro, Sour cream, Avocado, peeled and chopped
Reviews: [{'name': 'Judy Rilling', 'review': "I made this, and my family told me it is one of the best soups ever, and since they are not fans of spice, I only added Cumin, salt & pepper, no chili spice or lime. I used canned black beans. I will make this again, adding lime to see if it's loved as much."}, {'name': 'Helen', 'review': 'Wonderful soup! I make my own chicken stock. I used chicken stock in place of the water and I did not use molasses. I will make it again! Thanks!'}, {'name': 'Trey', 'review': 'This was excellent! Easy to make and everyone loved it. Will definitely be making this one again.'}, {'name': 'Melissa', 'review': 'We had a Honey Baked Ham that was already delicious. This recipe was an A+. The sweet flavor from the molasses and addition of sweet potato made the recipe unique and mouthwatering. My three teenage boys all had 2-3 bowls.'}, {'name': 'Lisa', 'review': "This was SO delicious, definitely the best soup I've ever made. I used my Instant Pot for Step One. My beans needed an extra 5 minutes of high pressure, so next time I will set the time to 25 minutes. I used my honey baked ham bone and could not believe how much yummy ham was released from the bone. I did not have any sweet potatoes or celery, and it did not matter. I can't wait to make it again!"}]

og:title: How to Make Shellfish Stock Like a Total Pro
og:description: Saving your crab, shrimp, and lobster shells is totally worth it to make this homemade shellfish stock. Our recipe has step-by-step photos and instructions, so you'll know exactly how to make it like a pro.
Title: How to Make Shellfish Stock
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
How to Make Shellfish Stock
Total Time: 0 mins; Servings: 8
to 12 servings; Yield: 2
to 3 quarts
Ingredients: 4 to 6 cups shellfish shells, from shrimp, lobster, and/or crab, 1/2 cup dry white wine, 1 large yellow onion, sliced or chopped, 1 carrot, roughly sliced or chopped, 1 celery stalk, roughly sliced or chopped, 2 tablespoons tomato paste, 2 sprigs thyme, Several sprigs parsley, 1 bay leaf, 10 to 15 whole peppercorns, 2 teaspoons salt
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Yasmine', 'review': 'I went with a kitchen sink method- using a gallon freezer bag full of veggie scraps and a cluster of king crab shells from dinner the other night. I added the shells solo for the first 30 mins (made the mistake of stirring them a couple times-- before reading the part about how not to stir the shells). I didn't get much foam but what i did get i skimmed off before adding the veggies. I'm getting a little bit of foam now and skimming the best i can. Its hard since all the veggies are floating at the top. MY QUESTION is, once i strain it into a new pot, could i then boil the stock to skim the remaining impurities? Or is it best/safest to use this as a learning batch and toss it?

My plan was to freeze the stock in Souper Cubes and use as a substitute in various recipes for stock or water-- not necessarily for a seafood soup/dish. 

Note- I've only ever made chicken stock using frozen veggie scraps and a costco rotisserie chicken carcass.'}, {'name': 'paperpushermj', 'review': 'I live in Sioux Falls So. Dakota...Not a crab or lobster within a 1,000 miles. Yes I can buy them at the local market but that would break the bank. Can I use Canned crab and lobster meat to flavor the stock?'}, {'name': 'Michael Schertz', 'review': 'Could you ads Sherry to this'}, {'name': 'Jayne', 'review': 'I used mostly crab and shrimp shells. Had the bones, head and tail from a whole fish. What do you think about some of the fish skin being added? I love this recipe and use it often for Paella and risotto.'}, {'name': 'Elaine', 'review': 'If I use lobster shells, do you use the body with the internal organs still in there?'}]

og:title: Nothing's Classier Than This Simple Watercress Soup
og:description: Making a simple and flavorful watercress soup is easy with bunches of fresh watercress, a splash of white wine, and potatoes. It's a classy soup for lunch or dinner.
Title: Watercress Soup
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Watercress Soup Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 40 mins; Total Time: 55 mins; Servings: 6
to 8 servings
Ingredients: 3 tablespoons butter, 2 cups white or yellow onion, chopped, Salt, 1 cup white wine, chicken stock, or vegetable stock (wine or veg stock for vegetarian version), 1 pound potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks, 6 cups water, 6 cups fresh watercress, about 1/2 pound, chopped, stems included, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper, About 6 tablespoons sour cream, stirred in, or for garnish
Reviews: [{'name': 'Rosie', 'review': 'Well, I forgot to add the water. When I realised my error I added more but the potatoes were already soft. Despite my mistake the watercress soup was delicious. I didn't add any salt in the recipe though and I halved the recipe ingredients, but added more watercress than that in the recipe. Good texture and wonderful colour.'}, {'name': 'Carrie', 'review': 'I found the soup to be very thin and watery despite the potatoes. I had to keep adding better than bouillon and salt to give it any taste and I followed the recipe to a T. I ended up adding alot more watercress and leaving it chunky to give it some texture. After alot of taste testing it came out ok but would not make again.'}, {'name': 'sally', 'review': 'Great recipe and great comments!'}, {'name': 'Diane', 'review': 'Absolutely delicious! I used stock and wine--no water. I also halved the recipe, as that was how much cress I had on hand. I'll definitely make again.'}, {'name': 'Liz', 'review': "I wasn't a huge fan. I thought it was a little too onion-y and bitter. The sour cream helps, but I probably won't make it again."}]

og:title: Tom Yum Soup (Spicy Thai Soup with Shrimp)
og:description: Let the spicy flavors of Thailand tempt your taste buds! Tom Yum Soup is a quick, easy, and healthy weeknight recipe. This brothy version is made with shrimp!
Title: Tom Yum Soup (Spicy Thai Soup with Shrimp)
Author: Aaron Hutcherson
Description:
Tom Yum Soup (Spicy Thai Soup with Shrimp) Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 30 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 1/2 pound shrimp, peeled and deveined, 2 stalks lemongrass (see Recipe Note), 6 cups water or shrimp stock, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 2 Thai (bird's eye) chiles, sliced, or more to taste, 1 lime, zested and juiced, 1 cup sliced button mushrooms, 1 teaspoon grated ginger, 1 teaspoon sugar, 2 teaspoons soy or fish sauce, plus more to taste, Cilantro leaves, Lime wedges
Reviews: [{'name': 'Edna B Whitmore', 'review': 'I am going to have to make this soup.....sounds DELICIOUS !!'}, {'name': 'JoseE', 'review': 'I am into hot and sour soup this winter. This looks good and simple.'}, {'name': 'navisos', 'review': "Nowadays it is easy just to buy Tom Yam paste, which contains all the important lemon grass. Small uncut button mushrooms, small tomatoes, and fresh cilantro should be added with the shrimp. I don't use lemon juice or lime juice at all.\nNo noodles are needed. Use enough for a large soup bowl per person."}, {'name': 'Todra@TravelLiveBreathe', 'review': "This is one of my favorite soups. You've got to be comfortable with flavor for this one. It has a lot of layers going on and it's wonderful."}, {'name': 'Louise', 'review': 'Ugh. Too spicy and I substituted lemon slices for lemon grass as mentioned above. Turned out bitter as well as too spicy! We picked out the shrimp and threw the rest of the soup out.'}]

og:title: My Mom Has Cooked This Albondigas Soup For Our Family For Over 50 Years
og:description: Classic Mexican soup made with meatballs (albondigas), green beans, onions, and chicken stock. This delicious soup recipe comes together in just 1 hour.
Title: Albondigas Soup (Mexican Meatball Soup)
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Albondigas Soup (Mexican Meatball Soup) Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 45 mins; Total Time: 60 mins; Servings: 6
to 8 servings
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, 1 large onion, chopped, 1 clove garlic, minced, 2 quarts chicken stock or beef stock, 1 quart water, 1/2 cup tomato sauce, 1/2 pound green beans, strings and ends removed, cut into 1-inch pieces, 2 large carrots, peeled and sliced, 1/3 cup white rice, 1 pound ground beef, 1/4 cup (loosely packed) chopped fresh spearmint leaves, 1/4 cup (loosely packed) chopped fresh parsley, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, plus more to taste, 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more to taste, 1 large egg, 1 1/2 cups frozen or fresh peas, 1 teaspoon dried oregano or 1 tablespoon fresh chopped oregano, 1 dash cayenne, optional, 1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro
Reviews: [{'name': 'Bubbalikesit', 'review': 'This will be my first time to make Albondigas. My friends mother (she's from the old country) made it a couple of weeks ago and it was fabulous. Your recipe is more or less just like she made and she told me that the ingredients could be slightly variable. Here's what she did that was different and I haven't seen it done online. For the meatball ingredients she used a small amount of oil and cooked the onion, garlic and get this, the RICE for a few minutes. She said it get the rice to "Pop". She said it gives the rice a slightly different flavor and helps hold the meatballs together much better.'}, {'name': 'Bety Jacques', 'review': 'I like this recipe. To make it comfort food for me, I’d add hard boiled egg pieces inside each meatball, the way my mom used to do it. She’s been gone nearly 40 years, but this soup brings her back.'}, {'name': 'cindy_pacheco', 'review': 'My mother-in-law made this but without all the vegetables. A wonderful addition!'}, {'name': 'Warren Contreras', 'review': 'Not complete without Pine Nuts for a totally unique flavor'}, {'name': 'David ', 'review': 'I add potato’s and a yellow onion instead of peas and green beans. Spanish rice is also made on the side to put into the soup'}]

og:title: Warm Up With Avgolemono, a Classic Greek Lemon Chicken Soup
og:description: A classic Greek Lemon Chicken Soup packed with lots of lemon, herbs, and veggies.
Title: Lemon Chicken Soup (Avgolemono)
Author: Yasmin Khan
Description:
Lemon Chicken Soup (Avgolemono) Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 70 mins; Total Time: 85 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 1 pound 2 ounces (500g) skinless chicken thighs on the bone, 1/2 small white onion, finely chopped, 2 fat cloves garlic, minced, 1 small celery stalk, finely chopped, 1 medium carrot, finely chopped, 3/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric, 2 bay leaves, 3 1/4 cup (750ml) chicken stock, 4 cups (960ml) just-boiled water, divided, Scant 1/2 cup (90g) short or medium-grain white rice, rinsed, 3 1/2 ounces (100g) kale, stalks removed, leaves shredded, 3 extra large eggs, 1 teaspoon finely grated unwaxed lemon zest, 6 tablespoons lemon juice, or to taste, 1 to 2 tablespoons chopped dill, or to taste, Extra virgin olive oil, Salt and black pepper
Reviews:
[{'name': 'brushjl', 'review': 'Wow! Super delicious. I used a preserved lemon and lacinato kale. Fabulous flavor and texture.'}, {'name': 'NASCAR4433', 'review': "Hi...this sounds very good, but I do have a couple of questions before trying it

Is there a substitute for the kale? We're not fans of it.

Why water rather than all broth?

Can I use store-bought bowl of pre-cooked jasmine rice?

Where can you find unwaxed lemons? Or, how can you de-wax them?

Thanks for your help! I don't want to mess it up from the start and end up tossing everything out."}, {'name': 'Harley Clark', 'review': 'Do you think this would be ok with brown rice?'}, {'name': 'D', 'review': 'I thought this soup would be weird at first with the cinnamon - but the cinnamon makes it! This soup is delicious. I make it constantly now. I don’t bother with the eggs and it comes out great.'}, {'name': 'Laura', 'review': 'Would this be ok to freeze or would using the eggs to thicken make freezing a bad choice? Thanks!'}]

og:title: Miso Soup
og:description: This version of the traditional Japanese dish, Miso Soup is drizzled with sesame oil and sprinkled with togarashi for a lightly smoky and savory spin.
Title: Miso Soup
Author: Vivian Jao
Description:
Miso Soup Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 25 mins; Total Time: 30 mins; Servings: 4 servings; Yield: 7 1/2 cups soup
