Ingredients: 2 tablespoons dried precut wakame seaweed, 1 (14x2 1/2-inch) piece of dried kelp (kombu), 8 cups water, 2 cups (20g) large dried bonito flakes (katsuobushi), lightly packed, 1/3 cup white miso paste, 1 (16 ounce) package silken tofu, cut into 1-inch cubes, 2 teaspoons sesame oil, 1 scallion, thinly sliced, 1/8 teaspoon shichimi togarashi (optional)

og:title: This Savory Korean Dumpling Soup Is a Family Favorite
og:description: Mandu Guk is a Korean dumpling soup that starts with a quick beef broth flavored with garlic, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Use store-bought or homemade dumplings for an easy and satisfying dinner.
Title: Mandu Guk (Korean Dumpling Soup)
Author: Cecilia Hae-Jin Lee
Description:
Mandu Guk (Korean Dumpling Soup) Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 45 mins; Total Time: 55 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 1 pound beef brisket or chuck, cut into 1- to 1 1/2-inch pieces, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 4 tablespoons soy sauce, 10 cups water, 32 homemade or store-bought mandu (Korean dumplings), fresh or frozen, 2 large eggs, 4 green onions, trimmed and cut diagonally into 2-inch slices, 2 tablespoons toasted sesame oil, 2 teaspoons salt, plus more to taste, 1 teaspoon white or black pepper, plus more to taste, 2 roasted nori (seaweed sheets), for serving
Reviews: [{'name': 'Amy', 'review': 'Delicious! I actually ate a 1/2 cup later that evening for a snack instead of dessert. High praise from me. This first attempt, I used frozen gyoza dumplings I had on hand but am gearing up to try making homemade Mandu dumplings for Lunar New Year. Thank you for a great recipe!'}]

og:title: Vegetarian French Onion Soup Is Just as Rich and Comforting as the Original
og:description: Sweet caramelized onions swimming in a rich, flavorful mushroom broth and topped with crusty bread and melted cheese is just the thing you need to keep warm this winter. Make this vegetarian French onion soup recipe for pure comfort.
Title: Vegetarian French Onion Soup
Author: Sharon Lehman, RD
Description:
Vegetarian French Onion Soup Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 80 mins; Total Time: 90 mins; Servings: 6 servings
Ingredients: 4 tablespoons unsalted butter, 2 tablespoons avocado oil or other neutral oil, 4 large (8 to 10 cups) yellow onions, cut into 1/8-inch slices, 1/2 cup dry white wine, like Sauvignon Blanc , 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, 8 cups mushroom broth, 3 sprigs fresh thyme, 2 dried bay leaves, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1 tablespoon vegan Worcestershire sauce, 2 teaspoons balsamic vinegar, 1 (12-inch) French baguette, cut into 1-inch slices, 6 slices (about 6 ounces) Swiss cheese, 1 1/2 cups (about 6 ounces) shredded gruyere cheese

og:title: What Makes This Kreplach Recipe So Easy? Ground Beef!
og:description: These triangle-shaped dumplings are enjoyed on Jewish holidays or any time the craving hits.
Title: Easy Beef Kreplach (Purim Dumplings)
Author: Coco Morante
Description:
Easy Beef Kreplach (Purim Dumplings) Recipe
Prep Time: 25 mins; Cook Time: 35 mins; Total Time: 60 mins; Servings: 8 servings; Yield: 4 dozen dumplings
Ingredients: 3 quarts chicken stock, 2 carrots, peeled and sliced into coins, 2 ribs celery, thinly sliced, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 yellow onion, minced, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, 1 pound ground beef (90% lean, 10% fat), 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1 (14-ounce) package (about 50) wonton wrappers (such as Twin Dragon brand), 2 tablespoons fresh chopped dill and/or parsley
Reviews: [{'name': 'Esther', 'review': 'wait a minute... *on* Yom Kippur? Kreplach are traditional for the day *before* Yom Kippur, but Yom Kippur itself is a fast day, so no food at all.'}]

og:title: Kimchi Jjigae (Korean Kimchi Stew)
og:description: This Kimchi Jjigae is a classic Korean kimchi stew made with a generous amount of pork belly. This recipe balances spicy, savory, and sweet flavors, which makes it the perfect weeknight dinner for when you crave comfort and warmth.
Title: Kimchi Jjigae (Korean Kimchi Stew)
Author: Vivian Jao
Description:
Kimchi Jjigae (Korean Kimchi Stew) Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 40 mins; Total Time: 55 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 2 cups short or medium grain rice, washed and drained, 2 cups water, 1 pound pork belly, cut into 1 1/2 x 1/4-inch pieces, 2 cups kimchi, 1/3 cup gochujang, 1 tablespoon gochugaru, 2 teaspoons sugar, 4 1/2 cups water, Soy sauce or fish sauce, to taste, 1 (16-ounce) package firm tofu, drained and cut into 1 1/2 x 1/4-inch planks, 1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil (optional), 1 teaspoon toasted sesame seeds (optional), 2 scallions, trimmed and thinly sliced
Reviews: [{'name': 'Holly Humbyrd', 'review': 'I love Kimchi Jjigae, it is my fall/winter go-to comfort food, and I've been making it for over 30 years now, pulling ideas from many different jjigae recipes over the years. My current recipe is much more labor intensive than this one and runs about 2.5 hours including prep time. Now that I'm almost 70, I really don't enjoy spending that much time over one dish, so now I'm on the hunt for a simpler recipe that does not sacrifice the rich, umame flavors I love. I will start with this recipe. I'm sure I will also be looking at your other Korean recipes as well. No, I am am not Korean, but I have a long time friend who is. She taught me the various dishes, and they've been a part of my personal menu ever since. I'm looking forward to exploring your recipes!'}, {'name': 'Christine', 'review': 'I made the vegetarian version, with mushrooms and onions to use up a surplus of homemade kimchi. It so easy and very tasty. I can only imagine how much tastier the pork version would be.'}]

og:title: I Make Marcella Hazan’s Soup When I Only Have 15 Minutes and Need Spoonfuls of Comfort
og:description: Marcella Hazan's white bean soup recipe calls for 5 ingredients and is one of the most delicious soups I've ever made. A smart technique brings out the hidden beauty of beans. It's my cure for cold-weather blues.
Title: I Make Marcella Hazan’s Soup When I Only Have 15 Minutes and Need Spoonfuls of Comfort
Author: Myo Quinn
Description: Marcella Hazan White Bean Soup Review

og:title: This Brilliant Trick Will Have You Making Soups All Winter Long
og:description: Leslie Bobo-Kiesel created a viral soup recipe that's going to save you so much time chopping vegetables and stirring them in the pot. Use this trick for any creamy soup you crave!
Title: For Easier Homemade Soups, Start in the Oven
Author: Sara Haas, RDN, LDN
Description: This Brilliant Trick Will Have You Making Soups All Winter Long

og:title: The Shortcut Soup I Make Every Time My Family Gets Sick
og:description: Whenever my family is under the weather, I make this quick and easy matzo ball soup. It combines store-bought ingredients with some homemade twists for a warming recipe that’s sure to cure what ails you.
Title: The Shortcut Soup I Make Every Time My Family Gets Sick
Author: Stephanie A Ganz
Description: Shortcut Lemony Matzo Ball Soup Recipe

og:title: The Only Broccoli Cheddar Soup Recipe You Need
og:description: This creamy broccoli cheddar soup takes less than 30 minutes to make and is as good as the original version from Panera Bread.
Title: Copycat Panera Broccoli Cheddar Soup
Author: Myo Quinn
Description:
Copycat Panera Broccoli Cheddar Soup Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 20 mins; Total Time: 25 mins; Servings: 6 servings
Ingredients: 4 tablespoons salted butter, divided, 1 small yellow onion, chopped (about 1/2 cup), 1/4 cup all-purpose flour, 3 cups water, 1 1/2 cups heavy cream, 2 tablespoons chicken stock base, such as Better than Bouillon, 2 cups finely chopped broccoli florets (from 1 small crown broccoli), 1/2 cup carrot matchsticks (from 1 small carrot or pre-cut), 6 ounces pre-shredded sharp cheddar cheese (about 1 1/2 cups), 2 ounces processed cheese, cubed, such as Velveeta, 2 teaspoons Dijon mustard, 2 teaspoons hot sauce, such as Tabasco, 1 teaspoon paprika, 1 teaspoon white pepper, 3/4 teaspoon kosher salt
Reviews: [{'name': 'Kim J', 'review': 'Loved the Flavor. Closest to the real Panera I've had so far with a few changes. Mine came out super thick so I had to add 2 more cups of water, even tho I measured everything precisely, to get to a good cream soup consistency. I used Better Than Boullion but keep in mind it's alot saltier than canned chicken stock. I omitted the Dijon mustard & hot sauce since I don't like either one in a soup but added fresh grated nutmeg to taste as this goes well in white cream based soups.'}, {'name': 'SF', 'review': 'Love this soup! Making today for the second time. I am however learning out all the salt. It seemed to get saltier after the first day.'}, {'name': 'Kary ', 'review': 'Delicious! Definitely will be my go to broccoli cheese soup recipe'}, {'name': 'psadie', 'review': 'I have made this and it is WONDERFUL. I would puree the soup before you add the cheese and cream.'}, {'name': 'Allie', 'review': 'OMG this soup tastes exactly like Panera’s broccoli cheddar soup. I live in Australia so only get to eat this once a year when I visit the US. \nI think this will become a regular dish for my family. So good!! Thank you 😊'}]

og:title: This Easy Creamy Soup Tastes Like Spinach Artichoke Dip
og:description: Conjure up the rich, melty Olive Garden dip in a soup form that you can make an entire meal out of.
Title: Spinach Artichoke Dip Soup
Author: Sara Bir
Description:
Spinach Artichoke Dip Soup Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 25 mins; Total Time: 30 mins; Servings: 6 servings; Yield: 7 1/2 cups
Ingredients: 1 (8-ounce) package cream cheese, at room temperature, 1 cup heavy cream, 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, 1 1/4 cups chopped yellow onion (from 1 medium onion), 2 teaspoons minced garlic (from 4 medium cloves), 1 teaspoon kosher salt, 1 (10-ounce) bag frozen spinach, thawed in a colander (Let moisture drip out as it thaws but no need to squeeze out excess.), 4 cups chicken broth, 2 (12-ounce) jars marinated quartered artichoke hearts, drained and coarsely chopped (about 2 1/2 cups), 3/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, plus more for serving, Freshly ground black pepper, for serving
Reviews: [{'name': 'SharonP', 'review': "I was excited when I saw this recipe, I love spinach artichoke dip. Followed the recipe exactly, and was disappointed in the result. It was OK, but definitely missing something, so I looked up the dip recipe, which included an Italian blend shredded cheese. Dumped the soup back in the pot and added 8oz of cheese, much better and the cheese didn't thicken the soup."}, {'name': 'Susanne', 'review': 'Made this soup last night for dinner and almost ate the entire soup pot myself! It was so delicious! I followed the recipe exactly! So creamy and so much flavor. This soup tastes like it simmered for hours but only simmered for about 30 minutes. My new favorite soup. I will be making this again soon.'}, {'name': 'Lisa C. Wolanski', 'review': 'Is there a vegan option for this recipe?'}]

og:title: The 30-Minute Tortellini Soup My Whole Family Loves
og:description: All it takes is 30 minutes to make this easy tortellini soup. My whole family loves it, including my picky kids. It’s an easy recipe to customize to your liking.
Title: The 30-Minute Tortellini Soup My Whole Family Loves
Author: Molly Adams
Description: The 30-Minute Tortellini Soup My Whole Family Loves
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 onion, diced, 3 large carrots, sliced, 3 celery stalks, sliced, 3 garlic cloves, minced, 1 teaspoon, Italian seasoning, 1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes, Kosher salt, to taste, Freshly ground black pepper, to taste, 8 cups chicken stock, 1 small (2-inch) Parmesan rind, waxed scraped (optional), 1 pound fresh or frozen cheese tortellini, (I like the Kirkland Signature 5 Cheese Tortelloni)

og:title: This Meatball Sub Soup Is Just as Cheesy and Saucy as the Sandwich
og:description: Use frozen meatballs and tons of melty cheese to recreate the classic meatball sub as a weeknight-friendly soup.
Title: Meatball Sub Soup
Author: Sara Bir
Description:
Meatball Sub Soup Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 35 mins; Total Time: 45 mins; Servings: 4 servings; Yield: 5 3/4 cups
Ingredients: 1 (14-ounce) bag store-bought Italian-style frozen meatballs, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 medium yellow onion, chopped (about 1 1/2 cups), 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1 teaspoon kosher salt, 2 tablespoons tomato paste, 2 (15-ounce) cans crushed tomatoes with basil and oregano, 2 1/2 cups beef broth, plus more as needed, 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, plus more for garnish, 8 slices French baguette, cut 3/4 to 1-inch-thick, 1 cup (4 ounces) shredded low-moisture mozzarella cheese

og:title: Spice up Your Weeknight Dinner Roster with Chipotle Chicken Chowder
og:description: This smoky one-pot chipotle chicken chowder can be made as mild or as spicy as you prefer and requires on 30 minutes of hands on cooking time.
Title: Chipotle Chicken Chowder
Author: Ross Yoder
Description:
Chipotle Chicken Chowder Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 50 mins; Total Time: 65 mins; Servings: 6
to 8 servings
Ingredients: 2 ears sweet corn or 2 cups frozen corn kernels, 8 (about 3 pounds) boneless skinless chicken thighs, 1 1/2 teaspoons chili powder, 1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt, divided, plus more to taste, 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more to taste, 1 tablespoon canola oil, plus more as needed, 2 poblano peppers, seeded and chopped, 1 medium yellow onion, diced, 4 chipotle peppers (from one 7-ounce can chipotles in adobo), 2 tablespoons adobo sauce (from one 7-ounce can chipotles in adobo), 2 quarts chicken stock, 3 russet potatoes, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch chunks, 1 (14.5-ounce) can petite diced tomatoes, 3/4 cup half and half, Sour cream, for serving (optional), Cilantro leaves or thinly sliced scallion, for serving (optional)
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Shawn', 'review': 'Absolutely delicious. Made this soup twice now and it never disappoints. Sour cream, shredded cheese and tortilla strips to top it make it a home run. Both times did 2 tbsp of chipotle and added garlic. Will make plenty more times'}, {'name': 'Andy', 'review': 'I started with this recipe as a guide with the following changes:
1. Used sweet potatoes instead of russets. The sweetness complements the heat of the chipotles.
2. Used a full 12 oz can of chipotles in adobo sauce. Hand chopped the peppers out of the can.
3. Used a 24 oz bag of frozen sweet corn.
4. Added 16 ounces of fresh mushrooms.
5. Only used one quart of chicken stock.
6. Used a full pint of half and half (next time I will use full cream).
7. Used four bell peppers instead of two poblanos. One each of red, yellow, orange, and green. Adds color and crunch.
8. Used two medium sweet yellow onions.
9. Used 3.75 pounds of chicken thighs (they came in 1.25 pound packages).
10. Eliminated the black pepper. Figured it was just as easy to add at the table if necessary.
Placed everything but the mushrooms and cream in a slow cooker after browning the chicken. Cooked that for 6 hours on low then added the mushrooms and cream.'}, {'name': 'fstylerep', 'review': 'Very thin but tasty. I’m planning on reducing the stock and then add the 1/2 & 1/2. I even used 2 cups less of liquid and still way too thin. I like a lot more body in my chowders. Not like sludge but a nappé consistency on the spoon back.'}, {'name': 'Anne', 'review': "This was absolutely delicious. I had to use a Pasilla pepper instead od poblano because that's what my grocery store had. I used two heaping tablespoons of the chipotle in adobo puree. I threw in a handfull of shredded cheddar at the end and that balanced the heat beautifully. A definite keeper."}, {'name': 'Lauren K', 'review': "I made this with my Father and it was pretty good. It didn't have as much body as I would've liked though, especially considering it's a chowder. Added some lime juice myself on top and it made it a bit slightly sweeter, which was pretty nice. And it isn't as spicy as people say, in my opinion anyone can handle the bite. Though the spice was taking over a bit of the rest of the flavor. 

Maybe more cream and just a bit less spice? Slices of Avocado is also very afterwards. Still a good recipe, hopefully I can build off of this. 🙂"}]

og:title: The Easy Lasagna Soup You’ll Want on Repeat
og:description: All the creamy, cheesy goodness of a white chicken lasagna, but ready in under an hour? This, my friends, is the power of lasagna soup.
Title: Creamy White Lasagna Soup
Author: Emma Christensen
Description:
Creamy White Lasagna Soup Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 40 mins; Total Time: 50 mins; Servings: 6
to 8 servings
Ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 yellow onion, diced, 2 teaspoons salt, divided, plus more to taste, 16 ounces cremini or button mushrooms, thinly sliced, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 1 quart unsalted chicken stock or broth, 2 cups water, 5 sprigs fresh thyme, or 3/4 teaspoon dried thyme, 1 bay leaf, 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts or thighs, 8 ounces dry lasagna noodles, 10 ounces baby spinach, 1 cup (4 ounces) freshly grated Parmesan cheese, 2 cups whole milk, Ricotta, to serve, Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
Reviews: [{'name': 'Cynthia Robinson ', 'review': 'Looking forward to making this. One slight modification for me...MiYoko's Vegan liquid MOZZARELLA that THICKENS the dish quite nicely!!! as a substitute for the dairy.'}, {'name': 'Munni P', 'review': 'Delicious and easy to make. The soup was creamy, but not heavy from the cooked lasagna, even when eating the leftover the following day. The vegetables, chicken, and the lasagna were tasty together and really absorbed the flavor from chicken broth base. Served this with ricotta and cracked pepper; my brother enjoyed it with some chili flakes!'}]

og:title: If You Love Spaghetti Squash, You Have To Make This Soup Right Now!
og:description: Rich and hearty. The spicy Italian sausage balances the sweetness of the roasted spaghetti squash.
Title: Spaghetti Squash Soup with Italian Sausage
Author: Lauren Paige Richeson
Description:
Spaghetti Squash Soup with Italian Sausage Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 70 mins; Total Time: 90 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 1 medium (about 3 pounds) spaghetti squash, halved lengthwise and seeded, 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided, 12 ounces spicy Italian sausage, casings removed, Sea salt, 1 medium yellow onion, diced, 4 medium garlic cloves, minced, 1 (28-ounce) can whole fire-roasted tomatoes, undrained, 2 tablespoons tomato paste, 4 cups chicken stock, store-bought or homemade, 1/4 teaspoon ground cumin, 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/4 teaspoon dried oregano, 1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper, 1/4 teaspoon ground white pepper, 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, plus more to taste, 2 cups Swiss chard, roughly chopped , 1 (15-ounce) can white beans, drained , Chopped sage, for garnish (optional)
Reviews: [{'name': 'Kathy', 'review': 'If I add the squash and keep it in the warmer will it turn to mush ❓❓ (I work in a restaurant and the soup is in a warmer for 6-8 hours$'}, {'name': 'Valerie', 'review': 'Delicious! Made it two weeks ago and loved it. Getting ready to make again. Will use a little more Italian sausage this time.'}, {'name': 'Maria ', 'review': 'I love making spaghetti squash . I use my own Italian marinara sauce with lots of cheese on top. Easy , and delicious.'}]

og:title: It's Always the Right Time for Classic New England Clam Chowder
og:description: If you’re craving clam chowder, try this classic New England clam chowder. It’s creamy, but not heavy, with delicate potatoes and just the right amount of briny clam flavor.
Title: Classic New England Clam Chowder
Author: Sally Vargas
Description:
Classic New England Clam Chowder Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 35 mins; Total Time: 45 mins; Servings: 6
to 8 servings
Ingredients: 4 ounces (3 to 4 slices) thick-cut bacon, cut into 1/4-inch pieces, 1 large yellow onion, diced, 2 stalks celery, diced, 2 (8-ounce) bottles clam juice, 1 cup water, 1/2 teaspoon salt, plus more to taste, 2 russet potatoes (about 1 pound) peeled and cut into 1/2-inch cubes , 1 pound (about 2 cups) frozen chopped clam meat, defrosted overnight in the refrigerator, 1 cup heavy cream, Freshly ground black pepper, to taste, Oyster crackers, for serving
Reviews: [{'name': 'Gene', 'review': 'If I made a little more than the recipe says, how can I thicken it a little'}, {'name': 'Kent', 'review': 'Great recipe!'}, {'name': 'Robert Lowery', 'review': 'I used six dozen little nick clams. Followed the recipe exactly. In a word fabulous.'}, {'name': 'Angela ', 'review': 'Recipe says 6-8 servings, what is the serving size?'}]

og:title: Sweet and Sour Cabbage Soup Is a Warm Hug in a Bowl
og:description: With lots of savory, sweet, and sour flavor, this easy-as-can-be sweet and sour cabbage soup will be your wintertime go-to. The vegetarian recipe freezes well, too.
Title: Sweet and Sour Cabbage Soup
Author: Micah Siva, RD
Description:
Sweet and Sour Cabbage Soup Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 35 mins; Total Time: 50 mins; Servings: 8 servings
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 medium yellow onion, chopped, 2 cloves garlic, chopped, 2 tablespoons tomato paste, 1 tablespoon sweet paprika, 1 medium head green cabbage (about 2 pounds), core removed and thinly sliced, 3 medium carrots, peeled and chopped into 1/2-inch pieces, 1 bay leaf, 8 cups low-sodium vegetable broth, 1 (28-ounce) can crushed tomatoes, 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar, 2 tablespoons brown sugar, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, Salt and pepper, to taste, 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Althea ', 'review': 'I have made it 4 times and it tastes better each time. I now am adding mushrooms.'}, {'name': 'Althea ', 'review': 'i love this recipe I have made it 4 times and it just gets better every time I make it;
Thans so much for this great recipe.
I now have started added mushrooms.'}, {'name': 'MiraeDeimel', 'review': 'This was wonderful. I followed it almost exactly. I did use 4 cups of chicken broth to sub out some veggie broth. I also ground up some beef to add protein to the soup. Was a favorite will make again!'}, {'name': 'Dan', 'review': 'A very good recipe. Simple, balanced…and easy to personalize…spicier, chunkier, sweeter, more sour…thanks for sharing.'}, {'name': 'bocaboy', 'review': 'I made it as written, and it was delicious. Adding the lemon juice and parsley at the end accentuated the sweet and sour taste. As noted in the intro to this recipe, it makes a LOT of soup, but putting it in the freezer ensures plenty for the next few months. We had this with a crusty ciabatta and cucumber salad.

This soup could also use the addition of some beef, Russian-style. A bit of leftover chuck roast or short ribs would be delicious.'}]

og:title: Crab and Corn Chowder Is Rich, Creamy Perfection
og:description: Crab adds sweetness to this rich and creamy New England-style chowder with corn, smoky bacon, potatoes, and cream.
Title: Crab and Corn Chowder
Author: Sally Vargas
Description:
Crab and Corn Chowder Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 25 mins; Total Time: 40 mins; Servings: 6
to 8 servings
Ingredients: 4 slices thick-cut bacon (4 ounces), cut into thin strips, 1 large leek, trimmed and halved lengthwise, cut into thin, half-moon slices, 2 stalks celery, finely diced, 1 teaspoon salt, plus more to taste, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, plus more to taste, 1/2 cup dry white wine, 2 russet potatoes (about 1 1/2 pounds), peeled and cut into 1/2-inch pieces, 4 cups low-sodium chicken stock, 3 cups corn kernels (about 3 ears of fresh corn) , 1 pound fresh or frozen crab meat, 3/4 cup heavy cream, or more to taste, Juice of 1/2 lemon (2 tablespoons, or more to taste), 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
Reviews: [{'name': 'Tim Thompson', 'review': 'Wow! This recipe is now my go-to recipe for Crab and Corn Chowder! I make it a couple times a year and this is the best I've ever tasted, it came out absolutely perfect and everyone flipped out over how flavorful it was. The leek really adds so much and the textures of all the ingredients made for an all around great chowder. I steamed some snow crab clusters and picked all the meat, I also used the broth from the steamer mixed with chicken base as the stock and I did not add any salt at all, it didn't need any. Thank you so much, this is going in my recipe book for sure!!!'}, {'name': 'Gabrielle Miller', 'review': 'What is another protein that would work well besides crab? I enjoy it with crab just have a hard time getting it sometimes.'}, {'name': 'Dan ', 'review': 'What if I used lobster base instead of chicken broth?'}, {'name': 'Bryan', 'review': 'I like all the fresh ingredients'}, {'name': 'Bob H', 'review': 'Do you discard the bacon grease ?'}]

og:title: The Classic Tuscan Soup I Make All Winter Long
og:description: Of all the beloved Italian soups, this hearty Tuscan ribollita is one you need to know. My flexible recipe keeps it simple and includes plenty of ideas for making it your own.
Title: Easy Tuscan Ribollita Soup
Author: Devan Grimsrud
Description:
Easy Tuscan Ribollita Soup Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 25 mins; Total Time: 35 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 3 tablespoons olive oil, plus more for serving, 1 medium yellow onion, diced, 1 medium carrot, peeled and diced, 2 ribs celery, diced, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more to taste, 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more to taste, 2 cloves garlic, peeled and thinly sliced, 1 bay leaf, 1 sprig fresh rosemary, thyme, oregano, or marjoram, 1 tablespoon tomato paste, 1 (14-ounce) can whole plum tomatoes, 4 1/4 cups vegetable broth, 2 (14-ounce) cans cannellini beans drained and rinsed, 5 to 6 ounces (150 grams) Tuscan kale, stemmed and roughly chopped, Freshly grated Parmesan cheese, for serving, 4 to 6 slices sourdough or country bread, 1 clove garlic, peeled
Reviews: [{'name': 'Munni P', 'review': "Absolutely delicious! The soup itself was hardy, but light and everything tasted amazing together. Loved the garlic bread in the soup as well. Added another dimension of texture and flavor! My sister doesn't care for soup, but she thoroughly enjoyed this one! \n\nFor those interested in meal prep - I made this for dinner and incorporated the rest of the soup as part of my weekly meal prep, and the vegetables held up so well! I usually refrain from making soup for meal prep b/c texture of the vegetables is important to me; this still tasted amazing and didn't become mush! Would recommend not adding the bread until you're ready to eat it."}]

og:title: The Hearty Southern Soup I Make All Winter Long
og:description: A hearty mix of beans, sausage, pasta, and greens make this flavorful swamp soup a complete dinner. I make this Southern recipe on repeat in the winter.
Title: Swamp Soup
Author: Laurel Randolph
Description:
Southern Swamp Soup Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 30 mins; Total Time: 45 mins; Servings: 5
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 2 bunches turnip greens (or other dark greens like kale or collard greens), 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 small yellow onion, diced, 3 ribs celery, diced, Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste, 2 garlic cloves, minced, 3/4 pound kielbasa or other smoked sausage, diced, 2 (15-ounce) cans white beans, drained and rinsed, 1 (15-ounce) can crushed or diced tomatoes, 6 cups chicken broth, 1 cup water, 1 cup small pasta, like ditalini or orzo, 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley leaves, optional
Reviews: [{'name': 'DawnLBS', 'review': 'I found it way too soupy. It needs much less broth or water. I also found it flavorless. I had to add a bunch of stuff to give it flavor.'}, {'name': 'SusieQ Gallagher', 'review': 'I haven't made this yet but definitely will as it reminds me of Minestrone soup! A favorite.'}, {'name': 'L MARCIANO', 'review': 'Laurel, Sounds just like Italian Escarole Soup! But interchanged. Escarole Soup, sausage sautéed for flavor, chicken broth, white beans, usually cannelloni &, Escarole, YUM!'}, {'name': 'Estoy Listo', 'review': 'This makes a thick bowl of soup. Swamp, indeed! But tasty, nourishing and easy to make. I followed the recipe pretty much, substituting a carrot for the celery. Eating it now I regret that I didn't think to add frozen okra. Next time!'}, {'name': 'Shereen Rasor', 'review': 'Great soup!💚'}]

og:title: Impress Your Guests With This Delectable Lobster Bisque Recipe
og:description: Need an impressive meal that doesn't require any fancy chef tricks? Try this decadent lobster bisque!
Title: Lobster Bisque
Author: Sally Vargas
Description:
Lobster Bisque Recipe
Prep Time: 40 mins; Cook Time: 90 mins; Total Time: 2 hrs 10 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 7 cups water, divided, 3/4 teaspoon salt, plus more to taste, 1 large (2-pound) or 2 small (1-pound) live lobsters (see Recipe Note), 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 medium yellow onion, sliced, 1 medium carrot, sliced, 1 stalk celery, sliced, 2 sprigs fresh thyme, 1 clove garlic, sliced, 2 tablespoons tomato paste, Pinch cayenne pepper or to taste, 1 dry bay leaf, 1 cup dry white wine, 2 1/2 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature, 6 tablespoons all-purpose flour, 1/3 cup cream sherry, 1 cup heavy cream, 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Oli', 'review': 'Could I replace the Lobster with Crab, for a crab bisque? Anything you’d tweak of making with crab??'}, {'name': 'Shawn', 'review': 'Thank you for this! I am starting from the bisque stage as I had saved seafood shells in the freezer and made broth a couple weeks ago. As I do not have meat, is there anything you would add/change - I suppose I am making the traditional silky style lobster bisque! Thank you for your article :)'}, {'name': 'Jan Thurnau', 'review': 'I have the shells and bodies of two lobsters in my freezer. They were 1-
1-1/4 lbs. each. Can I use those to make your lobster bisque? After breaking them apart, would I start by cooking them in oil in the large pot which would have been used t boil the lobsters. At the appropriate time, would I add 3 cups of clam juice and 3 cups of water and just follow the directions from that point?

 A friend of mine just made your crab bisque and his raving about it.'}]

og:title: We Love This Creamy White Bean Soup with Sage Gremolata; You Will, Too
og:description: This vegan soup is creamy and satisfying without one bit of dairy. Garnishing it with a bright, fresh Italian herb condiment makes it extra special.
Title: Creamy White Bean Soup with Sage Gremolata
Author: Sheela Prakash
Description:
Creamy White Bean Soup with Sage Gremolata Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 40 mins; Total Time: 60 mins; Servings: 6 servings
Ingredients: 3 tablespoons olive oil, 1 large yellow onion, chopped, 5 cloves garlic, roughly chopped, 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional), 2 cups low-sodium vegetables broth, plus more as needed , 3 (14-ounce) cans white beans, such as cannellini, including liquid (see recipe note), 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more to taste, 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more to taste, 3 tablespoons olive oil, 35 fresh sage leaves (from about 5 sprigs), 1/2 cup loosely packed finely chopped fresh parsley, 1 clove garlic, minced, Finely grated zest of 1 medium lemon (about 1 tablespoon), 1/8 teaspoon kosher salt
Reviews: [{'name': 'Sara B.', 'review': 'Such a big payoff for so little work! Frying the sage leaves was fun and not messy. The gremolata had tons of flavor. My daughter like the soup on its own. Will make again.'}]

og:title: I Make This Creamy Soup on Repeat With a Handful of Pantry Staples
og:description: Get your pita ready. The essential ingredients of hummus translate so well to soup that it’ll shock you! This easy soup recipe is substantial yet bright.
Title: Hummus Soup
Author: Sara Bir
Description:
Hummus Soup Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 40 mins; Total Time: 50 mins; Servings: 4 servings; Yield: 6 cups
Ingredients: 2 (15-ounce) cans chickpeas, drained and rinsed (3 heaping cups), divided , 8 medium garlic cloves, peeled, 3 tablespoons olive oil, divided, 1 3/4 teaspoons kosher salt, plus more to taste, 1 1/2 teaspoons ground cumin, divided, 1 large yellow onion, chopped (about 1 3/4 cups), 4 small carrots, peeled and coarsely chopped (about 1 1/2 cups), 4 cups vegetable broth, 1 cup water, plus more as needed, 1/3 cup tahini, 3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice (from 2 lemons), plus more to taste, 1/4 cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley
Reviews: [{'name': 'brushjl', 'review': "Heavenly, luxurious lingering aftertaste. One of the best soups I've ever made and I make a lot.of soups."}, {'name': 'Jasmine S', 'review': 'Delish! It taste like a creamy chickpea soup but the tahini gives it a hummus feel. The creaminess is coming from the pureed chickpeas. The tahini adds a mellow nutty flavor. The lemon juice brightens up this soup and adds a little tang. The roasted garlic is the perfect touch, adding a sweet garlicy flavor.'}]

og:title: Add This Shrimp and Chorizo Chowder to Your Must-Make List Immediately
og:description: Savory Spanish chorizo and plump shrimp meet smoked paprika for an easy chowder recipe with a broth so good, you’ll be licking the bowl.
Title: Shrimp and Chorizo Chowder
Author: Nick Evans
Description:
Shrimp and Chorizo Chowder Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 30 mins; Total Time: 40 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 4 ounces Spanish dry-cured chorizo, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1/2 yellow onion, diced, 1 carrot, peeled and diced, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 russet potato, peeled and diced, 2 teaspoons Spanish smoked paprika (regular paprika will work also), 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, 1 (15-ounce) can diced tomatoes, 4 cups chicken stock, 1 cup half and half, 1 cup frozen corn (no need to defrost), 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined, Fresh parsley, for garnish, Baguette toasts, for dipping
Reviews: [{'name': 'Ishbel Ogilvie', 'review': 'Just tried this recipe and it is so good. Have had great success with all of Nick’s recipes. Delicious and easy to prepare. Real winners!'}, {'name': 'Bill B.', 'review': 'How about Turkey Andoullie as a sub for the Chorizo ?'}, {'name': 'janmaus', 'review': 'Spanish chorizo is totally unavailable in my small town, so after trying this soup with both dry cured summer sausage and pepperoni, I have to say that the pepperoni,, closer in taste to what I remember of Spanish chorizo, worked better for us. With either sub, this soup was delicious! I really loved the inclusion of corn'}, {'name': 'Colleen Pergamalis', 'review': 'This was absolutely delicious! I used a soy chorizo and coconut cream instead of the half/half and it was sooooo good. Will be making this again! Thank you!'}, {'name': 'Mski2', 'review': 'This was the Bomb, I had a stick of Iberico chorizo left over from Christmas used fake cream kid lactose intolerant came out delicious !!'}]

og:title: Shi-won-hae-yo! Mul Naengmyeon: the Most Refreshing Korean Cold Noodle Soup You'll Want in the Summer Heat
og:description: Naengmyeon is a soup of cold noodles served in an icy broth (typically beef), mixed with radish water kimchi and topped with tasty garnishes. It is a cool and refreshing soup with a mild flavor, served mostly during the heat of summer.
Title: Mul Naengmyeon (Korean Cold Noodle Soup)
Author: Cynthia Christensen
Description:
Mul Naengmyeon (Korean Cold Noodle Soup) Recipe
Prep Time: 2 hrs; Cook Time: 75 mins; Total Time: 3 hrs 15 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 1 pound beef brisket, 8 cups water, 4 cloves garlic, smashed, 2 large green onions, cut in thirds, 1 (1-inch) piece of ginger, peeled, 1 1/2 tablespoons soy sauce, 2 large eggs, 1/2 large (1/2 pound) Korean radish, 1 tablespoon kosher salt, 1/2 cup rice wine vinegar, 1/2 cup water, 1/2 cup sugar, 3 tablespoons gochujang (Korean chili paste), 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 2 tablespoons toasted sesame oil, 2 tablespoons honey, 1 tablespoon rice vinegar, 1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 24 ounces Korean buckwheat noodles (such as Assi brand), Pickled radish, from the dongchimi, 2 sliced Persian cucumbers, 1 Asian pear, sliced, 2 green onions, julienned, Hard boiled eggs, Sliced brisket (optional), Dongchimi with brine
Reviews: [{'name': 'Munni P', 'review': "This naengmyeon recipe was everything you'd hope from naengmyeon. The subtle broth with a slight tang paired with the chewy buckwheat noodles and ALL those toppings resulted in an absolutely refreshing noodle soup! My favorite part was definitely the quick pickled radish. The sweet and sour flavor from the pickled radish was an amazing addition to the naengmyeon, and echoing the author's mother, definitely pairs better with the broth! She says the pickled radish is optional, but trust me, you don't want to not skip it!"}]

og:title: Fast and Easy Chicken Pot Pie Soup Satisfies Your Craving With No Baking Required
og:description: To scratch that itch when a chicken pot pie craving strikes, this easy soup recipe delivers. Use rotisserie chicken and seasoned oyster crackers for a quick, satisfying dinner.
Title: Chicken Pot Pie Soup
Author: Sara Bir
Description:
Chicken Pot Pie Soup Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 40 mins; Total Time: 50 mins; Servings: 6 servings; Yield: 9 1/2 cups
Ingredients: 3 tablespoons unsalted butter, 1 large yellow onion, chopped (about 2 cups), 2 small carrots, chopped (about 1 1/4 cups), 2 medium ribs celery, sliced (about 1 1/4 cups), 6 large garlic cloves, chopped (about 2 tablespoons), 1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt, 1 teaspoon dried thyme, 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour, 6 cups chicken broth, 2 cups shredded chicken (from 1 rotisserie chicken), 2 cups chopped red potatoes (about 4 potatoes)  , 2 cups frozen peas (from one 16-ounce bag), 1/2 cup half and half, 2 cups oyster crackers, 1/4 cup olive oil, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, 1 teaspoon dried thyme, 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional)
Reviews: [{'name': 'Jill', 'review': 'This was so delicious! Exactly what I was hoping it would taste like which never happens for me. Thank you!'}, {'name': 'MB', 'review': 'Delicious! Don't skip the crackers-in fact maybe double!! I added some smoked paprika to the mix which adds great color and flavor. I think the amount of olive oil could be decreased but they were so tasty, maybe not.'}, {'name': 'Jefferie ', 'review': 'I am absolutely hooked on this soup and have made it half a dozen times in the last six months. I have substituted some ingredients like omitting the potatoes and adding spatzle instead but the broth and flavor have been consistent delicious. Thank you for this great soup.'}, {'name': 'Chris C', 'review': "This was really yummy and easy to make. I just served it with some biscuits. If I were to change anything it would be to put in a bit less thyme but maybe that's because we're really sensitive to that spice."}, {'name': 'Dick ', 'review': 'Best soup I have ever had'}]

og:title: The 30 Essential Soup Recipes for Fall
og:description: We have 30 amazing fall soup recipes to deliver cozy warmth with all the fall vibes. Bean soups, chicken soups, chili, cream soups, and more are here ring in the sweater and boots weather.
Title: The 30 Essential Soup Recipes for Fall
Author: Sara Bir
Description: The 30 Essential Soup Recipes for Fall

og:title: Make This Korean Stew When You're Craving Comfort
og:description: Born of necessity after the Korean War, budae jjigae (also known as army base stew) is a delicious blend of Korean and American culture. Make it for your next family dinner.
Title: Budae Jjigae (Army Base Stew)
Author: Cynthia Christensen
Description:
Budae Jjigae (Army Base Stew) Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 35 mins; Servings: 6 servings; Yield: 12 cups
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons gochujang, 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 2 tablespoons mirin, 2 tablespoons gochugaru , 1 tablespoon fish sauce, 2 teaspoons granulated sugar, 2 ramen spice packets, 4 cloves garlic, grated, 1 cup rice cakes (sliced oval coins, fresh or frozen) , 2 green onions, 1 cup kimchi, 1/4 cup napa cabbage, 8 ounces enoki mushrooms, 1 (4.6-ounce) can Vienna sausages, drained, 1 (12-ounce) can Spam , 12 ounces firm tofu, drained, 1/2 cup canned pork and beans or baked beans, 6 cups chicken broth, 2 package instant ramen (preferably spicy), 1 to 2 slices american cheese, 3 cups steamed rice
Reviews: [{'name': 'Mario', 'review': 'Broth is awesome! Very easy to make and fun.'}, {'name': 'Munni P', 'review': "Budae jjigae is such a fun stew to make! It's so quick and very flavorful. A little bit spicy (from the gochujang and the Shin Ramyun soup base), a little bit sweet (from the cabbage and the mirin), a little bit sour (from the kimchi), and of course, savory from all the meats and beans. It has everything you'd expect from a good budae jjigae. Personally, I really enjoyed the amount of veggies in this version. Definitely a realiable budae jjigae recipe!"}, {'name': 'Nelson Parker', 'review': 'Gotta try this!'}]

og:title: The Clever Shortcut to the Best Ever Dumpling Soup
og:description: This cozy one-pot soup utilizes potato gnocchi as the “dumplings” for a clever shortcut. Creamy vegetable dumpling soup is easy, customizable, and comes together in just 30 minutes.
Title: Creamy Vegetable Dumpling Soup
Author: Julie & Amy Luxemberg
Description:
Creamy Vegetable Dumpling Soup Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 20 mins; Total Time: 30 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 small white onion, 3 stalks celery, 3 medium carrots, 3 cloves garlic, 3/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme, 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano, 6 cups reduced-sodium vegetable broth, 1 cup full-fat coconut milk, 16 ounces potato gnocchi, 1/2 lemon, juiced, 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped, Salt, to taste, Grated Parmesan cheese or nutritional yeast, Crushed red chili flakes

og:title: I Make This Southern Good Luck Soup Every New Year’s
og:description: Southerners have certain foods they like to eat on New Year’s to ensure good luck for the year to come: black-eyed peas, collard greens, and pork. All three go into this delicious, easy soup recipe.
Title: I Make This Southern Good Luck Soup Every New Year’s
Author: Laurel Randolph
Description: I Make This Southern Good Luck Soup Every New Year’s
Ingredients: 1 cup dried black-eyed peas, picked through, rinsed, and drained, 1 large bunch collard greens, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1/2 large yellow onion, diced, 1 small red bell pepper, diced, 2 garlic cloves, minced, 1/2 pound spicy sausage (2 to 3 links), 6 cups chicken broth, 1/2 small lemon, Salt and pepper, to taste

og:title: The 4-Ingredient Soup I Make When I’m Short on Time and Need Comfort
og:description: Inspired by Marcella Hazan’s famous white bean soup, this version is just as easy and takes just 4 ingredients and 20 minutes to make.
Title: The 4-Ingredient Soup I Make When I’m Short on Time and Need Comfort
Author: Alexandra Shytsman
Description: The 4-Ingredient Soup I Make When I’m Short on Time and Need Comfort
Ingredients: 4 medium garlic cloves, 3 (15-ounce) cans cannellini or great Northern beans, 1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil, 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 2 cups, vegetable broth, 1 (5-ounce) package baby spinach, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, optional, Kosher salt, to taste, Crusty bread, for serving, optional

og:title: The Secret to the Best Potato Soup
og:description: This one-pot easy potato soup recipe uses frozen hash browns, so there’s zero prep for you to do. Every diner can top their bowl with their favorite baked potato toppings for a quick and crowd-pleasing family dinner.
Title: The Secret to the Best Potato Soup
Author: Stephanie A Ganz
Description: Quick and Easy Potato Soup Recipe
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, 1 (30-ounce) bag frozen hash browns (shredded or cubed), 3 cups chicken broth, plus more as needed, 1 (10.5-ounce) can condensed cream of celery soup (or cream of fill-in-the-blank soup of your choice), 1 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, Optional toppings:, crispy bacon, , shredded cheese, sour cream, green onions

og:title: The 3-Step Mediterranean Soup I Make All the Time
og:description: This classic Portuguese soup is incredibly easy to make. Much of the flavor in caldo verde comes from smoked sausage, with potatoes and kale rounding out the recipe.
Title: Easy Caldo Verde (Portuguese Kale Soup)
Author: Sara Haas, RDN, LDN
Description:
Easy Caldo Verde (Portuguese Kale Soup) Recipe (6 Ingredients)
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 25 mins; Total Time: 35 mins; Servings: 6 servings
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, 8 ounces Spanish chorizo or other smoked sausage, cut into 1/4-inch slices, 1 medium yellow onion, chopped, 2 clove garlic, minced, 2 pounds russet potatoes, peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces, 4 cups low-sodium chicken broth, 2 cups water, 1 bunch lacinato (Tuscan) kale, stems removed and leaves thinly sliced, Salt, to taste
Reviews: [{'name': 'Paula Bernardes-Silva', 'review': 'Although I'm delighted to finally see a Portuguese recipe on your site, I'm also sorry to disappoint you: I don't know who gave you this recipe, but that is not caldo verde. 1. The "chouriço", "linguiça" or even "paio", if you want it more meaty (these are three types of Portuguese cured sausages, the third one is very large), onion and garlic are not sizzled in the olive oil. 2. The potatoes are completly smashed, not just partially. 3. It definitely is NOT made with chicken broth! 4. It takes a much larger quantity of "couve galega" (collards) ou "couve portuguesa", which is very similar. The real Portuguese recipe is made like this: In a large pot, you boil the potatoes and the onion (whole, not minced), then make them into a purée. Add salt to taste (pay atention, because the "chouriço" is normally a bit salty) and three or four large (again whole, not minced) garlic cloves and then boil the collards, which must be minced much thinner than you show. When they are almost cooked, add a generous (or not so generous, it's up to your taste) extra virgin olive oil portion; make sure the oil boils only for three or four minutes. Than take some bowls (smaller than ramen bowls; the grey one in the photo is the right size) add a slice or two of raw "chouriço" and pour the soup, very hot, on top of it. Accompany it with slices of "broa" (Portuguese corn bread). The only variation allowed is to boil the "chouriço" (yet again, whole, not sliced) with the potatoes and the onions, take it out before you make the purée, and slice it and add to the bowls, as previously said. If you want to see what it looks like, there are photos on Wikipedia (although it also has a mistake, saying we eat it on festivities like weddings and birthdays; not true: we eat it all year round). One thing you got absolutely right, though: it's absolutely delicious (and this tradicional version, much healthier)! Oh! And, although we know kale, it's something very recent in our country, and we surely don't know mustard greens! That being said, I'm all for creativity in the kitchen. Enjoy!\nP.S. - Sorry for the large comment.'}, {'name': 'Laurel R', 'review': 'Easy and delicious! I used smoked andouille which was tasty, would love to try Spanish chorizo next time. I added a squeeze of lemon at the end and it really brightened up the soup.'}]

og:title: The Creamy Italian-Inspired Soup You’ll Make on Repeat This Winter
og:description: Olive Garden's Chicken & Gnocchi Soup is a fan favorite for good reason. Here's a homemade version you can make in under 30 minutes and for a fraction of the cost.
Title: Copycat Olive Garden Chicken & Gnocchi Soup
Author: Myo Quinn
Description:
Copycat Olive Garden Chicken & Gnocchi Soup Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 25 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 4 tablespoons unsalted butter, divided, 1 small rib celery, sliced 1/4-inch thick (1/3 cup), 1 small yellow onion, chopped (1/2 cup), 1/2 cup matchstick carrots (from a 10-ounce package), 3 small cloves garlic, finely chopped (2 teaspoons), 1/4 cup all-purpose flour, 2 1/2 cups chicken broth, 2 cups half-and-half, 1 cup finely chopped cooked chicken, 2 teaspoons granulated sugar, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, 1 (12-ounce) package refrigerated gnocchi (such as Rana), 1 1/2 cups roughly chopped baby spinach (about 2 ounces), 1/2 teaspoon dried Italian seasoning, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, Pinch ground nutmeg
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Cynthia Gracie', 'review': 'We recently discovered Olive Gardens gnocchi soup and couldn't stop thinking about how good it was. This recipe I baked 3 breasts (used about 2.5), used a mirepoix to save time, and made the broth with better than boullion mix. This was almost as good as the restaurant! Just a slight taste variation. Definitely a keeper and on semi regular rotation 😁
Watch your gnocchi measurements I added a few too many and made more of a chowder than soup (I personally LOVED it but my husband want a thinner mix) 
Make sure you have your heat turned to LOW when you add the gnocchi and spinach cook for about 5 minutes, take it off the heat and let it set for about 10 minutes.'}, {'name': 'Cory ', 'review': 'I love how this soup turned out. It’s super good and it does taste like the Olive Gardens soup. The nutmeg is the game changer I think. I did add more than a pinch and once it heated up, it smelled exactly like the Olive gardens soup. It gives it that sweet bite. I also used very course cracked black pepper, which definitely added to the flavor as well. 

The only thing that I want to change the next time I make it is to cook the gnocchi separately. I overcooked it to the point that it’s too mushy. I was hoping that it would be more of a solid texture. I’ve never cooked gnocchi before, so I’m not familiar with how long to cook it and so forth. It took too long for me to add the spices and that’s what made it mushy. I also cut the gnocchi in half, which probably made them cook even faster than usual too.'}, {'name': 'Petunia', 'review': 'Next time, I'm going to cut the sugar either in half or or all together. It was way too sweet using the full amount. That said, once I found the right balance of savory to sweet, this was way better than Olive Garden's.'}, {'name': 'Eli', 'review': 'First soup I've made and it came out very well. Thank you 😊'}, {'name': 'Terrell Young', 'review': 'My daughter-in-law is vegetarian. Any idea how it would taste without chicken and using veggie broth instead?'}]

og:title: This Easy Tuscan Soup Tastes Better Than the Olive Garden Classic
og:description: This Tuscan soup recipe has it all—hearty ingredients like potatoes, white beans, and sausage and a creamy, savory broth. Known as Zuppa Toscana, it’s an Olive Garden classic but easy to make at home.
Title: This Easy Tuscan Soup Tastes Better Than the Olive Garden Classic
Author: Nick Evans
Description:
Zuppa Toscana Recipe (3 Steps)
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 35 mins; Total Time: 50 mins; Servings: 6
to 8 servings
Ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 pound raw spicy Italian sausage, casings removed if using links, 1 medium white onion, chopped, 2 stalks celery, chopped, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour, 8 cups (2 quarts) chicken broth, 1 pound new potatoes, diced, 1 (15-ounce) can cannellini or other white beans, rinsed and drained, 1 cup heavy cream or half-and-half, 5 cups stemmed and chopped kale (about 5 ounces), Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
Reviews: [{'name': 'Lynne', 'review': 'Is this recipe suitable for freezing please'}, {'name': 'Lisa', 'review': 'I use fat free or Regular evaporated milk in a can.\nIt's better than cream or half and half.\nMy sister in law Lee tuned me onto this calorie cutting tip.'}, {'name': 'janmaus', 'review': 'Nice clone--DH loves all of the OG soups, but the ones served at the restaurant are way too high in salt for me, so high, that salt is about all I can taste when I've tried to eat any. I appreciate having a recipe where the sodium can be adjusted down. I tried it immediately, using low sodium chicken broth, half&half, and no additional salt--the Italian sausage, which I slightly reduced to about 12 oz, is plenty salty by itself.'}, {'name': 'Cynthia McHugh', 'review': 'This sounds great! My husband does not eat sausage anymore, how about ground turkey with additional spices to make it Italian?'}, {'name': 'Carol', 'review': 'Wonderful soup. Didn't have kale on hand, but we had carrots, and they worked just fine. Simply boiled the carrots until "al dente" and added them in, they added nice color! We will make this soup again.'}]

og:title: The Simple Tuscan Soup I’m Making All Winter Long
og:description: Acquacotta is an age-old traditional Tuscan recipe that transforms stale bread and simple pantry ingredients into a warm, cozy soup. A poached egg in each bowl makes it an even heartier wintertime meal.
Title: The Simple Tuscan Soup I’m Making All Winter Long
Author: Karishma Pradhan
Description:
Acquacotta (Tuscan Soup) Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 60 mins; Total Time: 75 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling, 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes, 1 large or 2 small yellow onions, thinly sliced, 1 large celery stalk, finely diced, 1 clove garlic, minced, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more for seasoning, 1 (28-ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes, 4 cups chicken or vegetable broth, 2 cups water, 4 large eggs, 4 slices stale Tuscan bread or crusty sourdough, torn into 1-inch cubes, 1/4 cup freshly grated Pecorino romano cheese
Reviews: [{'name': 'Frank T', 'review': 'I really enjoyed the umami-packed flavors of the acquacotta. The tomato flavors are really pronounced and I can taste the lingering sweetness from the onion. The eggs are gently poached and the creaminess of the egg yolk helps balance the broth's sharp acidity. I love how the broth overall is indeed soupy, which has enough liquid volume to soak and imbue the torned sourdough pieces with flavor and color (while still being a soup).'}]

og:title: The Hungarian Goulash I Crave All Winter Long
og:description: Hungarian Goulash features tender beef and hearty vegetables swimming in a rich broth that’s scented with sweet paprika and caraway. It’s a warming soup recipe perfect for cold winter days!
Title: The Hungarian Goulash I Crave All Winter Long
Author: Mark Beahm
Description:
Hungarian Goulash Recipe (4 Steps)
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 90 mins; Total Time: 110 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 3 tablespoons neutral oil, like canola, 1 large yellow onion, diced, 1 1/2 pounds boneless beef chuck roast, cut into 1-inch chunks, 2 teaspoons kosher salt, divided, plus more to taste, 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, divided, 1/4 cup Hungarian sweet paprika, 4 cloves garlic, minced, 1 teaspoon caraway seeds, 4 cups low-sodium chicken stock or beef stock, 2 medium carrots, peeled and diced, 1 medium tomato, roughly chopped, 1 medium red bell pepper, stemmed, seeded, and diced, 1 bay leaf, 2 medium Yukon gold potatoes, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch cubes, 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley leaves, optional, Crusty bread, for serving, optional
Reviews: [{'name': 'Christine', 'review': 'This is the closest to what I grew up with in Hungarian kitchen.. Not the heavy stews, but the brothiness - Oma didn't always have meat, but would substitute with Hungarian sausage. A very comforting dish.'}, {'name': 'Jan', 'review': 'I made this last night. The flavors are really good. I didn't change anything. Would definitely make again. It is more soupy than I was hoping for. My idea of Goulash is a thick stew. Still a great recipe!'}, {'name': 'Gudrun A Llamas', 'review': 'I like the idea to substitute the meat with mushrooms!'}, {'name': 'Tibor Wagner', 'review': 'If you use lard in place of the oil, it is more tasteful. I also put specials made with one egg and 2 Tbs of all purpose flour mix with little water and put into the soup with a small teaspoon and cook 10-15 minutes more.'}, {'name': 'Niecy', 'review': 'Would GranAroma Sweet Hungarian Paprika work?'}]

og:title: The Easy Italian Soup I’m Making All Winter Long
og:description: This quick and easy version of Italian wedding soup achieves the perfect marriage between weeknight simplicity and depth of flavor. The recipe makes the most of ground Italian sausage to streamline the cooking process while still offering lots of oomph.
Title: The Easy Italian Soup I’m Making All Winter Long
Author: Stephanie A Ganz
Description: Easy Italian Wedding Soup Recipe
Ingredients: For this simplified version, I’m just using onions and garlic, but celery and carrots are common in other versions of Italian wedding soup. To make prep even easier, use store-bought mirepoix., It’s easiest to roll the sausage balls when the sausage is cold. Use sausage straight from the fridge and wet your hands before rolling., For more depth of flavor, use 1 cup of white wine to deglaze the pan after sautéing the onions and garlic., Make sure the sausage balls are small (about an inch in diameter) so they cook quickly.

og:title: The Easiest, Creamiest Broccoli Cheddar Soup Is Ready in 30 Minutes Flat
og:description: Broccoli cheddar soup is a classic that is really easy and satisfying to make at home. Our recipe uses potatoes to thicken (no cream!), has plenty of great broccoli texture, and deep cheddar flavor.
Title: The Easiest, Creamiest Broccoli Cheddar Soup Is Ready in 30 Minutes Flat
Author: Devan Grimsrud
Description:
Easy Broccoli Cheddar Soup Recipe (30 Minutes)
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 20 mins; Total Time: 30 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings; Yield: 6 cups
Ingredients: 1 large head broccoli (1/2 pound), 4 tablespoons unsalted butter, 1 medium white or yellow onion, roughly chopped (about 1 cup), 1 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more to taste, 1 small to medium russet potato, peeled and roughly chopped (9 ounces or about 1 1/2 cups), 2 cups vegetable broth, 2 cups whole milk, 2 cups freshly grated sharp cheddar cheese (8 ounces), 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground ground black pepper, plus more to taste, Bread or toast for dipping, optional
Reviews: [{'name': 'N', 'review': 'Amazing recipe! Absolutely loved it and was easy to follow. Recommend cutting the potatoes & broccoli florets, stems into small pieces so they cook faster if time is an issue for you. Thanks for sharing!'}, {'name': 'Tiga', 'review': 'This took over an hour and a half to make. The prep time they say it will take is totally unrealistic. It came out okay, but not the way I really wanted it to, and even if it had been amazing it wouldn’t have been worth the time that went into it. I think the recipe’s that use flour instead of potato are probably closer to the restaurant recipe’s. I was disappointed. We will not bother with this recipe again.'}, {'name': 'C. E. A.', 'review': 'Second time I've made this recipe in a month! Perfect cold weather soup. Thank you!'}, {'name': 'Laurel R', 'review': 'Exactly what you want from a broccoli cheddar soup!'}, {'name': 'Lea', 'review': 'Did exactly what it called for. Perfect!'}]

og:title: This “Marry Me Chicken Soup” Is So Good I’d Marry It
og:description: Marry Me Chicken took the internet by storm a few years ago and is still going strong. This recipe reimagines the creamy chicken dish as a velvety, hearty soup that’s super quick and easy to make.
Title: This “Marry Me Chicken Soup” Is So Good I’d Marry It
Author: Afton Cyrus
Description:
Marry Me Chicken Soup Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 30 mins; Total Time: 45 mins; Servings: 6 servings
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons oil from a jar of oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, 6 cloves garlic, minced, 3/4 cup drained and chopped sun-dried tomatoes with herbs, 3 tablespoons tomato paste, 8 cups low-sodium chicken broth, 8 ounces small pasta shells (about 2 cups), 1 (5-ounce) package baby spinach, coarsely chopped, 2 cups shredded cooked chicken (about 8 ounces), 1 (8-ounce) package cream cheese, cubed and softened, 1/2 cup finely shredded Parmesan cheese, plus more for garnish, 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil, plus more for garnish, optional, Kosher salt, if needed, to taste
Reviews: [{'name': 'CardKaye', 'review': 'I wasn’t ready to “marry” anyone over this soup but it was very hearty and satisfying. This was a very salty recipe even though I omitted the kosher salt and used reduced sodium broth.'}, {'name': 'adorablediva', 'review': 'Is there any way at all to cut the salt content/sodium all the down? It is so high,however, the recipe seems very healthy and delicious ingredients to boot!'}, {'name': 'Jeff', 'review': 'The saltiness is overwhelming.'}, {'name': 'Amanda H', 'review': 'This soup is packed full of all the marry me flavors, but isn’t overwhelming. I think this is by far my favorite way to eat this dish, the soup wasn’t overly creamy or thick, it was warming and delicious!'}]

og:title: The Secret To Making a Bunch of Grilled Cheese All at Once
og:description: Instead of standing over a hot pan and patiently flipping grilled cheese after grilled cheese, make five toasty, gooey grilled cheese sandwiches at one time on a sheet pan!
Title: The Secret To Making a Bunch of Grilled Cheese All at Once
Author: Nicole McLaughlin
Description:
Sheet Pan Grilled Cheese Sandwiches Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 20 mins; Servings: 5 servings; Yield: 5 grilled cheese sandwiches
Ingredients: 6 tablespoons (3 ounces) unsalted butter, 2 tablespoons herbed goat cheese, 10 thick white bread slices, 5 sharp white cheddar cheese slices, 5 provolone cheese slices, 5 Swiss cheese slices

og:title: The 30-Minute Dinner I Make on Repeat All Winter Long
og:description: My go-to recipe from Colu Henry's "Colu Cooks: Easy Fancy Food " is this easy pasta e ceci, a quintessential winter soup that can be made in under 30 minutes.
Title: The 30-Minute Dinner I Make on Repeat All Winter Long
Author: Molly Adams
Description: Colu Henry's Pasta e Ceci Recipe
Ingredients: 2 tablespoons olive oil, plus more for drizzling (optional), 4 ounces (115g) pancetta, finely diced, 1 medium yellow onion, finely chopped, 3 cloves garlic, finely chopped, 2 teaspoons chopped fresh rosemary, 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes, Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, 1 cup (165g) diced canned tomatoes with their juices, 1 (15-ounce) can chickpeas, drained and rinsed, 3 to 4 cups chicken stock, 1 cup (120g) ditalini, 5 cups (210g) roughly chopped escarole, dandelion greens, or something else green and wiltable, Freshly grated pecorino cheese, for serving

og:title: If You Can't Get To New Jersey for a Classic Italian Hot Dog , Make Your Own
og:description: A hot dog topped with fried potatoes, peppers and onions, served with deli mustard on a sandwich bun-Jersey style
Title: New Jersey Italian Hot Dog
Author: Hank Shaw
Description:
New Jersey Italian Hot Dog Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 35 mins; Total Time: 45 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil, Salt, 2 pounds potatoes, peeled and cut into 1/2 inch chunks, 2 medium green peppers, sliced into strips, 1 large yellow or white onion, sliced into strips, 1 teaspoon Italian seasoning, or a mixture of oregano, basil and rosemary, 8 beef hot dogs, preferably with natural casings, 4 sandwich buns, Mustard
Reviews: [{'name': 'Linda Mills', 'review': 'I grew up in Springfield, NJ and remember eating that same sub about 65 years ago … I’ve never seen it outside of NJ. Thanks for the memory.'}, {'name': 'Jon', 'review': 'Wow! I worked as a manager in the Fanwood A&P and I remember that store. All the kids hung out there. Great place from a time gone by. I am sure you remember Irma’s Bag? Any way this is a great Italian hot dog recipe and if you can find pizza bread, it would be 100% a NJ Italian hot dog worthy of the Corner Store or even Jimmy Buff’s another Italian HD icon.'}, {'name': 'Alan H', 'review': 'If you're from New Jersey you should try Windmill Hotdogs. They're Quarter pound hotdogs that work really well Italian style. Based in Long branch they have a few other store locations. My Shop Rite in Burlington got them in on a request by me. Trust me they're a little pricey but worth every penny.'}, {'name': 'Bobby B900', 'review': 'I grew up in Jersey as well. Dickey Dees in Newark was fantastic n Keansburg boardwalk also had great Italian dogs. Great recipe btw 👍'}, {'name': 'Johnny Malangone', 'review': "I grew up with these in NJ in union county. Somewhere on route 22 I think. I've been living in Hudson County for 15 years and no one makes these. I can't even find one in NYC."}]

og:title: The Easy Appetizer I Make Every Game Day
og:description: Bratwurst sausages are a classic choice for game day parties or tailgating, but they need a fair amount of attention and time to cook properly. This recipe for bratwurst sliders makes feeding a crowd much easier (and way cuter, too!).
Title: The Easy Appetizer I Make Every Game Day
Author: Ivy Manning
Description:
Bratwurst Sliders Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 40 mins; Total Time: 60 mins; Servings: 6
to 8 servings; Yield: 18 sliders
Ingredients: 1/2 bottle lager or pilsner beer (or NA beer if avoiding alcohol), optional, 2 thin slices yellow onion, optional, 2 (19-ounce) packages fresh bratwurst, Freshly ground black pepper, to taste, 18 King’s Hawaiian sweet slider buns or pretzel slider buns, 1 cup whole grain mustard, 2 tablespoons canola oil, divided, 1 heaping cup well-drained sauerkraut
Reviews: [{'name': 'MADONNA CHERRY', 'review': 'They are so good everyone love.'}, {'name': 'Munni P', 'review': 'This tasted exactly as you'd expect - a sweet Hawaiian bun paired with bratwurst, spicy whole mustard, and sour sauerkraut. Truly can't go wrong with that flavor combination, and it was super easy to make! I ended up soaking half of the patties in the beer mixture, and both the soaked and unsoaked brats tasted delicious. Can't go wrong with this recipe.'}]

og:title: Bring Out the Mini Muffin Pans for These Kid-Friendly Broccoli Cheddar Egg Bites
og:description: These quiche-like broccoli, cheese and egg snacks baked in mini-muffin pans are great for brunch, parties, or kid-friendly lunches.
Title: Broccoli Cheddar Egg Bites
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Broccoli Cheddar Egg Bites Recipe
Prep Time: 30 mins; Cook Time: 25 mins; Total Time: 55 mins; Servings: 24 servings
Ingredients: Florets from 1 large bunch broccoli (about 300g broccoli florets), 2 large eggs, lightly beaten, 1/2 cup crustless, torn (into tiny pieces) fresh bread, packed, 1/4 cup grated onion, 1/4 cup mayonnaise, 1 cup (4 ounces, 114g), packed, grated sharp cheddar cheese, 1/2 teaspoon lemon zest, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
Reviews: [{'name': 'JayTL ', 'review': 'Made a batch for a brunch kiddo breakfast celebration. They received rave reviews (guests loved the lemon in them!) and will plan to make again. Has anyone tried freezing these for make ahead options?'}, {'name': 'Amelia ', 'review': 'This looks so yummy! Can I use almond flour instead of bread in the recipe? Thanks'}, {'name': 'Bonnie', 'review': 'Can I sub spinach for the broccoli? .\n Bonnie'}, {'name': 'Charli Goodhew', 'review': "Skipped the lemon zest, didn't feel like it needed it and they're so delicious. Pefect for a grab and go snack. I don't have much of a sweet tooth and struggle to find something exciting to just grab from the fridge, but these are perfect. Thanks for the recipe, I will now be making weekly!"}, {'name': 'Mike Herr', 'review': 'I agree with the few others that mentioned there was too much lemon zest. Just made these and while they came out nicely and look great, the lemon zest was too overpowering compared to the other flavors! I want to be able to taste the broccoli and cheese since these are broccoli cheddar bites :)'}]

og:title: Store-Bought Puff Pasty Is the Secret to This Easy Asparagus Tart
og:description: This easy asparagus tart with goat cheese comes together quickly thank to store-bought puff pastry. It's perfect for weekend brunch or a light weeknight dinner.
Title: Easy Asparagus Tart with Goat Cheese
Author: Sarah Wharton
Description:
Easy Asparagus Tart with Goat Cheese Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 35 mins; Total Time: 55 mins; Servings: 6 servings
Ingredients: 2 sheets frozen puff pastry, 2 eggs, at room temperature, 8 ounces herbed goat cheese, at room temperature, 1 ounce (about 3/4 cup grated) Pecorino Romano cheese, 1 pound asparagus, trimmed and peeled as needed, 1 teaspoon vegetable oil, 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, Zest of 1 lemon
Reviews: [{'name': 'Helen', 'review': 'I like to cut my asparagus into bite size pieces. It makes it easier to eat.'}, {'name': 'Saila Salo', 'review': 'Add some cured or smoked salmon or shrimps and you are ready for a party! Make experiments with other cheeses as well, this is an excellent basic recepy.'}, {'name': 'Yeddard', 'review': "I make this with Brie and it's fantastic!"}]

og:title: Make Gaby Dalkin’s Fried Polenta Panzanella Recipe At Your Next Party
og:description: This Tuscan inspired chopped salad uses fried polenta in place of stale bread. It’s magnificent—you’ll want to make it all summer long.
Title: Fried Polenta Panzanella with Tomato, Basil, and Burrata
Author: Gaby Dalkin
Description:
Fried Polenta Panzanella with Tomato, Basil, and Burrata Recipe
Prep Time: 50 mins; Cook Time: 18 mins; Total Time: 68 mins; Servings: 6
to 8 servings
Ingredients: 4 pounds mixed heirloom tomatoes (make sure they are very ripe!), cored and cut into 1-inch wedges  , 1 tablespoon kosher salt, plus more to taste, 2 pounds store-bought prepared polenta, 1 shallot, minced, 1/2 cup plus 6 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided , 2 garlic cloves, minced , 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard, 3 tablespoons balsamic vinegar, Freshly ground black pepper, 1 bunch basil leaves, divided (half of the basil leaves should be torn and half left whole)  , 8 ounces burrata, torn into pieces, Flaky salt, to taste
Reviews: [{'name': 'sandy basilio', 'review': 'looks tasty😋'}]

og:title: How to Make Chewy, Sweet and Spicy Korean Tteokbokki at Home
og:description: Tteokbokki, spicy Korean rice cakes, are a popular Korean street food that comes together in 30 minutes. The rice cakes are soft and chewy, and coated with a sweet and spicy gochujang sauce.
Title: Tteokbokki (Spicy Korean Rice Cakes)
Author: Myo Quinn
Description:
Tteokbokki (Spicy Korean Rice Cakes) Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 25 mins; Total Time: 30 mins; Servings: 2
to 4 servings
Ingredients: 2 large eggs, 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, 1 small yellow onion, cut into 1/2-inch halfmoons, 3 green cabbage leaves, cut into 2-inch squares, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 1/2 cups water, 1 pound (about 3 cups) garaetteok (cylindrical Korean rice cakes), 2 scallions, ends trimmed and cut into 2-inch pieces, 3 tablespoons gochujang, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, plus more to taste, 2 teaspoons sugar, plus more to taste, 1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil, 1 teaspoon toasted sesame seeds
Reviews: [{'name': 'Lynn', 'review': 'Thank you for sharing your story and your recipe Myo. I really enjoyed reading about your recipe. I love Korean food, but do not make it much myself. This recipe intrigues me enough to try making it.. I appreciate all the details of the process of making this dish, and the "Why\'s" of how you do each step. Now off to find these ingredients :)'}]

og:title: Make Perfect Tamagoyaki at Home!
og:description: Tamagoyaki is a soft and delicate rolled omelet and a classic Japanese dish. The technique to flip and roll the eggs may look tricky, but if I can do it, you can too!
Title: Tamagoyaki
Author: Irvin Lin
Description:
Tamagoyaki Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 20 mins; Servings: 4 servings; Yield: 2 rolls
Ingredients: 1/4 cup warm water, 1/4 teaspoon instant dashi powder, like Ajinomoto Hondashi, 4 large eggs, 2 teaspoons sugar, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, 1 teaspoon soy sauce, 1 teaspoon mirin, 1 tablespoon canola oil, Grated daikon, for serving (optional)
Reviews: [{'name': 'eureka', 'review': 'thanks! eggs came out slightly sweet and delicious. I was able to roll it just fine in a round non-stick pan :)'}]

og:title: Give Tomato Bruschetta a Break and Make This One With Fresh Corn and Ricotta
og:description: This thick toast piled high with fluffy ricotta and sweet corn is the perfect low-effort, high-reward summer meal or appetizer.
Title: Corn and Ricotta Bruschetta
Author: Georgia Freedman
Description:
Corn and Ricotta Bruschetta Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 15 mins; Misc: 5 mins; Total Time: 25 mins; Servings: 4 servings; Yield: 8 pieces of bruschetta
Ingredients: 2 ears fresh sweet corn, shucked, 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, divided, 1/2 red onion, small dice, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 8 mint leaves, very thinly sliced, 8 thick slices whole-grain batard or boule bread (cut about 4 inches wide, 5 inches long, and 1 inch thick), 16 ounces ricotta cheese, 4 mint leaves, very thinly sliced

og:title: Bite-Sized Baked Weeknight Kuku Sabzi (Persian Herb Frittata)
og:description: These kuku sabzi are festive and vibrant baked eggs filled to the brim with fresh herbs. Barberries add a pop of brightness. It’ll delight your tastebuds!
Title: Kuku Sabzi (Persian Herb Frittata)
Author: Mersedeh Prewer
Description:
Kuku Sabzi (Persian Herb Frittata) Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 20 mins; Total Time: 40 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings; Yield: 12 kuku
Ingredients: 3 tablespoons olive oill, divided, 3 1/2 ounces fresh flat leaf parsley (about 1 bunch), 3 1/2 ounces fresh cilantro (about 1 bunch), 3 1/2 ounces fresh dill (about 1 bunch), 5 scallions, dark green part only, 1 1/2 ounces baby spinach (a generous handful), 2 cloves garlic, 6 large eggs, 1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric, Zest of 1 lime (about 1/2 packed teaspoon), 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/4 teaspoon freshily ground black pepper, 2 tablespoons dried barberries, 1 tablespoon chopped raw walnuts, plus more for garnish
Reviews: [{'name': 'Jelena', 'review': 'Thanks for an interesting recipe. Are there any alternatives to barberrries? Thanks in advance!'}]

og:title: The One Magically Packed Lunch My Kids Will Always Eat
og:description: You’ll want these tasty sesame soba noodles in your lunchbox. The best part is that this soba noodle recipe takes less than 15 minutes to make.
Title: Sesame Soba Noodles
Author: Myo Quinn
Description:
Sesame Soba Noodles Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 4 mins; Total Time: 14 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 9 ounces dry soba noodles (see Recipe Note), 1/4 cup toasted sesame oil, 3 tablespoons soy sauce, 2 tablespoons maple syrup or sugar, 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice or rice vinegar, 2 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds (black or white), 2 green onions, roots trimmed and finely chopped, 1 clove garlic, grated with a Microplane, 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, Thinly sliced radishes, Chopped cilantro, Any type of micro greens
Reviews: [{'name': 'rob', 'review': 'I love these noodles and buy them when we go out but we don't do that much since covid. \n\nGot Soba at a local, large market. I ate it the day I made it and I think that caused it to be a bit bitter. It was far better the next day. I also added 1+T of creamy peanut butter with just peanuts and salt (so no Jiff or Skippy). I cut the scallions and the wet mixture is in a jar to be added later. Will make it in a day after the mix is nice and chilled. I was afraid my weight would shoot up but I'm okay :) .'}, {'name': 'Annie R', 'review': 'I’ve made these noodles half a dozen times at least. They never let me down! Especially good in the summer. I use just 3 T of the sesame oil.'}, {'name': 'LD', 'review': 'Excellent recipe. I made it per the recipe instructions. This is perfect for weekday after work or easy weekend days. I highly recommend the soba noodles.'}]

og:title: Buttery-Soft Pepperoni Rolls Will Be Your New Favorite Snack
og:description: Originally from West Virginia and beloved all along the Ohio River Valley, buttery-soft pepperoni rolls are stuffed with plenty of pepperoni and are irresistible at parties and potlucks. This easy scratch pepperoni roll recipe may just become your new favorite snack or lunch fix.
Title: Pepperoni Rolls
Author: Sara Bir
Description:
West Virginia Pepperoni Rolls Recipe (From Scratch!)
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 40 mins; Rise Time: 2 hrs 40 mins; Total Time: 3 hrs 40 mins; Servings: 12 servings; Yield: 12 rolls
Ingredients: 1/4 cup warm water, 1 (.25-ounce) package (2 1/4 teaspoons) active dry yeast, 3 1/2 cups (451g) all-purpose flour, divided, plus more if needed, 1 teaspoon salt, 8 tablespoons (113g) unsalted butter, divided, 2 tablespoons honey, 3/4 cup buttermilk, 1 large egg, 8 to 9 ounces (about 144 slices) thinly sliced pepperoni
Reviews: [{'name': 'Linda', 'review': 'Very good'}, {'name': 'Paul', 'review': 'Can you use can brisket rolls ?'}, {'name': 'Mo', 'review': 'I was skeptical of this recipe due to the buttermilk. it seemed overly fussy. The dough was extremely soft and I thought this was going to be a problem. However, these are the best pepperoni rolls I’ve baked in my life. As a West Virginian, these are part of our daily culture and I want to give kudos to the author. This is my new pepperoni roll recipe and my friends think I am a magical genius.'}, {'name': 'Katie Fultz', 'review': 'I'm making these this week for sure!'}, {'name': 'twilkinson', 'review': "In all the years I've been cooking, I've yet to successfully make anything that required yeast and I don't have one of those mixers with a dough hook! I'm wondering if these rolls could be made using puff pastry???? Please advise and thank you ..."}]

og:title: Going on a Picnic? Make This Classic Muffuletta!
og:description: The classic New Orleans muffuletta is the most delicious picnic sandwich on the planet—the olive salad and the cold cuts between sesame-crusted bread taste even better the longer it sits.
Title: Classic Muffuletta
Author: Jyl Benson
Description:
Classic Muffuletta Recipe
Prep Time: 25 mins; Rest Time: 2 hrs; Total Time: 2 hrs 25 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 1 small anchovy fillet, packed in oil, Extra-virgin olive oil, for the marinade, 1 cup coarsely chopped pitted kalamata olives, 1 1/2 cups coarsely chopped pimento-stuffed green olives, 1/2 cup finely diced celery (from 1/2 stalk), 1/2 cup finely diced carrot (from 1 small carrot), 1/2 cup finely chopped cauliflower florets, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 2 tablespoons drained and chopped capers, 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar, plus more to taste, 2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh oregano, or 2 teaspoons dried oregano, 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more to taste, 1 (8- to 9-inch) round, seeded muffuletta loaf, 4 ounces thinly sliced salami, 4 ounces thinly sliced capicola, 4 ounces thinly sliced mortadella, 4 ounces thinly sliced mozzarella cheese, 4 ounces thinly sliced provolone cheese (not smoked)
Reviews: [{'name': 'Jack Kirchhoff', 'review': "I've made dozens of these over the years, usually with a bigger loaf and with a tapenade and sliced tomatoes, peppers and onions instead of the olive salad. And, not that it makes much difference, the recipe I started with called for friulano cheese instead of mozzarella.
