I've tried a lot of variations, including this recipe (pretty much), but in any case, the muffuletta is always excellent: hearty, flavourful and portable. (The recipe I first used says to leave the sandwich wrapped for 24 hours to let the flavours meld. Ha! We have never, not once, waited that long. Usually the whole sandwich is gone long before the 24 hours would be up.)"}, {'name': 'LanceRichardson', 'review': "This recipe is solid, but rather than fresh carrots, celery, and cauliflower, I recommend (and believe to be traditional) using pickled Italian giardiniare. Thinly-sliced green onions and fresh Italian parsley are good adds, as well. I've never added anchovy, but it sounds like a great idea. And DO NOT screw around with crappy olive oil. The good stuff (I like Frantoia) is worth the money! l don't hollow my bread, either, as the moisture in the olive salad needs plenty of bread to absorb it. Lastly, that's about double the cheese that I would ordinarily use. The biggest key is to chop the olive salad ingredients VERY coarsely. It's not a tapenade. My critique aside, this is a pretty good recipe that hits all the important notes."}, {'name': 'brushjl', 'review': "The intro says to bake it at 350° for 30 minutes, but that wasn't in the instructions. A shame, it would have been much more management but I only read the instructions. I used a ciabatta, but it wasn't the same. BTW, central grocery has been closed for three years, it's roof caved in."}]

og:title: Easy Whipped Ricotta Toast Is Creamy and Dreamy
og:description: When you whip ricotta, it magically becomes airier, creamier, and perfect for smearing on a sturdy slice of bread. A drizzle of lemony, thyme-y honey on top, and you’ll be spellbound!
Title: Easy Whipped Ricotta Toast
Author: Emily Weinberger
Description:
Easy Whipped Ricotta Toast Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 25 mins; Servings: 5 servings; Yield: 10 ricotta-topped toasts
Ingredients: 10 (1/2-inch) slices crusty sourdough bread , 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, plus more for bread, 1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt, Freshly ground black pepper, 15 ounces whole milk ricotta, Finely grated zest of 1 lemon, 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice, 1/3 cup honey, 1 teaspoon fresh thyme leaves, Flaky sea salt, for serving (optional)

og:title: This Easy Pork Bánh Mi Isn’t Flavor Shy
og:description: This version of the bánh mì stays true to the porky, fiery, and pickle-filled classic, all stacked between a crispy baguette. It’s perfect for cutting in half and sharing.
Title: Easy Pork Bánh Mì
Author: Cecilia Hae-Jin Lee
Description:
Easy Pork Bánh Mì Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 15 mins; Pickling Time: 30 mins; Total Time: 65 mins; Servings: 2 servings; Yield: 2 (6-inch) sandwiches
Ingredients: 1/4 cup white vinegar, 1/4 cup sugar, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 cup shredded carrots, 1/4 cup shredded daikon, 2 tablespoons minced lemongrass, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 shallot, minced, 1 tablespoon sugar, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 tablespoon fish sauce, 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 10 ounces pork tenderloin, thinly sliced, 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, 1 (12-inch) french baguette, 1/4 cup mayonnaise, Maggi Seasoning, to taste, 1/4 cup pâté (optional), 1 jalapeño, thinly sliced, 6 to 8 sprigs cilantro, tender stems intact
Reviews: [{'name': 'Air', 'review': 'Easy and delicious, thanks for sharing!'}, {'name': 'Cindy Rasmuson', 'review': 'Absolutely delicious. I didn’t change a thing, except I didn’t have jalapeño. It’s a very filling sandwich…'}, {'name': 'Lynn', 'review': 'Can’t wait to try this. It looks delicious! I love Banh Mi sandwiches….yum!'}]

og:title: These Peanut Buttery Sesame Noodles Are Magic
og:description: Make a big batch of these quick sesame peanut noodles and enjoy them cold for a easy dinner or lunch. It’s the best budget-friendly, make-ahead recipe.
Title: Sesame Peanut Noodles
Author: Hannah Zimmerman
Description:
Sesame Peanut Noodles Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 10 mins; Total Time: 20 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 8 ounces dry soba, rice, or egg noodles, 2 tablespoons toasted sesame oil, divided, 3 tablespoons natural peanut butter, 1/4 cup soy sauce, 1 1/2 tablespoons honey, 1 1/2 tablespoons rice vinegar, 1 clove garlic, grated, 1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds, for garnish (optional), 1 green onion, sliced, for garnish (optional)
Reviews: [{'name': 'Claudia G', 'review': 'I made this dish but turned out very salty. How do I undo and take away the salty taste.'}, {'name': 'Daffodil', 'review': 'Long thin strips of cucumber makes an excellent garnish.'}, {'name': 'Kaitlin', 'review': 'If you double the amount of sauce and add sriracha (if you like spice), it’s perfect! I make this all the time and it’s a huge hit.'}, {'name': 'allisonsaysthis', 'review': 'this was so salty! I basically ended up doubling everything else in the sauce to even out the flavor. if I made this again, I'd add the soy sauce a little at a time until it was seasoned correctly.'}, {'name': 'stewball', 'review': "Cold pasta doesn't do it for me. Can I eat them warmed up?\nCan i use ordinary peanut butter?"}]

og:title: Nothing Says Lunch Time Like a BLT Wrap!
og:description: Nothing says lunch like this BLT Wrap! Stuffed with crispy bacon, juicy tomatoes, and a tangy chive sauce, it's the perfect lunch for summer.
Title: BLT Wraps
Author: Nick Evans
Description:
BLT Wraps Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 20 mins; Total Time: 30 mins; Servings: 6 servings; Yield: 6 wraps
Ingredients: 1 pound bacon, 1 head butter lettuce, leaves roughly chopped, 3 small ripe tomatoes, sliced, 6 large burrito-size tortilla wraps, 1/2 cup mayo, 2 tablespoons thinly sliced fresh chives, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/8 teaspoon kosher salt
Reviews: [{'name': 'C R', 'review': 'Super easy and delicious!'}]

og:title: Go Meatless for a Night With Roasted Cabbage Steaks with Garlic Breadcrumbs
og:description: The perfect crisp-tender and tasty vegetarian fare. Top it with crunchy garlic breadcrumbs for a satisfying weeknight meal.
Title: Roasted Cabbage Steaks with Garlic Breadcrumbs
Author: Laurel Randolph
Description:
Roasted Cabbage Steaks with Garlic Breadcrumbs Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 25 mins; Total Time: 35 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 1 (2- to 3- pound) green cabbage, 2 1/2 tablespoons olive oil, divided, 2 teaspoons soy sauce, 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice, 1 teaspoon smoked paprika, 1/2 teaspoon honey, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, divided, 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 1 clove garlic, minced, 1/2 cup panko breadcrumbs, 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional), 2 tablespoons fresh parsley, finely chopped

og:title: Your Lunch Awaits: Farro, Mushroom, and Egg Grain Bowls
og:description: These farro, mushroom, and egg grain bowls are just what you need for a hearty and flavorful lunch during the work week.
Title: Farro, Mushroom, and Egg Grain Bowls
Author: Karishma Pradhan
Description:
Farro, Mushroom, and Egg Grain Bowls Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 55 mins; Total Time: 70 mins; Servings: 4 servings
Ingredients: 3 cups vegetable broth, plus more if needed, 1 cup semi-pearled farro (See Recipe Note), 1 tablespoon canola oil, 8 ounces cremini mushrooms, cleaned, thinly sliced, and divided, 3/4 teaspoon salt, divided, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper, divided, 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, 1 medium onion, finely diced, 4 cloves garlic, finely minced, 1 cup full-fat Greek yogurt, 1/2 cup flat-leaf parsley, finely minced, 1 small garlic clove, grated or finely minced, 3 tablespoons water, Salt, to taste, Black pepper, to taste, 4 large eggs, 4 teaspoons extra-virgin olive oil, Salt, to taste, Black pepper, to taste
Reviews: [{'name': 'Helen Miller', 'review': 'Delicious!'}, {'name': 'Toni', 'review': 'Could you swap yogurt for cottage cheese to up the protein a titch...and maybe add a second egg ? This sounds tasty. \nIs barely similar to farro ... love it & have never tried the other.'}]

og:title: This Spicy Coconut Ginger Omelette is a Lunchbox Dream
og:description: Eggs make for a quick and easy weeknight dinner and this spicy Kerala coconut ginger omelette is anything but tired and boring.
Title: Motta Porrichu (Spicy Coconut Ginger Omelette)
Author: Dalia David
Description:
Motta Porrichu (Spicy Coconut Ginger Omelette) Recipe
Prep Time: 12 mins; Cook Time: 13 mins; Total Time: 25 mins; Servings: 2 servings
Ingredients: 4 large eggs, 1/3 cup coconut cream (see Recipe Note), 1 small red onion, diced (about 1 1/2 cups), 2 tablespoons grated fresh ginger, 2 tablespoons roughly chopped fresh curry leaves, 1 green bird's eye chili, finely chopped, 1 1/2 teaspoons pink salt or 1/2 teaspoon table salt, 1 1/2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper, 1 1/2 tablespoons virgin coconut oil, Matta rice, for serving (optional)

og:title: Impress Everyone By Making Homemade Potato Knishes
og:description: Nothing beats a classic potato knish. Make your own at home with this recipe, complete with jammy onions and flaky crust. Serve as a side dish, appetizer, or snack with deli mustard.
Title: Potato Knishes
Author: Micah Siva, RD
Description:
Potato Knishes Recipe
Prep Time: 40 mins; Cook Time: 90 mins; Total Time: 2 hrs 10 mins; Servings: 12 servings; Yield: 12 knishes
Ingredients: 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 cup water, 1/2 cup neutral oil (like vegetable or canola), 1 large egg, whisked, 1 teaspoon white vinegar, 3 tablespoons olive oil, 1 medium yellow onion, chopped, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper, 1 pound russet potatoes, peeled and quartered, 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, 1 large egg, whisked, 1 tablespoon water, Mustard, for serving

og:title: A Better Lunch Is Only a Chicken Caesar Wrap Away
og:description: These chicken Caesar wraps are sure to become a lunch favorite! Here's the easiest way to assemble them, plus some fun variations to try.
Title: Chicken Caesar Wrap
Author: Devan Grimsrud
Description:
Chicken Caesar Wrap Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Total Time: 20 mins; Servings: 4 servings; Yield: 4 wraps
Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups chopped cooked chicken, 2 cups chopped romaine lettuce, 1/3 cup Caesar dressing, 1/4 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese, 1/2 cup croutons, Salt, to taste, Black pepper, to taste, 4 large (10-inch) flour tortillas
Reviews: [{'name': 'Gracie', 'review': 'Made this recipe tonight…so good! The dressing is delicious, I subbed in mayo for eggs & Worcestershire sauce for anchovy. And the chicken!!! 🤌'}, {'name': 'Brkgeusjcn', 'review': 'So good'}]

og:title: TikTok's "Egg Tortilla" Is Actually Delicious (It's So Crispy!)
og:description: These crispy fried egg tacos are all over TikTok right now. Made with corn tortilla, eggs, and a variety of toppings, it's a breakfast recipe you'll want to make on repeat.
Title: Fried Egg Taco
Author: Nick Evans
Description:
Fried Egg Taco Recipe
Prep Time: 2 mins; Cook Time: 8 mins; Total Time: 10 mins; Serving: 1 serving
Ingredients: 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, 2 (6-inch) corn tortillas, 2 large eggs, 1/4 cup cheddar cheese, grated, Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste, 2 tablespoons salsa, for garnish, 1/2 avocado, thinly sliced, for garnish, Cilantro leaves, for garnish
Reviews: [{'name': 'TacoTuesday', 'review': "Whatever you want to call this thing, it's great! Fun to make and eat."}, {'name': 'Avery', 'review': 'I’m dying laughing right now. I’ve been making huevos rancheros in much the same way for years, after ordering them the same way for years at the cafeteria at work (the Thursday breakfast special.) Oil a corn tortilla on both sides, cook on one until slightly crisp, then turn and coat with refried beans and cheese. Crack an egg and cook to your preference, then place on the beans and cheese and top with salsa of your choice.\n\nAnd as another commenter pointed out, this is more of a tostada rather than a taco.'}, {'name': 'Flor Filosa', 'review': 'It looks really delish but it’s a tostada not a taco. Silly TikTok.'}]

og:title: Chopped Italian Salad Will Be a Weeknight Favorite
og:description: Classic chopped Italian salad with pickled vegetables, cured meats, and cheeses is dinner or a starter for pasta or pizza.
Title: Classic Chopped Italian Salad
Author: Nick Evans
Description:
Classic Chopped Italian Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 25 mins; Total Time: 25 mins; Servings: 6 servings
Ingredients: 1 lemon, juiced, 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard, 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar, 2 teaspoons sugar, 1 teaspoon dried oregano, 1/2 cup olive oil, 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, 2 heads romaine lettuce, chopped, 1/2 red onion, chopped, 1 (15-ounce) can chickpeas, rinsed and drained, 1 pint cherry tomatoes, halved, 4 ounces genoa salami, chopped, 8 ounces fresh mozzarella, chopped, 1/2 cup sliced pepperoncini, 1/4 cup sliced roasted red peppers, 10 fresh basil leaves, chopped

og:title: The Air Fryer Is the Secret to Crispy-Skinned, Fluffy Baked Potatoes
og:description: For a baked potato with the crispiest skin and a light and fluffy interior, don’t turn on the oven. Use the air fryer instead!
Title: Air Fryer Baked Potatoes
Author: Kayla Hoang
Description:
Air Fryer Baked Potatoes Recipe
Prep Time: 3 mins; Cook Time: 40 mins; Total Time: 43 mins; Servings: 4 servings; Yield: 4 medium baked potatoes
Ingredients: 4 medium to medium-large russet potatoes (about 10 ounces each), 1 tablespoon olive oil, divided , 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, divided, plus more for serving, Freshly ground black pepper, unsalted butter, shredded sharp cheddar, sour cream, and/or scallions, for serving (as desired)
Reviews: [{'name': 'Sher', 'review': 'Not Crispy. Followed air fry directions. I have an oven air fryer, maybe makes difference? I think using no oil might be better.'}, {'name': 'steven wiser', 'review': 'This was perfect, I even forgot to poke holes!'}, {'name': 'Bonnie Stenoien Peterson', 'review': 'Will try this😊'}]

og:title: Classic Kimbap—Our Favorite Packed Lunch
og:description: Here’s a step-by-step guide on how to make a classic Korean kimbap with seasoned rice, beef, and lots of vegetables.
Title: Classic Kimbap (Korean Seaweed Rice Roll)
Author: Cynthia Christensen
Description:
Classic Kimbap (Korean Seaweed Rice Roll) Recipe
Prep Time: 40 mins; Cook Time: 5 mins; Total Time: 45 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings; Yield: 6 rolls
Ingredients: 6 ounces skirt steak or sirloin beef, cut into 3 x 1/4-inch strips, 2 teaspoons soy sauce, 1 teaspoon rice vinegar, 1 teaspoon sugar, 1 clove garlic, grated, 1 teaspoon vegetable oil, 4 cups freshly cooked medium-grain white rice, 2 teaspoons sesame oil, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, 8 ounces spinach leaves, washed, 2 teaspoons sesame oil, 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, 1 teaspoon vegetable oil, 1 large carrot, peeled and cut into 1/8-inch-wide matchsticks, Pinch kosher salt, 6 (1/4-inch wide) strips danmuji (yellow pickled radish), 6 (about 8 x 8-inch) sheets gim (roasted seaweed), Sesame oil, for brushing the kimbap
Reviews: [{'name': 'Maddy B', 'review': 'I added way too much sesame oil to my rice but my gimbap came out very well for my first time, I was super impressed with myself. Will make it again, love my Korean dishes. Thank you for the very helpful and easy recipe 😋'}, {'name': 'Munni P', 'review': 'Everything tasted great! Textures were great, and everything worked well together!'}]

og:title: Serve Menemen (Turkish Scrambled Eggs) for Breakfast, Lunch, or Dinner
og:description: Transport yourself to the cafes of Istanbul with menemen. This delicious, quick, and easy scrambled eggs with tomatoes recipe can be served for breakfast, lunch, or dinner.
Title: Menemen (Turkish Scrambled Eggs and Tomatoes)
Author: Mersedeh Prewer
Description:
Menemen (Turkish Scrambled Eggs and Tomatoes)
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 25 mins; Total Time: 40 mins; Servings: 4
to 6 servings
Ingredients: 2 beefsteak tomatoes, 8 large eggs, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 large yellow onion, finely diced, 1 teaspoon salt, 3 cloves garlic, minced or crushed, 6 sivri biber (Turkish green peppers), seeded and finely diced, 1 tablespoon tatli biber salçasi (Turkish sweet pepper paste), 1 teaspoon pul biber (ground Aleppo pepper), 1 teaspoon dried oregano, 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 teaspoon pul biber, 1/4 bunch fresh parsley, leaves coarsely chopped

og:title: The 10-Minute Meal I Make Every Single Week
og:description: I make this curried chickpea salad at least once a week. And for good reason—it takes just 10 minutes to make, there’s no cooking involved, and it’s delicious as a sandwich, in a salad, and more.
Title: The 10-Minute Meal I Make Every Single Week
Author: Alexandra Shytsman
Description: Curried Chickpea Salad Recipe (10 Minutes, No Cook)
Ingredients: 2 (15-ounce) cans of chickpeas, 1/4 cup finely diced shallot or red onion (about 1 small shallot), 1/3 cup mayonnaise, 1/4 cup golden raisins, 1 tablespoon Dijon or brown mustard, 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice, 2 teaspoons yellow curry powder, Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

og:title: The 4-Ingredient Lunch I Make for My Kids Every Morning
og:description: These “nacho bites” are perfect for kids' lunchboxes and allow them to assemble their own meal from classic taco components. The recipe needs just four ingredients and is endlessly riffable to use up leftovers or incorporate kids’ favorite taco toppings.
Title: The 4-Ingredient Lunch I Make for My Kids Every Morning
Author: Kris Osborne
Description: Nacho Bites Recipe (4 Ingredients)
Ingredients: 1 (16-ounce) can pinto or black beans, drained, rinsed, and seasoned, if desired, 1 (15.25-ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained and rinsed, 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese, Optional add-ins: chopped tomatoes, sour cream or, Greek yogurt, , sliced green onions, sliced black olives, cilantro leaves, salsa or, pico de gallo, , and/or, guacamole, Large tortilla chips

og:title: The 15-Minute Mediterranean-Inspired Meal I Make Once a Week
og:description: These open-face tuna Niçoise melts are a fresher, brighter, Mediterranean-inspired take on tuna salad. The recipe needs just five ingredients and is quick and easy to make for lunch.
Title: The 15-Minute Mediterranean-Inspired Meal I Make Once a Week
Author: Ivy Manning
Description: Tuna Niçoise Melt Recipe (5 Ingredients, 15 Minutes)
Ingredients: 2 (3/4-inch-thick) slices country-style sourdough bread, 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil, 1 (5-ounce) can albacore tuna, drained, 1/2 cup cherry tomatoes, halved, 1/4 cup Niçoise or kalamata olives, pitted and torn in half, 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 1/2 cup shredded Gruyère or Swiss cheese, 4 large basil leaves, finely sliced, optional

og:title: The No-Cook Meal I'm Eating All Summer Long
og:description: I come back to this simple but satisfying meal time and time again, all summer long. The quick and easy take on a Greek salad is all I want to eat when the weather heats up.
Title: The No-Cook Meal I'm Making All Summer—It's So Easy
Author: Julie & Amy Luxemberg
Description: The No-Cook Meal I'm Making All Summer—It's So Easy
Ingredients: 1 (15.5-ounce) can chickpeas, drained and rinsed, 1/2 pint cherry tomatoes, chopped, 1/4 small red onion, chopped, 1/4 English cucumber, chopped, 1/2 cup crumbled feta, 1 cup arugula, chopped, 8 ounces store-bought tzatziki, 2 to 3 pita pockets, sliced in half

og:title: My All-Time Favorite Lunch Is Ready in 15 Minutes
og:description: This recipe for lemon-caper tuna melt toasts is a quick and easy lunch or light dinner you can make in just 15 minutes. The tuna filling is mayo-free and features bright lemon, briny capers, and punchy Dijon mustard, all blanketed in gooey, melty cheese.
Title: My All-Time Favorite Lunch Is Ready in 15 Minutes
Author: Sheela Prakash
Description: Lemon-Caper Tuna Melt Toasts Recipe (15 Minutes)
Ingredients: 1 (5 to 7-ounce) jar or can oil-packed tuna, 1 small lemon, 1 tablespoon rinsed and drained capers, 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard, 2 slices crusty bread, such as sourdough, 3/4 cup shredded Gruyère or cheddar cheese, Freshly ground black pepper, for serving

og:title: The Perfect Pasta Salad Begins With Tortellini
og:description: You'll want to make a double batch of this tortellini salad—it tastes even better the next day and it's the perfect packed lunch for school or work.
Title: Tortellini Salad
Author: Sharon Lehman, RD
Description:
Tortellini Salad Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 5 mins; Total Time: 25 mins; Servings: 6
to 8 servings; Yield: 13 cups
Ingredients: 1/3 cup extra virgin olive oil, 4 tablespoons fresh lemon juice (from about 2 lemons), 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar, 2 cloves garlic, grated, 1 teaspoon dried oregano, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 1 small red onion, finely chopped (about 1 cup), 2 (10-ounce) packages tortellini (any kind), 1 small yellow bell pepper, chopped (about 1 cup), 1 English cucumber, quartered lengthwise and thinly sliced (about 3 cups), 3/4 cup pitted and sliced kalamata olives, 1 (14-ounce) can artichoke hearts, drained and roughly chopped, 8 ounces turkey summer sausage, quartered lengthwise and sliced (about 2 cups), 6 ounces crumbled feta cheese, 1/2 cup finely chopped fresh basil leaves
Reviews: [{'name': 'brushjl', 'review': 'Incredible! Fantastic flavor, texture and crunch. Just delicious.'}]

og:title: Mercimek Çorbası (Turkish Lentil Soup) Is All About the Garnishes
og:description: Serve comforting and classic mercimek çorbasi, Turkish lentil soup, with plenty of flavorful garnishes.
Title: Mercimek Çorbası (Turkish Lentil Soup)
Author: Mersedeh Prewer
Description:
Mercimek Çorbası (Turkish Lentil Soup) Recipe
Prep Time: 15 mins; Cook Time: 35 mins; Total Time: 50 mins; Servings: 6 servings
Ingredients: 3 tablespoons olive oil, 1 large yellow onion, finely diced (about 1 1/4 cups), 1 celery rib, finely diced, 1 carrot, finely diced, 4 cloves garlic, minced or crushed, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1 teaspoon dried oregano, 2 tablespoons tatli biber salçasi (Turkish sweet pepper paste), 1 1/2 cups (8.8oz/250g) dried red lentils, 2 liters (8 1/2 cups) vegetable stock, 1 to 2 lemons, juiced, to taste, 1 teaspoon salt, or to taste, 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, or to taste, 1/3 cup butter, 2 teaspoons olive oil, 2 teaspoons pul biber, plus extra to sprinkle on top, 6 tablespoons Greek yogurt, 6 heaping tablespoons croutons, 1/4 bunch fresh parsley, finely chopped
Reviews: [{'name': 'cf86713', 'review': 'Can you make this in a crockpot?'}, {'name': 'brushjl', 'review': 'Fabulous, I almost bought a ticket to Istanbul. One of my favorite soups.and this is an excellent version.'}, {'name': 'David Barry', 'review': 'Delicious soup. I substituted the pepper paste with tomato paste and cilantro for the parsley since I had it. Very yummy and just as good later in the week.'}, {'name': 'Dan S', 'review': "Such a flavorful and easy soup! And a gorgeous color. Don't skip the drizzle—I want to put it on everything."}, {'name': 'Nina Gasparelli', 'review': 'I made this today and it was very yummy. It wasn’t as creamy as yours, but I may not have blended it enough with my immersion blender. I let the leftover soup cool and blended it really well in my blender before storing it. It was my first time using the sweet pepper paste. I served the soup with Gozleme picked up at the market where I bought the paste. It was my first time trying that, too, and it was a perfect side dish.'}]

og:title: Fall In Love With This Easy Marry Me Chicken Salad
og:description: This quick and easy, no-cook recipe for Marry Me chicken salad is a riff on the internet-famous recipe “Marry Me Chicken.” It features a creamy, cheesy sauce to coat shredded chicken and gets a boost from floral herbs and bright and tangy sun-dried tomatoes for the dish’s signature flavors.
Title: Fall In Love With This Easy Marry Me Chicken Salad
Author: Marianne Williams and Afton Cyrus
Description:
Marry Me Chicken Salad Recipe (No-Cook, 15 Minutes)
Prep Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 15 mins; Servings: 6 servings
Ingredients: 1 cup mayonnaise, 1 1/2 tablespoons Dijon mustard, 1 tablespoon sherry vinegar or red wine vinegar, optional, 2 teaspoons garlic powder, 2 teaspoons dried basil or oregano, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more to taste, 3/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 1 (7-ounce) jar sliced sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil, 3 cups (about 1 pound) shredded cooked chicken, 3/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 1 large shallot, finely chopped, Fresh basil leaves, optional
Reviews: [{'name': 'Julia L', 'review': 'Incredibly flavorful and so good, the marry-me flavors translated so well into a chicken salad.'}]

og:title: The 15-Minute Lunch I Make When I’m Too Tired to Cook
og:description: This quick and easy recipe for peanut butter noodles needs just four ingredients and comes together in 15 minutes. Any noodle of your choice is coated in a creamy, salty, just-slightly-spicy no-cook peanut sauce for a satisfying lunch or light dinner.
Title: The 15-Minute Lunch I Make When I’m Too Tired to Cook
Author: Coco Morante
Description: Quick and Easy Peanut Butter Noodles Recipe (4 Ingredients, 15 Minutes)
Ingredients: Salt, for the pasta water, 1 pound spaghetti, linguine, or any other long noodles, Generous 1/3 cup no-stir creamy peanut butter, 1/4 cup sweet Thai chili sauce, plus more to taste, 2 tablespoons soy sauce, plus more to taste, 1/4 cup boiling water, Optional toppings: sliced green onions, chopped cilantro, and/or, toasted sesame seeds

og:title: The 4-Ingredient Chicken Salad I Can’t Stop Making
og:description: Give your chicken salad some real oomph by adding gochujang, a Korean pepper paste. This recipe takes just four ingredients and five minutes to whip up.
Title: The 4-Ingredient Chicken Salad I Can’t Stop Making
Author: Coco Morante
Description: 4-Ingredient Chicken Salad Recipe (5 Minutes)
Ingredients: 1/4 cup mayonnaise, 2 tablespoons gochujang, 1/2 teaspoon toasted sesame oil, 10 to 12 ounces (about 2 cups tightly packed) diced or shredded cooked chicken breast, Optional garnishes: 1 green onion, sliced, and 1/2 teaspoon toasted sesame seeds

og:title: These Bread and Butter Pickles Are Crunchy, Sweet Perfection
og:description: Turn fresh cucumbers into sweet bread and butter pickles to can or keep in fridge.
Title: Bread and Butter Pickles
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Bread and Butter Pickles Recipe
Prep Time: 20 mins; Cook Time: 30 mins; Salting and Chilling Cucumbers: 4 hrs; Total Time: 4 hrs 50 mins; Servings: 24 servings; Yield: 3
to 5 Pints
Ingredients: 2 1/2 pounds pickling cucumbers, fresh from the market, 1/4 cup pickling salt (see recipe note), 1 pound white or yellow onions, thinly sliced, 1 1/4 cups white distilled vinegar (5% acidity), 1 cup apple cider vinegar (5% acidity), 2 1/4 cups sugar, 1 tablespoon mustard seeds, 1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes, 3/4 teaspoon celery seeds, 1 inch cinnamon stick, 6 allspice berries plus a pinch of ground allspice, 6 whole cloves plus a pinch of ground cloves, 1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric
Reviews:
[{'name': 'Donna Thomason', 'review': 'Can you cut cucumbers in spears for this recipe?'}, {'name': 'John', 'review': 'Why are my pickles soft?'}, {'name': 'Karan', 'review': 'OOk, I am a new canner. I learned to can tomatoes four years ago. Have canned tomatoes ever since. Froze okra and squash. But pickles are my new addition. I am thrilled I found this recipe. I canned pickles with no problems at all! And they smelled heavenly. Can't wait til they cure out to eat them. Thanks a million!'}, {'name': 'Scott Achey', 'review': 'I love this recipe but I also add pickle crisp. The pickles don't get as mushy. Just made my first batch of the season. Many more to come.'}, {'name': 'Glenda Dunn', 'review': 'I'm soooo excited; finally found a pickle recipe I can make that is delicious! 
Especially like the tip about putting the jars filled with water in the warm water before filling. Also putting the ice on the sliced pickles, etc. for 4 hours. We have an abundance of cucumbers in our home garden this year so expect to make a few jars of pickles.
 Thank you for sharing.
 Glenda'}]

og:title: Skip the Blue Box and Make Homemade Macaroni and Cheese Mix
og:description: A good-quality cheese powder is the key to this wholesome and super duper easy homemade macaroni and cheese mix. It’s better than the box!
Title: Homemade Macaroni and Cheese Mix
Author: Sara Bir
Description:
DIY Macaroni and Cheese Mix Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 20 mins; Total Time: 25 mins; Servings: 2 1/2 servings (according to a typical box of mac and cheese mix)
Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups (6 ounces/170g) dry macaroni, shells, or other smaller pasta shape, 3 tablespoons (20g) cheddar cheese powder, orange or white, 1/2 teaspoon tapioca starch, optional, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 3 tablespoons milk, any kind, 1 to 2 tablespoons butter (if using salted, reduce the salt a bit)
Reviews: [{'name': 'Kiki', 'review': 'I followed the recipe faithfully the first time I made it and I liked it; however, I also appreciated the notes on how exactly adjusting the amounts of butter, tapioca starch, and milk (or using milk substitutes such as yogurt) would affect the results. This information allowed me to get the macaroni just how I like it - almost gooey. Recently, I tried it with bigger macaroni (mentioned above), and while the sauce was exactly right, there wasn\'t enough of it. So I upped the cheese powder to 1/4c (4T), the tapioca starch to 3/4 tsp, and used 1 or 2 T of yogurt, whisking the milk (about 1/4 c) in at the end until it was the desired consistency. For bigger macaroni that might be harder to coat, this gives a nice amount of sauce.\nI double this recipe tonight when 2 very picky nephews came over (kids who don\'t even like fruit) (!!!), and they gave it rave reviews, requesting seconds, and calling it "even better than the box." Winner winner cheesy dinner! This is a keeper for sure.'}]

og:title: Tortilla Española Is a Classic Spanish Tapa You Can Make at Home
og:description: This classic Spanish tortilla recipe (tortilla Española) is an omelette featuring sliced fried potatoes, onion, and eggs cooked in olive oil.
Title: Tortilla Española (Spanish Tortilla)
Author: Elise Bauer
Description:
Tortilla Española Recipe (Spanish Tortilla Recipe
Prep Time: 5 mins; Cook Time: 25 mins; Total Time: 30 mins; Servings: 2
to 4 servings
Ingredients: 6 eggs, beaten, 2 Yukon Gold potatoes, 2 to 3 green onions, chopped up to the light green parts, or 1/4 cup chopped yellow onion, 1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil, Salt
Reviews: [{'name': 'Ksenia', 'review': 'I’m Spanish. The potatoes must be peeled and cut into small squares, you put them in the pan to fry. In the meantime, open the eggs and with a fork shake them until they turn completely orange and become liquid. You put the eggs in the fry. Later on flip it. And that’s it. But it should not look like that. At least not the potatoe.'}, {'name': 'AmazingGracie', 'review': 'I wonder if one can make this even more simply by using "thick" sliced potato chips!'}, {'name': 'Patricia', 'review': 'En España no usan el horno para La Tortilla! Es una tradición “dar la vuelta” la tortilla en la sartén.'}, {'name': 'JIWA', 'review': 'I have been making a version of this for decades. Didn\'t know the history of the dish. I am from Canada and grew up in So California. Instead of frying the potatoes, I toss in a mix of olive oil salt and seasonings (varies: parsley, tarragon, Italian herbs, or even zatar) line on a baking sheet and bake until done and browned. I then saute the onions, layer on the potatoes, and yes sometimes some cooked mushrooms as well, then pour over the egg mixture and bake. Recently, as I no longer have a regular oven, but a toaster oven that is not big enough to hold a frying pan, I have been baking in a greased 8x8x2" pan. So Good.'}, {'name': 'Tak Templin', 'review': 'Every Tapas bars I went in Barcelona displayed\nown signature potato tortillas on a counter.\nMost of them were simple potato and egg combination with some onions. I love all types of mushrooms, and I make mine layering varieties of sautéed mushrooms and onions between potatos. It is so very good.'}]

og:title: Jalapeño Poppers: The Grilled Cheese Sandwich Edition
og:description: Jalapeño poppers meet a grilled cheese sandwich in this punchy version of the All-American classic. Gooey, crispy and spicy, this jalapeño popper grilled cheese is a flavor bomb.
Title: Jalapeño Popper Grilled Cheese Sandwich
Author: Maria J. Ritchie
Description:
Jalapeño Popper Grilled Cheese Sandwich Recipe
Prep Time: 10 mins; Cook Time: 15 mins; Total Time: 25 mins; Servings: 2
to 4 servings; Yield: 2 sandwiches
Ingredients: 6 strips bacon, 6 tablespoons garlic and herb cream cheese, softened, 2 ounces freshly grated Cheddar cheese, 2 ounces freshly grated Monterey Jack, 2 to 4 tablespoons pickled jalapeños, finely chopped, or to taste, 1/2 teaspoon cumin, optional, 4 slices sourdough bread, 1 to 2 tablespoons butter, 2 tablespoons finely grated Parmesan, optional
Reviews: [{'name': 'brushjl', 'review': 'Fantastic sandwich. I loved the pickled jalapeños.'}, {'name': 'Renee', 'review': "Grilled is my families Sunday Brunch meal after church. I can't wait to try this recipe this weekend. We also love jalapeno poppers. I will report back.."}]
